1st row: (RS). (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc – shell made) in 5th ch from hook. *Miss next 2 ch. Shell in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. Miss next ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 8 shells.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. *Shell in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * across ending with 2 dc in 3rd ch of turning ch. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 4. 1 dc in first dc. *Shell in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * across ending with shell in 3rd ch of turning ch. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. *Shell in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * across, ending with shell in 4th ch of turning ch and 1 dc in 3rd ch of turning ch. Turn. 10 shells.
5th row: Ch 3. *Shell in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * across ending with 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 6½ ins [16.5 cm], ending with RS facing for next row.
Shape neck: 1st row: (RS). (Shell in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. 1 dc in first dc of next shell. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first ch 1 sp. (Shell in next ch 1 sp) twice. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. (Shell in next ch 1 sp) twice. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next dc. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – dc2tog made. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in dc2tog. (Shell in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. (Shell in next ch-1 sp) twice. Dc2tog over next st and top of turning ch. Turn.
6th to 8th rows: Ch 3. (Shell in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
9th row: Ch 3. (1 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Fasten off.
With RS of work facing, miss next ch-1 sp and dc of shell last worked. Miss next 2 shells. Miss next dc and ch-1 sp of next shell. Join MC with sl st to next dc of same shell. 
1st row: Ch 3. (Shell in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. (Shell in next ch-1 sp) twice. 2 dc in next ch 1 sp. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. Miss first st. Dc2tog over next 2 sts. (Shell in next ch 1 sp) twice. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. (Shell in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in next dc2tog. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. Miss first 2 sts. (Shell in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
6th to 8th rows: Ch 3. (Shell in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
9th row: Ch 3. (1 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Fasten off.
Edging: Join A with sl st to top left corner of neck edge. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 1 row sc evenly around all edges. Join with sl st to first sc. Ch 5 for button loop. Join with sl st to next sc. Fasten off. Sew button in position.
FLOWER (make 3)
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: (Ch 3. 1 dc. Ch 3. Sl st) all in same sp as last sl st. *(Sl st. Ch 3. 1 dc. Ch 3. Sl st) all in next sc. Rep from * around. Fasten off. Sew Flowers to Bib as shown in picture.
BOOTIES
Sole: With MC, ch 10.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 7 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working along opposite side of ch, work 1 sc in each rem loop of next 7 sts. 2 sc in next loop. Join with sl st to first st. 20 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. 3 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. 3 sc in last st. Join with sl st to first st. 24 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. 3 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. 3 sc in next st. 1 sc in last st. Join with sl st to first st. 28 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. 3 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 13 sts. 3 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Join A with sl st to first st. 32 sts.
5th rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in back loop only of each st, work 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first st.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st) 3 times. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 35 sts.
7th and 8th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.
Upper: 1st row: With RS of work facing, miss first 6 sts of last rnd. Join A with sl st to next st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 5 sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 3 sts. Fasten off leaving a 6 ins [15 cm] end. Thread end through tapestry needle and sew seam at center of upper.
Ankle Strap: Left Foot: With A, ch 13. With RS of work facing, work 1 sc in each of center 5 sc at back of heel. Turn.
Next row: Ch 7. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch or sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off. Join A with sl st at opposite side of strap at top corner. Ch 3 for button loop. Join with sl st to foundation ch. Fasten off.
Ankle Strap: Right Foot: With A, ch 6. With RS of work facing, work 1 sc in each of center 5 sc at back of heel. Turn.
Next row: Ch 14. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch or sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc or ch-1 sp to end of row. Ch 3 for button loop. Join with sl st to foundation ch. Fasten off.
Flower: With MC, make 2 as given for Bib. Sew 1 Flower to each Bootie as illustrated.
Sew buttons to correspond to button loops.

pattern_name: BERNAT BABY COORDINATES BABY JACKET AND BLANKET
materials: Bernat® Baby Coordinates (170 g/6 oz) Main Color (MC): (White) 1 (1-1) ball
Bernat® Baby Coordinates (160 g/5.6 oz) Main Color (MC): (White) 2 balls
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Length of ½ inch [1.5 cm] wide ribbon.
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Jacket sizes: 6 mos 17 ins [43 cm], 12-18 mos 18-19 ins [45.5-48 ins], 2 yrs 21 ins [53.5 ins]. Finished chest measurements: 6 mos 19 ins [48 cm], 12-18 mos 21 ins [53.5 ins], 2 yrs 23 ins [58.5 ins]. Blanket: Approx 34 ins [86.5 cm] wide x 39 ins [99 cm] long.
gauge: Jacket: 6 V sts and 7 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] in pat. Blanket: 5½ V sts and 7 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Jacket
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ).
Note: Jacket is worked in one piece from neck edge down.
Beg at neck edge, with A, ch 52 (58-64) loosely.
1st row: (RS). (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) – V st made, in 5th ch from hook. *Miss next ch. V st in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. Miss next ch. 1 dc in last ch. 23 (26-29) V sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *V st in ch-1 sp of next V st. Rep from * across, ending with 1 dc in 4th ch of turning ch. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). V st in ch-1 sp of next V st. V st in sp between 2 V sts. *(V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) 3 (3-4) times. V st in sp between 2 V sts. (V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) 3 (4-4) times. V st in sp between 2 V sts. Rep from * twice more. (V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) 2 (3-3) times. V st in sp between 2 V sts. V st in ch-1 sp of last V st. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Break A. Join MC. Turn. 31 (34-37) V sts.
4th row: With MC, ch 3 (counts as dc). *V st in ch-1 sp of next V st. Rep from * across, ending with 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) twice. V st in sp between 2 V sts. *(V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) 4 (4-5) times. V st in sp between 2 V sts. (V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) 4 (5-5) times. V st in sp between 2 V sts. Rep from * twice more. (V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) 3 times. V st in sp between 2 V sts. (V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) twice. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn. 39 (42-45) V sts.
6th and 7th rows: As 4th row.
8th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) 3 times. V st in sp between 2 V sts. *(V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) 5 (5-6) times. V st in sp between 2 V sts. (V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) 5 (6-6) times. V st in sp between 2 V sts. Rep from * twice more. (V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) 3 times. V st in sp between 2 V sts. (V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) 3 times. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn. 47 (50-53) V sts.
Sizes 12-18 mos and 2 yrs only: 9th and 10th rows: As 4th row.
All sizes: Divide for Body: With separate length of MC and RS facing, join yarn with sl st in sp between 6th (7th-8th) V st and 7th (8th-9th) V st from left front edge. Ch 5. Miss next 11 V sts (left sleeve). Join with sl st in sp between last V st and next V st. Fasten off.
Miss center 13 (14-15) V sts (back). With separate length of MC and RS facing, join yarn with sl st in sp between last V st and next. Ch 5. Miss next 11 V sts (right sleeve). Join with sl st in sp between last V st and next V st. Fasten off.
Next row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). (V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) 6 (7-8) times (left front). (Miss next ch. V st in next ch) twice. Miss next ch. (V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) 13 (14 -15) times (back). (Miss next ch. V st in next ch) twice. Miss next ch. (V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) 6 (7-8) times (right front). 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn. 29 (32-35) V sts.
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *V st in ch-1 sp of next V st. Rep from * across, ending with 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 8 (9½ -10½ ) ins [20.5 (24 -26.5) cm], ending with a RS row. Fasten off.
Note: Sleeves are worked in rnds, but turn at end of each rnd to match fabric of body.
Left Sleeve: 1st rnd: With RS facing, join MC with sl st in first ch of ch 5. Ch 3. (V st in next ch. Miss next ch.) twice. (V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) 11 times. Join with sl st in top of ch 3. Turn. 13 V sts.
**2nd rnd: Ch 3. *V st in ch-1 sp of next V st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in top of ch 3. Turn.
Size 6 mos only: 3rd rnd: Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up a loop in ch-1 sp of next V st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook. Ch 1. 1 dc in same sp– V st dec made. *V st in ch-1 sp of next V st. Rep from * to last 2 V sts. V st dec over last 2 V sts. Join with sl st in top of ch 3. Turn. 11 V sts.
All sizes: Rep 2nd rnd until Sleeve from joining rnd measures 4 (5-6) ins [10 (12.5-15) cm]. Fasten off.

Edging: 1st rnd: With RS of work facing, join A with sl st in top of ch 3. Ch 3. *V st in ch-1 sp of next V st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in top of ch 3. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: With RS of work facing, join MC with sl st in top of ch 3. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *Ch 2. 1 sc in ch-1 sp of next V st. Rep from * around, ending with ch 2. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Right Sleeve: 1st rnd: With RS of work facing, join MC with sl st in last ch of ch 5. Ch 3. (V st in ch-1 sp of next V st) 11 times. (Miss next ch. V st in next ch) twice. Join with sl st in top of ch 3. Turn. 13 V sts.
Work from ** to ** as given for Left Sleeve.

Jacket Edging: With RS facing, join A with sl st in top corner of left front neck edge. Ch 1. Work 39 (45 -51) sc evenly down left front edge to corner. Fasten off.
With RS facing, join A with sl st in bottom corner of right front. Ch 1. Work 39 (45-51) sc evenly up right front edge to corner of neck edge. Fasten off.

1st row: With RS of work facing, join A with sl st in first sc at neck edge of left front. Ch 3. Miss next sc. *V st in next sc. Miss next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 V sts in last sc for corner. V st in ch-1 sp of each V st across lower edge. 2 V st in first sc for corner. **Miss next 2 sc. V st in next sc. Rep from ** to last 2 sc. Miss next sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. *V st in ch-1 sp of next V st*. Rep from * to * 2 corner V sts. V st in ch-1 sp of next V st. V st in sp between last V st and next st. Rep from * to * once more. V st in ch-1 sp of each V st to end of row. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Fasten off.
3rd row: With RS facing, join MC with sl st in last dc of 2nd row. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *Ch 2. 1 sc in ch-1 sp of next V st. Rep from * around to opposite corner, ending with ch 2. 1 sc in top of turning ch. (Ch 2. 1 sc in side of edging rows) twice. **Ch 2. 1 sc in ch-1 sp between next 2 V sts. Rep from ** across neck edge. (Ch 2. 1 sc in side of edging rows) twice. Ch 2. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Sew button to top corner of left front neck edge, using ch-2 loop of 3rd row of Edging on right front as a button loop.
Weave ribbon through neck edge. Tie in bow at center front. Sew seams at underarms.

Blanket
With MC, ch 134 loosely.
1st row: (RS). (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) – V st made, in 6th ch from hook. *Miss next 2 ch. V st in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. Miss next ch. 1 dc in last ch. 43 V sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *V st in ch-1 sp of next V st. Rep from * across, ending with 1 dc in 5th ch of turning ch. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *V st in ch-1 sp of next V st. Rep from * across, ending with 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
Rep last row for pat until work from beg measures 36 ins [91.5 cm]. Fasten off.

Edging: 1st rnd: With RS facing, join A with sl st in top right corner dc of Blanket. Ch 4. 1 dc in same sp – beg V st made. *V st in ch-1 sp of next V st. Rep from * to next corner dc. V st in top of corner dc. Work V st in side of each turning ch or dc down side of Blanket to next corner dc. V st in base of corner dc. V st in each ch-2 sp across foundation ch to next corner dc. V st in base of corner dc. Work V st in side of each turning ch or dc up opposite side of Blanket. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4.
2nd rnd: (Beg V st. V st) all in ch-1 sp of Beg V st. (*V st in ch-1 sp of next V st. Rep from * to next corner V st. 2 V sts in next corner V st) 3 times. **V st in ch-1 sp of next V st. Rep from ** to end of rnd. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. Fasten off.

pattern_name: One Ball Baby Blanket and Hat
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Blanket measures 39” x 32”. Hat fits 6-9 month-old.
gauge: 2 repeats = 4”; 7 rows = 4” in pattern with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BLANKET
With larger hook, ch 90.
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 6th ch from hook, dc in next 4 ch, ch 1, skip next ch, [dc in next 5 ch, ch 1, skip next ch] 13 times, dc in last ch; turn.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in first dc, * ch 2, skip next 2 dc, sc in next dc, ch 2 **, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last 2 sts, end at **; skip next ch, 2 dc in next ch; turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in next dc, * dc in next ch-2 space, ch 1, dc in next ch-2 space **, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from * to last 2 sts, end at **; dc in next dc and top of ch-3; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first dc, * ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-1 space, ch 2, skip next 2 dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * across working last sc in top of ch-3; turn.
Row 5: Ch 4, * dc in ch-2 space, dc in next 3 dc, dc in next ch-2 space, ch 1; repeat from * to last st; dc in last sc; turn.
Rows 6-65: Repeat Rows 2-5 fifteen times. Do not turn at end of last row but pivot to work down next side.
Border
Round 1: With right side still facing, work sc evenly around all 4 sides and work 3 sc in each corner; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 2: * Ch 3, dc in same st, skip next 2 sc, slip st in next sc; repeat from * around adjusting as necessary at corners and end of round; join in first st of round. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
HAT
With smaller hook, ch 4; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 11 dc in ring; join with a slip st in top of ch-3 – 12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, [2 dc in next dc] 11 times; join – 24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, dc in next dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc] 11 times; join – 36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, dc in next 2 dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next 2 dc] 11 times; join – 48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, dc in next 3 dc, ch 1, [dc in next 5 dc, ch 1] 4 times, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next 3 dc, ch 1, [dc in next 5 dc, ch 1] 4 times; join – 50 dc and 10 ch-1 spaces.
Round 6: Slip st in next dc, (slip st, ch 1, sc) all in next dc, * ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-1 space, ch 2 **, skip next 2 dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join in first sc.
Round 7: Slip st in next ch-2 space, ch 3, * dc in next 3 dc, dc in next ch-2 space, ch 1 **, dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Rounds 8-12: Repeat Rounds 6 and 7 twice, and then repeat Round 6 once more.
Round 13: Ch 3, * dc in next ch-2 space, dc in next 3 dc, dc in next ch-2 space **, dc in next sc; repeat from * around, end at **; join – 60 dc.
Round 14: Ch 3, dc in each dc around; join.
Round 15: Ch 3, dc in front loop of each dc around; join.
Round 16: Ch 3, dc in both loops of each dc around; join.
Fasten off. Weave in ends. Fold up last 2 rounds.

materials: RED HEART® “Collage™”: 2 balls 2629 Landscape Green (or 1 ball plus 2½ yds for scarf; 2½ oz for cloche).
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Scarf measures 5½” x 62”. Cloche fits most women.
gauge: 14 sts = 5”; 6 rows = 3” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 185 loosely.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 184 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3, skip first sc, * back cross dc over next 2 sc; repeat from * to last sc; dc in last sc; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each dc across and in top of ch-3; turn.
Rows 4-5: Repeat Rows 2 and 3.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * ch 2, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across. Fasten off.
With wrong side facing, attach yarn on opposite side of beginning ch.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Ch 3, skip first ch, * back cross dc over next 2 ch; repeat from * to last ch; dc in last ch; turn.
Rows 2-5: Repeat Rows 3-6. At end of last row, do not fasten off.
Border
Rnd 1: Ch 3, working across long edge, 4 dc in first sc, sc in next ch-2 space, * 3 dc in next sc, sc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * to last sc; 5 dc in last sc; working across short end, [sc in end of next sc row, 3 dc over post of dc at end of next row] 4 times, sc in end of next sc row **, 5 dc in next corner sc, sc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * to ** once more; join with a slip st in top of ch-3. Fasten off. 
Weave in ends.
CLOCHE
Ch 4; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc.
Rnd 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join – 16 sc.
Rnd 3: Ch 1, [sc in sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times; join – 24 sc.
Rnd 4: Ch 1, [sc in 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times; join – 32 sc.
Rnds 5 and 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Rnd 7: Ch 1, [sc in sc, 2 sc in next sc] 16 times; join – 48 sc.
Rnd 8: Repeat Rnd 5.
Rnd 9: Ch 1, [sc in 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 12 times; do NOT join – 60 sc. Mark first sc of next rnd and then move marker up as you work.
Rnds 10-20: Sc in each sc around without joining.
Rnd 21: [Sc in 14 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times; join to first sc – 64 sc.
Rnd 22: Ch 3, working behind the ch-3, dc in last sc of last rnd, * back cross dc over next 2 sc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of ch-3.
Rnd 23: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join.
Rnd 24: Repeat Rnd 22.
Rnd 25: Ch 1, sc in each st around decreasing 1 st at end of rnd; join; TURN – 63 sc.
Rnd 26 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, * sc in sc, ch 2, skip 2 sc; repeat from * around; join; TURN.
Rnd 27 (Right Side): Ch 1, * sc in ch-2 space, 3 dc in next sc; repeat from * around; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Optional Flower
With a pink section of yarn, ch 4; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc. 
Rnd 2: [Ch 3, slip st in next sc] 7 times, ch 3, slip st in joining slip st of Rnd 1.
Rnd 3: Ch 1, working behind ch-3 spaces in sc of Rnd 1 and to the left of slip sts of Rnd 2, sc in first sc, [ch 4, sc in next sc] 7 times, ch 4; join in first sc.
Rnd 4: Ch 1, working behind ch-4 spaces in same sc of Rnd 1 and to the left of sc of Rnd 3, sc in first sc, [ch 5, sc in next sc] 7 times, ch 5, join in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Add a pretty button or bead to the center of flower and then sew onto side of cloche.

materials: RED HEART® Team Spirit Chunky™: 5 balls 9988 Red/Grey
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Hat circumference at bottom edge: 18 (21, 22)" [45.5 (53.5, 56) cm]
gauge: 8 hdc = 4" [10 cm]; 5½ rows = 4" [10 cm] in half double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Round 1: Make an adjustable loop ring, ch 1 (does NOT count as a st here and throughout), work 10 hdc in ring, slip st in first hdc to join – 10 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 1, work 2 hdc in each st around, slip st in first hdc – 20 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st] 10 times, slip st in first hdc – 30 hdc.
For Small Hat Only
Round 4: Ch 1, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 4 sts] 6 times, slip st in first hdc – 36 hdc.
Rounds 5-8: Ch 1, hdc in each st around, slip st in first hdc – 36 hdc.
Rounds 9-11: Ch 1, sc in each st around, slip st in first sc – 36 sc. Fasten off.
For Medium Hat Only
Round 4: Ch 1, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts] 10 times, slip st in first hdc – 40 hdc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 19 sts] 2 times, slip st in first hdc – 42 hdc.
Rounds 6-9: Ch 1, hdc in each st around, slip st in first hdc – 42 hdc.
Rounds 10-12: Ch 1, sc in each st around, slip st in first sc – 42 sc. Fasten off.
For Large Hat Only
Round 4: Ch 1, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts] 10 times, slip st in first hdc – 40 hdc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 9 sts] 4 times, slip st in first hdc – 44 hdc.
Rounds 6-10: Ch 1, hdc in each st around, slip st in first hdc – 44 hdc.
Rounds 11-13: Ch 1, sc in each st around, slip st in first sc – 44 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Make a pompom with 3½" [9 cm] diameter using pompom maker. Sew pompom to top of Hat. Weave in ends.
SCARF
Ch 14.
Row 1: Hdc in third ch from hook (skipped chs do NOT count as a st), hdc in each ch across – 12 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (does NOT count as a hdc here and throughout), turn, hdc into each st across – 12 hdc.
Repeat Row 2 until Scarf measures 70" [178 cm] from beginning. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Make four pompoms, each with 3½" [9 cm] diameter, using pompom maker. Sew one pompom to each corner of Scarf. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn”: 1 Ball each 3720 Lavender CA, 2541 Blue Sky CB, and 4601 Off White CC
abbreviations: CL2: Yo and draw up a lp in next dc, yo and draw through 2 lps, skip next 2 sc, yo and draw up a lp in next dc, yo and draw through 2 lps, yo and draw through all 3 lps rem on hook.
CL3: Yo and draw up a lp in next st, yo and draw through 2 lps, skip next 3 sts, yo and draw up a lp in next st, yo and draw through 2 lps, yo and draw through all 3 lps rem on hook.
Shell: (2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) all in st or sp indicated.
measurements: Hat fits most women. Scarf measures approximately 6” x 71”.
gauge: 14 sts (2 repeats) = 3½”; 6 rows = 4” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
With CA, ch 281.
Rnd 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, * ch 1, skip next 2 ch, shell in next ch, ch 1, skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch **, sc in next ch; rep from * across, end at **; turn to work on opposite side of beg ch; sc in same ch as last sc; rep from * across, end at ** changing to CB in last sc; join with a sl st to first sc – 40 ch-3 sps on each side.
Rnd 2: With CB, ch 1, sc in same sc as joining, sc in ch-1 sp, ** ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, shell in ch-3 sp, dc in next dc, * CL2, dc in next dc, shell in ch-3 sp, dc in next dc; rep from * across first side; dc in next dc, ch 3, sc in ch-1 sp **, sc in next 2 sc, sc in ch-1 sp; rep from ** to ** across next side; sc in last sc changing to CC; join.
Rnd 3: With CC, ch 1, sc in same sc as joining, sc in next sc, sc in ch-3 sp, ** ch 3, skip next 2 dc, dc in next 2 dc, shell in ch-3 sp, dc in next dc, * CL3, dc in next dc, shell in ch-3 sp, dc in next dc; rep from * across first side; dc in next dc, ch 3, skip next 2 dc, sc in ch-3 sp **, sc in next 4 sc, sc in ch-3 sp; rep from ** to ** across next side; sc in last 2 sc changing to CA; join.
Rnd 4: With CA, ch 1, sc in same sc as joining and next 2 sc, 2 sc in ch-3 sp, ** ch 3, skip next 2 dc, dc in next 2 dc, shell in ch-3 sp, dc in next dc, * CL3, dc in next dc, shell in ch-3 sp, dc in next dc; rep from * across first side; dc in next dc, ch 3, skip next 2 dc, 2 sc in ch-3 sp **, sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in ch-3 sp; rep from ** to ** across next side; sc in last 3 sc; join. Fasten off.
HAT
With CC, ch 4; join with sl st in first ch to form ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 3, 13 dc in ring; join with sl st in top of ch-3 – 14 sts.
Rnd 2: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, [2 dc in next dc]13 times; join – 28 sts.
Rnd 3: Ch 3, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc] 13 times, 2 dc in last dc; join – 42 sts.
Rnd 4: Ch 3, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc] 20 times, 2 dc in last dc; join – 63 sts.
Rnd 5: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, * ch 1, skip next 2 dc, shell in next dc, ch 1, skip next 2 dc, sc in next dc **, sc in next dc; rep from * around, end at **; join in first sc – 9 ch-3 sps.
Rnd 6: Sl st in sp, sl st in next 2 dc, ch 3, * shell in ch-3 sp, dc in next dc, CL2 **, dc in next dc; rep from * around end at ** and working 2nd leg of CL2 in first dc of previous rnd; join in top of ch-3.
Rnd 7: St in next 2 dc, ch 3, * shell in ch-3 sp, dc in next dc, CL3 **, dc in next dc; rep from * around end at ** and working 2nd leg of CL3 in first dc of previous rnd; join.
Rep Rnd 7 four more times. Fasten off.
Brim-Next Rnd: With WRONG SIDE facing (this will be the right side when brim is turned up), attach CA in 2nd dc of shell; ch 3, * shell in ch-3 sp, dc in next dc, CL3 **, dc in next dc; repeat from * around end at ** and working 2nd leg of CL3 in first dc of previous rnd; join. Fasten off.
Rep last rnd 6 more times in following color sequence: [CB, CC, CA] twice. Weave in ends.

abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Cloche fits most women. Scarf measures 5½” wide x 61” long.
gauge: Scarf: 12 sc = 4”; Rows 1-3 = 1½”. Cloche: Rnds 1-3 = 2” across.
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 15.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 14 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3, skip first sc; * skip next sc, dc in next sc, working behind dc just made, dc in skipped sc – crossed dc made; repeat from * to last sc; dc in last sc; turn – 6 crossed dc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each dc across and in top of ch-3; turn.
Rows 4-123: Repeat Rows 2 and 3. Do not turn at end of Row 123.
Border
Working down long edge, ch 1, * (sc, ch 3, sc) all over next ch-3, slip st in next sc; repeat from * to corner; (sc, ch 4, sc) all in corner ch, [(sc, ch 3, sc) all in next ch, slip st in next ch] twice, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in next ch, sc in next ch, ch 5, sc in next ch, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in next ch, [slip st in next ch, (sc, ch 3, sc) all in next ch] twice, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in last (corner) ch, slip st in next sc; * (sc, ch 3, sc) all over next dc, slip st in next sc; repeat from * to corner; (sc, ch 4, sc) all in next sc, [(sc, ch 3, sc) all in next sc, slip st in next sc] twice, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in next sc, sc in next sc, ch 5, sc in next sc, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in next sc, [slip st in next sc, (sc, ch 3, sc) all in next sc] twice, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in last sc; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
CLOCHE
Leaving a 12” tail to beginning, work same as for Scarf for 40 rows, end Row 2. Do not fasten off. Sew beginning ch edge to dc of Row 40 for back seam. Now work around top as follows:
Rnd 1: Ch 1, [2 sc in end of dc row, sc in end of sc row] 20 times; join with a slip st in first sc – 60 sc.
Rnd 2: Ch 1, * sc in sc, ch 1, skip next sc; repeat from * around; join.
Rnd 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc and ch-1 space around; join.
Rnds 4 and 5: Repeat Rnds 2 and 3.
Rnd 6: Ch 1, * sc in 4 sc; draw up a loop in next 2 sc, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook – dec made; repeat from * around; join – 50 sc.
Rnds 7 and 8: Repeat Rnds 2 and 3.
Rnd 9: Ch 1, [sc in 3 sc, dec] 10 times; join – 40 sc.
Rnds 10 and 11: Repeat Rnds 2 and 3.
Rnd 12: Ch 1, [sc in 2 sc, dec] 10 times; join – 30 sc.
Rnds 13 and 14: Repeat Rnds 2 and 3.
Rnd 15: Ch 1, [sc in sc, dec] 10 times; join – 20 sc.
Rnd 16: Repeat Rnd 2.
Rnd 17: Ch 1, [sc in next ch-1 space] 10 times; join – 10 sc.
Rnd 18: Ch 1, [dec] 5 times; join. Fasten off leaving a 7” tail. Weave tail over and under sts of last rnd; draw up tightly; fasten securely. Weave in ends.
Lower Edging: With wrong side facing, attach yarn in the d.c. to the left of seam; ch 1, * (sc, ch 3, sc) over the d.c. row end, slip st in next sc row end; repeat from * around; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Turn cloche right side facing and turn up edge to form a cuff.

materials: Red Heart® Heat Wave™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 198 yds/181 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and insert hook from back to front around post of next stitch. Yoh and draw up a loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and insert hook from front to back around post of next stitch. Yoh and draw up a loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: Hat: One size to fit adult. Cowl: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] deep x 28" [71 cm] around.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
HAT 
Ribbing: Ch 13. 
1st row: (RS). Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each ch across. Turn. 12 sts. 
2nd row: Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in each of next 12 sl sts. Turn. 
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 18" [45.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off.
Join back seam: Working in back loops only, sl st last row and rem loops of foundation ch tog. Do not fasten off. 
Turn work and proceed as follows: 
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd does not count as st. 
Join all rnds with sl st to first dc or dcfp or dcbp.
Beg working in rnds: 1st rnd: 
Ch 3. Work 70 dc evenly around. Join. 70 dc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around next dc. 1 dcbp around each of next 9 dc) 7 times. Join. 
3rd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 8 sts) 7 times. Join. 
4th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 7 sts) 7 times. Join. 
5th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts) 7 times. Join. 
6th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts) 7 times. Join. 
7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around first st. (1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. Join. 
8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. (1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. Join. 
9th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. (1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Join. 
10th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. (1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. Join. 
11th rnd: As 6th rnd. 
12th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around next dc. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 8 dc) 7 times. Join. 63 sts. 
13th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts) 7 times. Join. 56 sts. 
14th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts) 7 times. Join. 49 sts. 
15th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts) 7 times. Join. 42 sts. 
16th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around next st) 7 times. Join. 35 sts. 
Join all rnds with sl st to first sc or dcfp or dcbp.
17th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around first st. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around next st) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Skip next st. Join. 28 sts. 
18th rnd: Ch 3. Skip first st. (1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around next st) 6 times. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. Join. 21 sts. Fasten off leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely. 
POMPOM Wind yarn around 4 fingers 80 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew Pompom to top of Hat. 
COWL 
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd does not count as dc. 
Join all rnds with sl st to first sc or dcfp or dcbp.
Ch 90. Join in ring with sl st into first ch, taking care to not twist chain. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 90 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around next sc. 1 dcbp around each of next 9 sc) 9 times. Join. 
3rd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 8 sts) 9 times. Join. 
4th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 7 sts) 9 times. Join. 
5th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts) 9 times. Join. 
6th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts) 9 times. Join. 
7th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 6 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts) 9 times. Join. 
8th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 7 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts) 9 times. Join. 
9th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 8 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts) 9 times. Join. 
10th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around each of next 9 sts. 1 dcbp around next st) 9 times. Join. 
11th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcfp around each st around. Join. 
12th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 9 sts) 9 times. Join. 
13th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 8 sts) 9 times. Join. 
14th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 7 sts) 9 times. Join. 
15th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 6 sts) 9 times. Join. 
16th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around each of next 5 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 5 sts) 9 times. Join. 
17th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around each of next 6 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts) 9 times. Join. 
18th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around each of next 7 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts) 9 times. Join. 
19th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around each of next 8 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts) 9 times. Join. 
20th rnd: Ch 3. (1 dcbp around each of next 9 sts. 1 dcfp around next st) 9 times. Join. 
21st rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around each st around. Join. 
Rep 2nd to 21st rnds once more. 
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 3 skeins 1942 Plum Jam
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 6½” x 60” (16.5 cm x 152.5 cm); Hat measures 18” (45.5 cm) circumference. Hat will stretch to fit a range of sizes.
gauge: 8 sts = 5” (10 cm); 11 rows = 4” (10 cm) in Woven Stitch pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
SCARF
Ch 23.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—22 sc.
Row 2: Ch 2, skip first st, WS in next sc, *skip next sc, WS in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—11 WS.
Row 3: Ch 2, WS in space between each WS and in ch-2 turning space, turn. Repeat Row 3 until scarf measures 60” (152.5 cm) or desired length.
Last Row: Ch 1, 2 sc in space between each WS. Fasten off.
FINISHING SCARF
Weave in ends.

HAT
Note: Do not turn unless instructed to do so.
Ch 4, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, work 7 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—7 sc.
Rounds 2-4: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc; join with slip st in first sc—56 sc at end of Round 4.
Rounds 5: Ch 2, skip first sc, WS in 2nd sc, *skip next sc, WS in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of turning ch, turn—28 WS.
Rounds 6-30: Ch 2, WS in space between each WS and in ch-2 turning space; join with slip st in top of turning ch, turn.
Round 31: Ch 2, 2 sc in space between each WS and in ch-2 turning space; join with slip st in top of turning ch—56 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING HAT
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton (Solids: 50 g/ 1.75 oz/73 m/80 yds)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: 27 sts = 4 ins [10 cm]
gauge: 14 hdc and 10 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]
instructions:
BIB
With MC, ch 21.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. *Ch 1. Miss next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. Rep from * to end of ch.  Turn. 19 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each st or ch 1 sp to last st. 2 hdc in last st. Join A.  Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sts. *(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in missed ch of foundation ch 2 rows below in front of work. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times– long tr made. Miss next st  (behind long tr). 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last st.  Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. Join MC.  Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. *Ch 1. Miss next st. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Ch 1. Miss next st. 1 hdc in last st. Ch 2.  Turn.
6th row: 2 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each st or ch sp to last st. 2 hdc in last st. Join A.  Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sts. *Long tr in next missed st 2 rows below. Miss next st (behind long tr). 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 3 sts. Long tr in next missed st 2 rows below. Miss next st (behind long tr). 1 sc in each of next 2 sts.  Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. Join MC.  Turn. 27 sts.
Cont even in pat as placed in last 8 rows for 12 more rows.
Shape neck: 1st row: (RS). With MC, ch 2. Pat across 6 sts. Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook– hdc2tog made. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. Pat to end of row. Join A. Ch 1.  Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. Pat to last 2 sts. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made.  Turn. 5 sts.
Work 6 rows even in pat.
Next row: (WS). Ch 2. 2 hdc in first st. Pat to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join A.  Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Pat to last st. 2 sc in last st.  Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Join MC.  Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. Pat to last st. 2 hdc in last st.  Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first st. Pat to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Fasten off.
With RS of work facing, miss next 11 sts. Join MC with sl st to next st. Ch 2. Hdc2tog over this st and next st. Pat to end of row.  Turn.
Work to correspond to first side, reversing all shapings.
Edging: Join A with sl st to top left corner of neck edge. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 1 row sc evenly around all edges. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Working around outer edge only, ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc to opposite side. Fasten off. With A, make button loop at center back on left side. Sew button in position.
BOOTIES
With A, ch 28.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 27 sts.  Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join MC.  Turn.
3rd row: With MC, ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. *Ch 1. Miss next st. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Ch 1. Miss next st. 1 hdc in next st.  Turn. 
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each st or ch 1 sp to end of row. Join A.  Turn.
5th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Long tr in next missed ch 2 rows below. Miss next st (behind long tr). 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Long tr in next missed ch 2 rows below. Miss next st (behind long tr). 1 sc in last st.  Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sts. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 sc in each of last 3 sts.  Turn. 23 sts.
7th row: (Eyelet row). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sts. *Ch 1. Miss next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts.  Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st or ch 1 sp to end of row. Fasten off.
Instep: 1st row: With RS of work facing, miss first 7 sts. Join A with sl st to next st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts.  Turn. 9 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row.  Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row.  Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
Sew center back seam. With RS of work facing, join A with sl st at center back seam. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Work 5 sc down side of instep. 3 sc in corner sc. 5 sc across end of instep. 3 sc in corner sc. Work 5 sc along other side of instep. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Join with sl st to first st. 35 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join MC with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in back loops only work 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 13 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 13 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st.
Fasten off. Join center foot seam.
Drawstring: 
With MC, chain a length to measure 16 ins [40.5 cm]. Fasten off. Weave drawstring through eyelet row. Knot ends of drawstring.

materials: RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™, Art. E805 available in solid 3.5 oz (100 g) 340 yd (310 m) and multi 3.5 oz (100 g) 290 yd (265 m) balls
Colorway #1: 1 ball each of 261 Tangerine A, 764 Taffy B, and 100 Lily C.
Colorway #2: 1 ball each of 764 Taffy A, 556 Jam B, and 100 Lily C.
Colorway #3: 1 ball each of 691 Grass A, 226 Bumble B, and100 Lily C.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 4.25 mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle, One ½” (13 mm) button
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Finished Chest: 20 (22, 24, 26)” (51 [56, 61, 66] cm) Headband Finished Size: 16” (40.5 cm) in circumference. Stretches to 17”-18” (40.5-45.5 cm)
gauge: 18 dc and 10 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
NOTE
Sweater is made from the top down in one piece.
SWEATER
Yoke
Starting at neck edge, with A, ch 50.
Row 1: Dc into 4th ch from hook, *2 dc in next ch, dc in next 3 ch; repeat from * across to last 2 ch, 2 dc in next ch, dc in last ch; turn—60 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in next dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 4 dc; repeat from * across to last 3 sts, 2 dc in next dc, dc in last 2 dc; turn—72 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 5 dc; repeat from * across to last 3 sts, 2 dc in next dc, dc in last 2 dc; turn—84 dc.
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 6 dc; repeat from * across to last 4 sts, 2 dc in next dc, dc in last 3 dc; turn—96 dc.
Row 5: Ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 7 dc; repeat from * across to last 4 sts, 2 dc in next dc, dc in last 3 dc; turn—108 dc.

Row 6: Ch 3, dc in next 3dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 8 dc; repeat from * across to last 5 sts, 2 dc in next dc, dc in last 4 dc; turn—120 dc.
Row 7: Ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 9 dc; repeat from * across to last 6 sts, 2 dc in next dc, dc in last 5 dc; turn—132 dc.
Sizes 9, 12, and 18 Months Only
Row 8: Ch 3, dc in next 4 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 10 dc; repeat from * across to last 6 sts, 2 dc in next dc, dc in last 5 dc; turn—144 dc.
Sizes 12 and 18 Months Only
Row 9: Ch 3, dc in next 4 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 11 dc; repeat from * across to last 7 sts, 2 dc in next dc, dc in last 6 dc; turn—156 dc.
Size 18 Months Only
Row 10: Ch 3, dc in next 5 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 12 dc; repeat from * across to last 7 sts, 2 dc in next dc, dc in last 6 dc; turn—168 dc.

Divide for Fronts, Back and Sleeves
Row 8 (9, 10, 11): Ch 1, dc in next 17 (19, 22, 24) dc, ch 6 (8, 8, 10) for underarm, skip next 30 (32, 32, 34) dc for sleeve, dc in next 36 (40, 46, 50) dc for back, ch 6 (8, 8, 10) for underarm, skip next 30 (32, 32, 34) dc for sleeve, dc in last 18 (20, 23, 25) dc; turn—84 (96, 108, 120) sts.

Skirt
Row 1: Ch 3, skip first 2 dc, fan in next dc, *skip next 5 dc, fan in next dc; repeat from * across to last 3 dc, skip next 2 dc, dc in top of turning ch; turn—14 (16, 18, 20) fans.
Directions are for size 6 months. Changes for sizes 9, 12 and 18 months are in parentheses.

Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *(sc, ch 3) in next 3 ch-1 spaces, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across, sc in top of turning ch; turn—42 (48, 54, 60) ch-3 spaces. 
Row 3: Ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, *fan in next ch-3 space**, skip next 2 ch-3 spaces; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, skip next ch-3 space, dc in last sc; turn.
Repeat Rows 2-3 until skirt measures 4 (4, 5, 5)” (10 [10, 12.5, 12.5] cm) from beginning, ending with Row 2 of pattern. Fasten off A, join C.
Last Row: With C, repeat Skirt Row 3. Fasten off C.

Sleeve Edging
Row 1: With right side facing and, join C in first (2nd, 2nd, 4th) dc of skipped sleeve sts on either sleeve opening, work Skirt Row 1 across dc section of sleeve—5 fans. Fasten off C. Repeat Sleeve Edging across other Sleeve opening

Collar
With B, ch 63. 
Row 1: Fan in 6th ch from hook, *skip next 5 ch, fan in next ch; repeat from * across to last 3 ch, skip next 2 chs, dc in last ch; turn—10 fans.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *(sc, ch 3) in next 3 ch-1 spaces, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across, sc in top of turning ch; turn—30 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off B, join C.
Row 3: With C, repeat Skirt Row 3. Fasten off C.
With right sides facing up, lay collar on top of neckline. Pin in place. With B, slip st collar to neck edge. Fasten off B.
Sew button to left front edge where desired. Use space between sts on right front, opposite button for buttonhole.

Headband
With A, ch 9.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in each ch across, turn—7 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), skip first st, dc in each dc across, turn—7 dc.
Repeat row 2 until headband measures 16” (40.5 cm) from beginning or 1½” (4 cm) less than head circumference.
Without twisting headband, hold both ends together, slip st last row to foundation ch, matching sts.

Flower
With B, make an adjustable ring. 
Round 1: Ch 1, 12 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in first sc, 2 dc in each sc around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off B, leaving a 12” (30.5 cm) sewing length—24 dc. Join C.
Round 3: With C, *ch 4, tr2tog over next 2 sts, ch 4, slip st in next 2 dc; rep from * around. 
Fasten off C.

FINISHING
Weave in ends. Sew flower to headband over seam.

materials: RED HEART® Eco-Ways Bamboo Wool: 3 skeins each 3116 Ivory A, 3365 Cocoa B, 3340 Rust C
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Hat circumference measures 25”; Scarf measures 60” x 6 ½”
gauge: In pattern: (shell, sc) twice = 4 ”; CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
HAT
With A, ch 86.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each remaining ch across. Fasten off.
Row 2 (Right Side): Join A with slip st in first sc on Row 1, ch 1, sc in same sc, *sk next 2 chs, shell in next ch, sk next 2 sc, sc in next sc, repeat from * across. Fasten off.
Row 3: Join B with slip st between first 2 sts of last row, ch 3, 2 dc in same space, sc in 3rd dc of next shell, *shell in next sc, sc in 3rd dc of next shell, repeat from * across, 3 dc in last sc. Fasten off.
Row 4: Hold piece with right side facing, join C with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3 on last row worked, ch 1, sc in same ch, shell in next sc, *sc in 3rd dc of next shell, shell in next sc, repeat from * across, sc in last dc. Fasten off.
Rows 4-14: Repeat Rows 3 and 4, in following color sequence: 1 row A, 1 row B, 1 row C.
Row 15: Repeat Row 3.
ASSEMBLY
With A, whipstitch ends of rows together on wrong side to form back seam.
TOP TRIM
Round 1 (Right Side): With right side facing, join B with slip st in any st on Row 15, ch 4, work (dc, ch 1) 55 times evenly spaced around Row 15, join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4. Turn.
Round 2: Slip st in next ch-1 space, ch 4, work (dc, ch 1) in each remaining ch-1 space around, join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4. Fasten off.
Round 3: With right side facing and working behind Round 1, join A with slip st in same space on Row 15 as beginning ch-4 of Round 1 made, ch 4, work (dc, ch 1) in same space as each dc worked on Round 1, join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4. Turn.
Round 4: Slip st in next ch-1 space, ch 4, work (dc, ch 1) in each remaining ch-1 space around, join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4. Fasten off.
Round 5: With right side facing and working behind Round 3, join C with slip st in same space on Row 15 as beginning ch-4 of Round 3 made, ch 4, work (dc, ch 1) in same space as each dc worked on Round 3, join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4. Turn.
Round 6: Slip st in next ch-1 space, ch 4, work (dc, ch 1) in each remaining ch-1 space around, join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4. Fasten off.
BAND
Round 1: Join A with slip st in sc at back seam; ch 3, dc in each sc around, join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3. Fasten off.
Round 2: Join C with slip st in dc at back seam; ch 3, dc in each sc around, join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3. Fasten off.
Round 3: Join B with slip st in dc at back seam; ch 3, dc in each sc around, join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3. Fasten off.
Round 4: Join A with slip st in dc at back seam; ch 1, *sc in 1st and 2nd dc, 2 sc in 3 dc, repeat from * around; join with slip st in beginning ch-1. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Weave 12-inch strand of B through sts on Row 15. Gather to close top opening and secure ends.
SCARF
With A, ch 257.
Row 1 (Right Side): Shell in 5th ch from hook, *sk next 3 chs, sc in next ch, sk next 3 chs, shell in next ch, repeat from * across to last 4 chs, sk next 3 chs, sc in last ch. Fasten off.
Row 2: Hold piece with right side facing, join B with slip st in space formed by beginning 4 sk chs on last row worked, ch 3, 2 dc in same space, sc in 3rd dc of next shell, *shell in next sc, sc in 3rd dc of next shell, repeat from * across to last sc, 3 dc in last sc. Fasten off.
Row 3: Hold piece with right side facing, join C with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3 on last row worked, ch 1, sc in same ch, shell in next sc, *sc in 3rd dc of next shell, shell in next sc, repeat from * across to last 3 dc, sk next 2 dc, sc in last dc. Fasten off.
Rows 4-11: Repeat Rows 2 and 3, in following color sequence: 1 row A, 1 row B, 1 row C.
Row 12: With C, repeat Row 2.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
FRINGE
Cut 8-inch lengths of each color. Fold 2 strands of A in half. Draw folded end through side of Row 1; pull ends through fold and tighten knot. Matching color of knot with color of row and using 2 strands for each knot, tie knot in side of each row on each short end of scarf. Trim ends even.

materials: RED HEART® "Soft Baby®", Art.E705 (7 ounce/575 yard solid; 6 ounce/430 yard print, multicolor and twinkle skeins)
abbreviations: CA, CB, CC, CD = Colors A, B, C, D
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: To Fit Chest: 20 (21, 22, 23)". Finished Chest Measurement: 24 (251/2, 271/4, 29)".
gauge: 20 sts = 4"; 16 rows = 4" in pat with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: CARDIGAN-BACK: With larger hook and CA, ch 61 (65, 69, 73). Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, * Xsc; rep from * to last ch; sc in last ch; turn – 60 (64, 68, 72) sts. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * Xsc; rep from * to last sc; sc in last sc; turn. Rep Row 2 for pat for 103/4 (113/4, 123/4, 133/4)". Shape Neck/Shoulders: Work in pat across 19 (21, 23, 23) sts, sc in next st. Fasten off. Skip next 20 (20, 20, 24) sts, attach yarn in next st; ch 1, work in pat to end. Fasten off. LEFT FRONT: With larger hook and CB, ch 29 (31, 33, 35). Work in pat same as for Back across 28 (30, 32, 34) sts for 3 (31/2, 33/4, 4)"; then continue in pat with CC for 41/2 (43/4, 5, 51/2)"; then with CA for 13/4 (13/4, 21/4, 21/2)". Shape Neck/Shoulder: Keeping continuity of pat, omit (sl st across first or leave rem sts unworked) 4 (4, 4, 6) sts at neck edge on next row, then dec 2 sts at neck edge every other row 4 times – 20 (22, 24, 24) sts. Work even until Front measures same as Back to shoulder. Fasten off. RIGHT FRONT: With larger hook and CA, ch 29 (31, 33, 35). Work same as Left Front except work 5 (51/2, 6, 61/2)" with CA, then continue with CB. SLEEVES: With larger hook and CB for left sleeve or CC for right sleeve, ch 41 (43, 45, 47). Work in pat same as for Back across 40 (42, 44, 46) sts, shaping sides by inc 1 st each end of 3rd row, then every 4th row 4 (5, 6, 6) times, working added sts into pat – 50 (54, 58, 60) sts. Work even until 6 (7, 8, 9)" from beg. Fasten off. RIBBING: With CD, work same as Cardigan Ribbing. PANTS-Left Leg: (NOTE: Use CB for 61/2 (71/2, 83/4, 93/4)", then use CA to end of leg.) With larger hook ch 45 (49, 51, 51). Work in pat same as for Cardigan Back over 44 (48, 50, 50) sts, shaping sides by inc 1 st each end of 6 (9, 7, 5)th row, then every 4 (5, 7, 9)th row 4 times, then inc 1 st at each end of next 5 rows working added sts into pat – 64 (68, 70, 70) sts. Mark each end of last row. Work even for 3 (3, 31/4, 31/2)". Dec 1 st each end of next row, then every 4th row 3 times – 56 (60, 62, 62) sts. Fasten off. Ribbing: With CD, work same as Cardigan Ribbing. Right Leg: (NOTE: Use CA for 4 (43/4, 51/2, 61/2)"; CC for 51/2 (61/4, 7, 71/2)"; then use CB to end of leg.) Work same as Left Leg except for color placement. FINISHING: Sew leg seams to marker. Sew front and back crotch seam. Waistband: With right side facing, attach CD at center back. Rnd 1: Ch 1, sc evenly spaced around; join with a sl st in first sc; turn. Rnd 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join; turn. Rep Rnd 2 for 13/4". Fasten off leaving long end for sewing. Overlap ends of elastic by 1/2" forming a circle and sew in place. Fold Waistband in half to wrong side over elastic and sew in place.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Baby”, Art. E705, (7 ounce solid/6 ounce multi-color skeins): Blanket: 14 Ounces 7964 Naptime CA, 8 ounces 7881 Powder Blue CB. Robe & Hat: 10 Ounces 7964 Naptime CA, 6 ounces 7881 Powder Blue CB.
Eleven 1/2" buttons; sewing needle and thread; yarn needle.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Blanket measures 39" x 39". Robe fits infant 0-3 months; hat circumference 14".
gauge: In pat—16 sts = 3 1/2"; 20 rows = 5 1/2". CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: BLANKET: With CB, ch 178. Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 177 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across changing to CA in last sc. Row 3: With CA, ch 1, sc in first sc, * sc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc, hdc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc, dc in next sc, [ch 1, skip next sc, tr in next sc] twice, ch 1, skip next sc, dc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc, hdc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next sc **, ch 1, skip next sc; rep from * to last sc, end at **; sc in last sc; turn. Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each st and sp across; turn. Row 5: Rep Row 3 changing to CB in last sc. Row 6: With CB, ch 1, sc in first sc, * sc in next (sc, sp, hdc, sp, dc, [sp, tr] twice, sp, dc, sp, hdc, sp, sc) **; draw up a lp in sc 4 rows below next sc, yo and draw through both lps on hook– long sc made; rep from * to last sc, end at **; sc in last sc; turn. Row 7: Ch 1, sc in each st across changing to CA in last sc. Row 8: Ch 4,skip first sc, * tr in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc, dc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc, hdc in next sc, [ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next sc] twice, ch 1, skip next sc, hdc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc, dc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc, tr in next sc **, ch 1, skip next sc; rep from * to last sc, end at **; tr in last sc; turn. Row 9: Rep Row 4. Row 10: Rep Row 8 changing to CB in last sc. Row 11: With CB, ch 1, sc in first tr, * sc in next (tr, sp, dc, sp, hdc, sp, sc), long sc, sc in (sc, sp, hdc, sp, dc, sp, tr, sp); rep from * across working last sc in top of ch-4 instead of sp; turn. Row 12: Rep Row 7. Rep Rows 3-12 twelve more times, then Rows 3-7 again; now turn and work sc evenly down side edge with CB. Fasten off. With right side facing, attach CB and work 1 row sc along opposite side edge; ch 1, now work 1 rnd sc around entire blanket; join to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends. ROBE: With CA, ch 130.Work Rows 1-12 same as for Blanket over 129 sts, then rep Rows 3-12 six more times, then Rows 3 and 4 again. Yoke: Ch 1, sc in first sc; [draw up a lp in next 2 sc, yo and draw yarn through both lps on hook– dec made] 15 times, sc in next 2 sc, [dec, dec, dec, sc in next sc] 9 times, sc in next 2 sc, [dec] 15 times, sc in last sc – 72 sc. Divide for Fronts and Back-Left Front: Ch 1, sc in first 17 sc; turn. Work even in sc until 4 1/4" above division, end wrong side row.Shape Neck: Ch 1, work across first 15 sc; turn. Dec 1 sc at neck edge on next 2 rows. Work a few rows even until 5 1/2" above division. Fasten off. Back: With wrong side facing, join yarn and sc in next 38 sc; turn. Work even in sc until same length as Left Front. Fasten off. Right Front: With wrong side facing, join yarn and sc in last 17 sc. Complete same as for Left Front, reversing neck shaping. Sleeves: With CB ch 50.Work Rows 1-12 same as for Blanket over 49 sts, then rep Rows 3-12 once, then Row 3 once more. Fasten off. Cuff-Row 1: With right side facing, join CB on opposite side of beg ch; ch 1, sc in first st, * skip next st, sc in next st; rep from * across; turn – 25 sc. Rows 2-4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, skip next sc, * (sc, ch 3, sc) all in next sc, skip next sc; rep from * to last sc; sc in last sc. Fasten off. Sew sleeve and cuff seam. Finishing: Sew shoulder seams. Set in sleeves. With right side facing, attach CB at lower edge of right front; ch 1, sc evenly up right front, around neck edge and down left front; turn. Work 5 rows sc across left front only for button band. Fasten off. Buttonhole Band: Mark positions for 11 buttonholes across right front edge. With wrong side facing, attach CB at neck edge of right front; ch 1, sc down right front edge; turn. Work 1 more row sc. Buttonhole Row: Ch 1, [sc to marker, ch 2, skip 2 sc] 11 times, sc to end; turn. Next Row: Ch 1, [sc to sp, 2 sc in sp] 11 times, sc to end. Work 1 more row sc. Next Row: Rep Row 5 of Sleeve Cuff up right front, around neck, and down left front, adjusting as necessary around neck and at corners. Fasten off. Sew on buttons. HAT: With CB, ch 66. Work even in sc over 65 sts for 11 rows, then work Rows 3-12 twice same as Blanket, then Row 3 once more. Shape Crown: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in each sp across, sc in last sc; turn. Next Row: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * skip next sc, sc in next sc; rep from * across. Fasten off. Weave yarn through rem sts, gather tightly, fasten securely. With wrong side facing (will be right side when brim is turned up) attach CB and work Row 5 of Sleeve Cuff across rem lps of beg ch. Sew back seam, reversing for brim. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Baby Clouds™”: 6 skeins 9008 Cotton Candy A, 1 skein 9311 Cloud B
RED HEART® “Baby Clouds™”: 2 skeins 9724 Pink Lemonade A (or 9025 Blue Sky or 9311 Cloud)
RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein 312 Black B
Crochet Hooks: U.S. Sizes K-10½ [6½mm] and I-9 [5½ mm]
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B, etc.
measurements: Blanket measures 56” across outer points. Bear stands approximately 21” tall.
gauge: In pattern – Rnds 1 and 2 = 6” across not including ch-3 loops. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
With A, ch 6; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 3, 15 dc in ring; join with a slip st to top of ch-3 – 16 sts.
Rnd 2: Ch 3, dc in next dc, ch 3, [dc in next 2 dc, ch 3] 7 times; join to top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off.
Rnd 3: Attach B in any ch-3 space. Ch 6 (counts as a dc and a ch-3 space), 3 dc in same space, [(3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in next ch-3 space] 7 times, 2 dc in first space; join to 3rd ch of ch-6. Fasten off.
Rnd 4: Attach A in ch-3 space after joining. Ch 6, 2 dc in same space, * dc in next 2 dc, skip next 2 dc **, dc in next 2 dc; (2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) all in ch-3 space – corner made; repeat from * to last 2 sts, end at **; dc in next dc, dc in same ch as joining of previous rnd, dc in first space; join to 3rd ch of ch-6.
Rnd 5: Slip st in next ch of ch-6, slip st in space, ch 6, 2 dc in same space, * dc in next 3 dc, skip next 2 dc **, dc in next 3 dc, work corner; repeat from * to last 3 sts, end at **; dc in next 2 dc, dc in same ch as joining of previous rnd, dc in first space; join to 3rd ch of ch-6.
Rnd 6: Slip st in next ch of ch-6, slip st in space, ch 6, 2 dc in same space, * dc in next 4 dc, skip next 2 dc **, dc in next 4 dc, work corner; repeat from * to last 4 sts, end at **; dc in next 3 dc, dc in same ch as joining of previous rnd, dc in first space; join to 3rd ch of ch-6. Fasten off.
Rnd 7: Attach B in ch-3 space after joining. Ch 6, 2 dc in same space, * dc in next 5 dc, skip next 2 dc **, dc in next 5 dc, work corner; repeat from * to last 5 sts, end at **; dc in next 4 dc, dc in same ch as joining of previous rnd, dc in first space; join to 3rd ch of ch-6. Fasten off.
Rnd 8: Work same as Rnd 4 EXCEPT work 6 dc on each side of corner.
Rnd 9: Work same as Rnd 5 EXCEPT work 7 dc on each side of corner.
Rnd 10: Work same as Rnd 6 EXCEPT work 8 dc on each side of corner.
Rnd 11: Work same as Rnd 7 EXCEPT work 9 dc on each side of corner.
Rnd 12: Work same as Rnd 4 EXCEPT work 10 dc on each side of corner.
Rnd 13: Work same as Rnd 5 EXCEPT work 11 dc on each side of corner.
Rnd 14: Work same as Rnd 6 EXCEPT work 12 dc on each side of corner.
Rnd 15: Work same as Rnd 7 EXCEPT work 13 dc on each side of corner.
Rnd 16: Work same as Rnd 4 EXCEPT work 14 dc on each side of corner.
Rnd 17: Work same as Rnd 5 EXCEPT work 15 dc on each side of corner.
Rnd 18: Work same as Rnd 6 EXCEPT work 16 dc on each side of corner. Weave in ends.
Ears (Make 2)
With A and larger hook, ch 4; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; place a contrasting length of yarn between the last st and the next st to mark end of rnd. Do not join, but work in continuous rnds.
Rnd 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 16 sc.
Rnds 3 and 4: Sc in each sc around.
Row 5: Fold ear in half, ch 1, working through both layers, work 8 sc across. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
Muzzle
With A and larger hook, work same as Ears through Rnd 2.
Rnd 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 24 sc.
Rnds 4 and 5: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
Nose
With B and smaller hook, ch 3; 5 hdc in 3rd ch from hook, ch 3, slip st in same ch. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
Eyes (Make 2)
With B and smaller hook, ch 2; 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing; tie ends together to round the eye.
Arms (Make 2)
With A and larger hook, work same as Ears through Rnd 2.
Rnds 3-14: Sc in each sc around. Stuff lightly and shape.
Wrist-Rnd 15: [Draw up a loop in next 2 sc, yo and draw yarn through all 3 loops on hook] 4 times, sc in next 8 sc – 12 sc.
Paw-Rnd 16: Sc in next 4 sc, [2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 20 sc.
Rnds 17-19: Sc in each sc around. Stuff lightly and shape.
Rnd 20: [Sc in next 3 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 4 times – 16 sc.
Rnd 21: Sc in every other sc around – 8 sc.
Rnd 22: Slip st in every other sc around. Fasten off.
Legs (Make 2)
With A and larger hook, work same as Ears through Rnd 2.
Rnds 3-16: Sc in each sc around. Stuff lightly and shape.
Ankle-Rnd 17: [Draw up a loop in next 2 sc, yo and draw yarn through all 3 loops on hook] 4 times, sc in next 8 sc – 12 sc.
Rnd 18: [3 Sc in next sc] 4 times, sc in next 8 sc – 20 sc.
Rnds 19-22: Sc in each sc around. Stuff lightly and shape.
Rnds 23-25: Work same as Arms Rnds 20-22. Fasten off.
Optional-Toes: Stitch through paw with yarn, tighten and secure. Repeat twice more for 3 toes.
Head & Body
With A and larger hook, work same as Ears through Rnd 2.
Rnd 3: 2 sc in each sc around – 32 sc.
Rnds 4-13: Sc in each sc around.
Neck-Rnd 14: [Draw up a loop in next 2 sc, yo and draw yarn through all 3 loops on hook] 16 times – 16 sc.
Body-Rnd 15: 3 Sc in each sc around – 48 sc.
Rnds 16-28: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 29: [Sc in next 6 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times – 42 sc.
Rnd 30: [Sc in next 4 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 7 times – 35 sc.
Rnd 31: [Sc in next 5 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 5 times – 30 sc.
Rnd 32: [Sc in next 3 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times – 24 sc. Stuff and shape head. Sew arms and legs onto body: leaving a 6” tail on outer side of arm or leg, stitch through limb and into body and back through limb several times at the same point (this method allows limbs to be movable), then tie yarn ends together in a knot; weave ends into arm or leg. Rnd 33: [Sc in next sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 8 times – 16 sc. Stuff body lightly and shape. Weave yarn through the stitches of Rnd 14 (neck), gathering neck to shape. Knot yarn ends together; weave in ends. Rnd 34: Sc in every other sc around – 8 sc. Rnd 35: Slip st in every other sc around. Fasten off.
Assembly
Cup ears and sew them to head. Sew muzzle in place onto head, stuffing lightly. With B in yarn needle, embroider mouth through the muzzle and the stuffing into the head to shape muzzle. Sew nose to muzzle above mouth. Sew eyes in place.

materials: Red Heart® Heat Wave™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 198 yds/181 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Hat: One size to fit adult. Scarf: Approx 9" x 81" [23 x 206 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 13 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
HAT
Note:
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first hdc.
• To join colors, work to last 3 loops on hook at end of rnd. Draw new color through rem loops and proceed with new color. 
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 2. 8 hdc in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc) 8 times. Join. 24 hdc. 
4th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc) 8 times. Join. 32 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc) 8 times. Join. 40 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc) 8 times. Join. 48 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join C at end of rnd.
8th rnd: With C, ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc) 8 times. Join A at end of rnd. 56 hdc.
9th rnd: With A, as 7th rnd.
10th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc) 8 times. Join. 64 hdc. 
11th to 14th rnds: As 7th rnd. Join B at end of last rnd. 
15th rnd: With B, as 7th rnd. Join C at end of rnd.
16th rnd: With C, as 7th rnd. Join B at end of rnd.
17th to 22nd rnds: With B, as 7th rnd. Fasten off .
Pompom: Wind C around 4 fingers approx 80 times. Remove from fingers. Tie tightly in center, leaving 2 long ends for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew to Hat. 
SCARF
Note:
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
• To join colors, work to last 3 loops on hook at end of row. Draw new color through rem loops and proceed with new color.
With B, ch 32. 
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 30 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row working in Stripe Pat as follows: 
3rd to 6th rows: With B, joining C at end of last row. 
7th row: With C, joining B at end of row.
8th to 13th rows: With B, joining C at end of last row.
14th to 34th rows: Rep 7th to 13th rows 3 times more.
35th row: With C, joining A at end of row.
36th to 41st rows: With A, joining C at end of last row.
42nd row: With C, joining A at end of row.
Rep 36th to 42nd rows 16 times more.
Next 6 rows: With B, joining C at end of last row.
Next row: With C, joining B at end of row. 
Rep last 7 rows 3 times more.
Next 6 rows: With B. 
Fasten off .
Fringe: Cut strands of A and C 15" [38 cm] long. Taking 2 strands of each together (4 strands total) fold in half and knot into fringe across both ends of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.
Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Patons® Decor (100 g / 3.5 oz) Blanket Pillow
Contrast C (16310 Rich New Lilac) 1 1 ball
Contrast I (16525 Dark New Green) 1 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
measurements: Blanket: Approx 48 x 57 ins [122 x 144.5 cm]. Pillow: Approx 18 ins [45.5 cm] square (excluding edging).
gauge: 15 dc and 7 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
BLANKET
LARGE MOTIF
With Color 1, ch 5. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). [3 dc. (Ch 3. 4 dc) 3 times] all in ring. Ch 3. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st in any ch-3 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in same sp as sl st. *1 dc in each dc across to next ch-3 sp. (2 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 dc in each dc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st in any ch-3 sp. As 2nd rnd. Fasten off.
4th rnd: Join Color 4 with sl st in any ch-3 sp. As 2nd rnd. Fasten off.
5th rnd: Join Color 5 with sl st in any ch-3 sp. As 2nd rnd. Do not fasten off.
6th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next dc. *(2 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in each dc across to next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. (2 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in each dc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
7th rnd: Join Color 6 with sl st in any ch-3 sp. As 2nd rnd. Fasten off.
SMALL MOTIF
With Color 1, ch 5. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). [3 dc. (Ch 3. 4 dc) 3 times] all in ring. Ch 3. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st in any ch-3 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in same sp as sl st. *1 dc in each dc across to next ch-3 sp. (2 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 dc in each dc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st in any ch-3 sp. As 2nd rnd. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew Motifs tog following Diagram III (see page 36). 
Edging: 1st rnd: With RS facing, join A with sl st in bottom right corner. Ch 1. Work sc evenly around outer edge of Blanket having 3 sc in each corner. Join B with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. Work 1 sc in each sc around, having 3 sc in each corner sc. Join C with sl st in first sc.
3rd rnd: With C as 2nd rnd, joining D at end of rnd.
4th rnd: With D as 2nd rnd, joining G at end of rnd.
5th rnd: With G as 2nd rnd. Fasten off.

materials: 3 cm [¾”] wide waistband elastic, length as required
matching sturdy thread for elastic casing
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: 12 Fdc = 10 cm [4”]; In shell pattern of yoke, 2 shells = 7.5 cm [3]”; 4 rows = 6.5 cm [2½”]; In shell pattern of body, 2 repeats of shell, ch-4 = 10 cm [4”]; 2 repeats of shell, ch-5 = 11.5 cm [4½”]; 5 rows shell over shell = 10 cm [4”]; Pineapple Lace, at Round 22 (before completing individual points), one repeat = 16.5 [6½”]
instructions:
Round 1 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, dc in same dc as joining, [dc in next dc, ch 5, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc] 19 (21, 23, 25, 27, 29, 31) times, dc in next dc, skip next 2 dc, (ch 3, htr in first dc) to join and form last space; TURN – 20 (22, 24, 26, 28, 30, 32) spaces.
Round 2 (Right Side): Ch 3, tr in first space, [Sh in next space] 19 (21, 23, 25, 27, 29, 31) times, 2 tr in same space as beginning, (ch 1, dc in top of ch-3) to join and form last space and complete last shell; turn – 20 (22, 24, 26, 28, 30, 32) shells.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 dc in first space, [ch 5, 2 dc in next ch-2 space] 19 (21, 23, 25, 27, 29, 31) times, (ch 3, htr in first dc) to join and form last space; turn.
Rounds 4-7: Repeat Rounds 2-3 twice more.
Skirt Hip/ Poncho Shoulder
Round 8: Ch 3, tr in first space – begin round made; [ch 1, Sh in next ch-space] 19 (21, 23, 25, 27, 29, 31) times, ch 1, 2 tr in same space as beginning, (ch 1, dc in top of ch-3) to join and form last space and complete last shell; turn.
Round 9: Begin round, [ch 2, SOS] 19 (21, 23, 25, 27, 29, 31) times, ch 2; 2 tr in same space as beginning, ch 1, dc in top of ch-3; turn – end round made.
Round 10: Begin round, [ch 3, SOS] 19 (21, 23, 25, 27, 29, 31) times, ch 3, end round.
Round 11: Begin round, [ch 4, SOS] 19 (21, 23, 25, 27, 29, 31) times, ch 4, end round.
Note: To shorten or lengthen skirt, omit or add repeats of Round 11 (to hip) and/or Round 14 (to mid-thigh) before beginning pineapple lace, end by working a Round 14.
Rounds 12-13: Repeat Round 11 twice (or for length desired).

Round 14: Begin round, [ch 5, SOS] 19 (21, 23, 25, 27, 29, 31) times, ch 5, end round.
Rounds 15-16: Repeat Round 14 twice (or for length desired).
Pineapple Lace-Round 17: Begin round, * ch 3, tr in next ch-5 space, ch 3, SOS, ch 5 **, SOS; repeat from * around, end at **; end round – 10 (11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16) repeats.
Round 18: Begin round, * ch 4, SOS, skip next ch-3 space, ch 3, 2 tr in next tr, ch 3 **, SOS; repeat from * around, end at **; end round.
Round 19: Begin round, * ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [2 tr in next tr] twice, ch 3, SOS, ch 3 **, SOS; repeat from * around, end at **; end round.
Round 20: Begin round, * ch 3, SOS, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [2 tr in next tr] 4 times, ch 3 **, SOS; repeat from * around, end at **; end round.
Round 21: Begin round, * ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, tr in next tr, [ch 1, tr in next tr] 7 times, ch 3, SOS, ch 1 **, SOS; repeat from * around, end at **; end round.
Round 22: Begin round, * ch 1, SOS, [ch 3, dcin next ch-1 space] 7 times, ch 3 **, SOS; repeat from * around, end at **; end round.

Pineapple Points (Complete each point separately)
First Point-Row 1 (Wrong Side): Ch 3, (tr, ch 2, 2 tr) all in first space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [dc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] 6 times, SOS; TURN.
Row 2: Ch 2, SOS, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [dc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] 5 times, SOS; turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, SOS, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [dc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] 4 times, SOS; turn.
Row 4: Ch 2, SOS, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [dc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] 3 times, SOS; turn.
Row 5: Ch 2, SOS, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, [dc in next ch-3 space, ch 3] twice, SOS; turn.
Row 6: Ch 2, SOS, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, dcin next ch-3 space, ch 3, SOS; turn.
Row 7: Ch 2, SOS, ch 1, SOS; turn.
Row 8: Ch 2, 2 tr in ch-2 space of first shell, 2 tr in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 2, slip st in next tr of shell. Fasten off.
For remaining 9 (10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15) pineapple points; with wrong side of skirt facing, join yarn in ch-2 space of next shell and repeat Rows 1-8 of First Point.

Waistband
Round 1: With right side facing, join yarn in any ch of foundation at waist; ch 1, dc in same ch, dc in each ch around; join in first dc; turn.
Rounds 2-5: Ch 1, dc in each dc around; join; turn. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

Elastic
Cut waistband elastic to fit waist plus a few cm [inches] overlap. Secure thread around the stem of any dc of Round 1 of waistband on the wrong side. Holding elastic along inside of waistband, moving from left to right, make a herringbone stitch casing: Skip the dc of Round 5 directly above beginning dc of Round 1, insert needle around post of next dc of Round 5, make a backstitch; skip next dc of Round 1, backstitch around post of next dc; skip next dc of Round 5, backstitch around post of next dc, working over elastic each time, careful not to catch elastic, sliding elastic as you go as needed to distribute fullness of waistband all around. End with backstitch in same dc as beginning. Secure and cut thread. Overlap ends of elastic and sew together securely.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein 1704 Bubblegum A
RED HEART® Boutique Sashay®: 1 ball 1953 Tutu B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6mm [J-10 US] and 5mm [H-8 US]
Yarn needle, stitch marker, sewing needle and thread to match
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Diaper Cover measures 18 (19, 20)” [45.5 (48.5, 51) cm] circumference at waist. Hat measures 17” (43 cm) circumference.
gauge: 9 sts = 4” (10 cm) in pattern; 12 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet with larger hook. 12 sts = 4” (10 cm) in pattern; 10 rows = 4” (10 cm) in half double crochet with smaller hook.
instructions:
DIAPER COVER
Front
With larger hook and A, ch 21 (23, 25).
Row 1 (right side): Sc in second ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—20 (22, 24) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until front measures 3½ (4½, 5½)” [9 (11.5, 14) cm], ending on right side row.
Leg openings
Row 1: Slip st in first 3 sts, sc in next 14 (16, 18) sts; leave last 3 sts unworked, turn—14 (16, 18) sc.
Row 2 (right side): Sc2tog, sc in each st to last 2 st, sc2tog, turn—12 (14, 16) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st, turn.
Rows 4–9 (11, 13): Repeat Rows 2 and 3 three (four, five) times—6 sc.
Row 10 (12, 14): Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st, turn—8 sc.
Row 11 (13, 15): Ch 1, sc in each st, turn.
Rows 12 (14, 16)–17 (21, 25): Repeat Rows 10 (12, 14) and 11 (13, 15) three (four, five) times, turn—14 (16, 18) sc.
Rows 18 (22, 26) and 19 (23, 27): Ch 4, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch, sc in each st across, turn—20 (22, 24) sc.
Directions are for size Infant 3 months. Changes for sizes Infant 6 months and Infant 12 months are in parentheses.
Back
