Row 20 (24, 28): Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st, turn.
Row 21 (25, 29): Ch 1, sc in each st, turn.
Repeat last 2 rows until back measures 3½ (4½, 5½)” [9 (11.5, 14) cm] from Row 19 (23, 27), ending with a Row 21 (25, 29).
Fasten off.
Ruffles
*Join B with slip st (see Special Techniques) to first unworked front loop of Row 20 (24, 28), ch 1, sc in each unworked loop across. Fasten off. Repeat from * for each right side row to top of back.
Optional: With sewing needle and matching thread, sew down the loose ends of B at last st of each row. With A, sew side seams.
Waistband
With right side facing and larger hook, join A with slip st in last st before side seam.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 4 (counts as first dc and ch 1), skip next st, *dc in next st, ch 1, skip next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4—20 (22, 24) dc and 20 (22, 24) ch-1 sps.
Round 2: Ch 1, reverse sc in each dc and ch-1 space around; join with slip st in first st—40 (44, 48) reverse sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Join A with sc in any st of leg opening and sc evenly spaced around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Repeat for 2nd leg opening. Weave in ends.
Cut two 1 yd (1 m) lengths of B for ties. Make a knot at each end to prevent tearing. Thread through ch-1 spaces of front from side seam to side seam; repeat for back. Tie bows at sides.
HAT
With smaller hook and A, ch 7.
Round 1: Work 3 sc in second ch from hook, hdc in next 4 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working on opposite side of foundation ch, hdc in next 4 ch—14 sts. Place marker in first st and move up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [2 sc in next 3 sc, hdc in next 4 hdc] twice—20 sts.
Round 3: *[Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, hdc in next 4 hdc; repeat from * once—26 sts.
Round 4: *[Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, hdc in next 4 hdc; repeat from * once—32 sts.
Round 5: *[Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, hdc in next 4 hdc; repeat from * once—38 sts.
Round 6: *[Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, hdc in next 4 hdc; repeat from * once—44 sts.
Round 7: *[Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, hdc in next 4 hdc; repeat from * once—50 sts.
Round 8: Hdc in each st around.
Repeat last round until hat measures 5½” (14 cm). Do not fasten off.
Brim
Round 1: [Work 2 hdc in next 12 sts, sc in next 13 sts] twice—74 sts.
Round 2: *[Hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st] 12 times, hdc in next 13 sts; repeat from * once—98 sts.
Round 3: Hdc in each st; join with slip st in first st.
Round 4: Ch 1, reverse sc in each st; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off.
FINISHING HAT
Weave in ends.
Hatband  
Cut a 19” (48.5 cm) length of B. Fold under ½” (1.5 cm) on each end and sew ends together with matching thread. Place just above brim, positioning seam where bow will be sewn; tack in place.
Bow  
Cut 5” (12.5 cm) and 10” (25.5 cm) lengths of B. Tie a knot in each end of longer piece. Fold into a bow shape (two loops and two straight ends). Wrap shorter piece of B around center of bow. Using sewing needle and matching thread, sew to hatband over seam.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® 1000 g™ (35 oz/1000 g; 1856 yds/1698 m)
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Sizes Child Adult Small Adult Large. Hat: 18¼" [46.5 cm] 19½" [49.5 cm] 21" [53.5 cm] around. Mittens: 6 x 7½" [15 x 19 cm] 7½ x 11½" [19 x 29 cm] 9½ x 12" [24 x 30.5 cm] circumference x length. Scarf: Approx 7" [18 cm] x 72" [183 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook. 14 sc and 16 rnds = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written Child ( Adult S - Adult L ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
SCARF
With larger hook, ch 24.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 22 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Repeat 2nd row until Scarf measures 72" [183 cm]. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut 90 lengths of yarn 10" [25.5 cm] long. Divide into 18 groups of 5 strands each - 9 groups for each end of Scarf.
Spacing fringe groups evenly along short ends of Scarf, fold a fringe group in half to form a loop. Draw center of fringe group through end of Scarf, using crochet hook if desired. Thread fringe tails through loop and tighten to secure. Rep for each group of fringe. Trim fringe ends evenly.
HAT
Cuff: With larger hook ch 64 ( 68-74). Join with sl st to first ch, taking care chain is not twisted.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st in back loop of first sc. Turn. 64 ( 68-74) sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc around. Join with sl st in back loop of first sc. Turn.
Rep 2nd rnd until work from beg measures 5 ( 5½-5½)" [ 12.5 ( 14-14) cm] slightly stretched. Do not turn at end of last rnd.
Crown: Change to smaller hook.
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: (RS) Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Do not turn.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 9 ( 10-10)" [ 23 ( 25.5-25.5) cm], decreasing 0 ( 0-2) sc on last round. 64 ( 68-72) sc.
Shape Top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. [Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 ( 12-13) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc] 4 times. Join. 56 ( 60-64) sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. [Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 ( 10-11) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc] 4 times. Join. 48 ( 52-56) sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. [Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 ( 8-9) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc] 4 times. Join. 40 ( 44-48) sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. [Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 ( 6-7) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc] 4 times. Join. 32 ( 36-40) sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. [Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 ( 4-5) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc] 4 times. Join. 24 ( 28-32) sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. [Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 1 ( 2-3) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc] 4 times. Join. 16 ( 20-24) sts.
Adult Small and Adult Large Sizes Only: Next rnd: Ch 1. [Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next ( 0-1) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc] 4 times. Join. ( 12-16) sts.
All Sizes: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Weave end through rem sts and draw up tightly. Fasten securely.
MITTENS
Cuff: With smaller hook, ch 15 ( 21-24).
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. 14 ( 20-23) sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row 16 ( 20-22) times more. Join 1st and last rows of Cuff using flat sl st join through both thicknesses. Note: Keep working yarn to WS of work so only flat sl st chain is visible on RS. Do not fasten off.
FLAT SL ST JOINING DIAGRAM
Hand: 1st rnd: Working into row ends on Cuff, work 18 ( 22-26) sl sts loosely evenly around. Join with sl st to first st.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in each of next 8 ( 10-12) sts. 2 sc in next st] twice. Join. 20 ( 24-28) sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in each of next 9 ( 11-13) sc. 2 sc in next sc] twice. Join. 22 ( 26-30) sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in each of next 10 ( 12-14) sc. 2 sc in next sc] twice. Join. 24 ( 28-32) sc.
Adult Small and Adult Large sizes only: 5th rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in each of next ( 13-15) sc. 2 sc in next sc] twice. Join. ( 30-34) sc.
Adult Large size only: 6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 16 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 17 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 38 sc.
All sizes: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Rep last rnd 0 ( 2-2) times more. Thumb Opening: Next rnd: Ch 1. [1 sc in next 20 ( 26-32) sc. Ch 4 ( 5-6). Skip rem sts. Join with slip st to first sc. Upper Hand: Note: Upper Hand is worked in continuous rnds. Do not join. PM at end of each rnd to keep count.
Next rnd: 1 sc in each st around. Rep last rnd 7 ( 8-11) times more. 24 ( 31-38) sc.
Adult Small size only: Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc around. 30 sts.
All Sizes: Upper Hand Shaping 1st rnd: [1 sc in each of next 10 ( 13-17) sc. Sc2tog] twice. 22 ( 28-36) sts.
2nd rnd: [1 sc in each of next 9 ( 12-16) sc. Sc2tog] twice. 20 ( 26-34) sts.
3rd rnd: [1 sc in each of next 8 ( 11-15) sc. Sc2tog] twice. 18 ( 24-32) sts.
4th rnd: [1 sc in each of next 7 ( 10-14) sc. Sc2tog] twice. 16 ( 22-30) sts.
Adult Small and Adult Large sizes only: 5th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
6th rnd: [1 sc in each of next ( 9-13) sc. Sc2tog] twice. ( 20-28) sts.
Next rnd: (Sc2tog) ( 10-14) times. All sizes: Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 8 ( 5-7) times. Fasten off. Weave end through rem sts and draw up tightly. Fasten securely.
Thumb: 1st rnd: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st, to thumb opening, closest to Upper Hand. Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. 8 ( 9-12) sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Rep 2nd rnd 3 ( 6-7) times more. Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join. 6 ( 7-10) sts.
Final rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 ( 3-5) times. 1 sc in last 0 ( 1-0) sc. Join. 3 ( 4-5) sts. Fasten off. Weave end through rem sts and draw up tightly. Fasten securely.

pattern_name: Bernat Handicrafter Cotton Baby Crochet Bibs and Booties
materials: Bernat Handicrafter Cotton Baby Solids (400 g/14 oz) or Ombres (340 g/12 oz)
1 ball of Baby Blue or Baby Lullaby or Baby Green or Baby Lilac or Baby Pink or Baby Pastels or Baby Yellow
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: To fit baby: Newborn to 6 mos.
gauge: 13H sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
BIB: Ch 20.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 19 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th to 9th rows: Rep last 2 rows 3 times more. 27 sc.
Cont even until work from beg measures 6 ins [15 cm], ending with RS facing for next row.
Shape neck: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sts. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn. 5 sts.
Work 10 rows even.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows twice more. Fasten off.
With RS of work facing, miss next 11 sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Ch 1. Sc2tog over this st and next st. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Work to correspond to first side, reversing all shapings.
Edging: Join yarn with sl st to top left corner of neck edge. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 1 row sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next row: Working around outer edge only, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 3. Sl st in first ch – picot made. Rep from * to top right corner. Ch 6 for button loop. 1 sc in next sp. Fasten off. Sew button in position.
BOOTIES: Ch 14.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 13 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row for 6G ins [16 cm] when slightly stretched. Do not fasten off.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 23 sc evenly across long edge of cuff. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Instep: 1st row: With RS of work facing, miss first 7 sts. Join yarn with sl st to next st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Turn. 9 sts.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Fasten off.
Sew center back seam. With RS of work facing, join yarn with sl st at center back. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. 5 sc down side of instep. 3 sc in corner sc. 3 sc across end of instep. 3 sc in corner sc. 5 sc along other side of instep. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Join with sl st to first st. 33 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, work 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off. Sew sole seam.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 8 skeins 4334 Buff Fleck A
1 skein each of 672 Spring Green B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 8 mm [US L-11] and 4 mm [US G-6]
measurements: Mat measures 31 x 41” (53.5 x 104 cm), not including border
gauge: 9 sts = 4” (10 cm); 6 rows = 4” (10 cm) in alternating rows
instructions:
Notes
1. Rug is worked with two strands of yarn held together and larger hook. All other pieces are worked with a single strand of yarn and smaller hook.
2. Gauge is not critical for this project. Work all pieces that will be stuffed, tight enough that the stuffing will not show through stitches.

MAT
With larger hook and 2 strands of A held together, ch 67.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc) and in each remaining ch across, turn—65 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each dc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 4–61: Repeat last 2 rows 29 times. Do not fasten off.

Border
Round 1: Ch 1, sc evenly spaced around entire outer edge of piece, working 3 sc in each corner; change to 2 strands of B in last sc; join with slip st in first sc, turn.
Round 2 (wrong side): With B, ch 1, lpst in same st as joining and in each remaining st around; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off.

LONG ROAD
With smaller hook and one strand of D, ch 19.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, turn—18 sc.
Rows 2–58: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), dc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Refer to photograph, sew road across rug, covering (approximately) Rows 32–39 of rug.

MEDIUM ROAD
Make same as long road through Row 40. Sew from top edge of rug down to long road and about 3” (7.5 cm) from side edge.

SHORT ROAD
Make same as long road through Row 26. Sew from lower edge of rug up to long road and about 3” (7.5 cm) from side edge (opposite side edge from medium road).

LAKE
With smaller hook and one strand of H, ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 sc in each of next 2 ch, sc in last ch, turn—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 3-5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—12 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 7: Ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—15 sc.
Row 8: Repeat Row 3—17 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—18 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 11 and 12: Repeat Row 3 twice—22 sc.
Row 13: Ch 10, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 8 ch, sc in each sc across, turn—31 sc.
Rows 14–31: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 32: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc in each remaining sc across, turn—30 sc.
Row 33: Ch 1, sc in each sc across to last 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc, turn—29 sc.
Rows 34–37: Repeat Rows 32 and 33 twice—25 sc at the end of Row 37.
Rows 38–41: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 42–48: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc in each sc across to last 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc, turn—11 sc at the end of Row 48.
Rows 49–52: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 53–55: Repeat Row 42 three times—5 sc. Do not fasten off.

Border
Round 1: Ch 1, sc evenly spaced around entire outer edge of piece, increasing as needed to keep piece flat; change to one strand of B in last sc; join with slip st in first sc, turn.
Round 2 (wrong side): With B, ch 1, lpst in same st as joining and in each remaining st around; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off.
Sew lake to rug, above the long road and to the side of the medium road.

PALM TREES
COCONUTS (make 2 for each small palm tree, and one for large palm tree or as many as desired)
With smaller hook and one strand of C, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rounds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through remaining 6 sts and pull to gather.

One small palm tree measures 7” (18 cm) tall

SMALL PALM TREE (make as many as desired)
Frond (make 2 for each tree or as many as desired)
With smaller hook and one strand of B, ch 6.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, [ch 6, sc in next ch] 3 times, ch 6, (sc, ch 6, sc) in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, [ch 6, sc in next ch] 4 times. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing to tree.

Trunk (make 1 for each tree)
Beginning at top of trunk with smaller hook and one strand of D, ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—7 sc.
Rows 2–15: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 16: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, change to A in last sc, turn.
Row 17: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across, turn—14 sc.
Row 18: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 7 times, turn—21 sc.
Row 19: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 20: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 7 times, turn—28 sc.
Row 21: Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 22: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 23: Working both loops, [sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 7 times, turn—21 sc.
Row 24: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 10 times, sc in last sc, turn—11 sc.
Row 25: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 5 times, sc in last sc—6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through last 6 stitches and pull to gather. Continuing with tail, sew side edges of lower section together, and stuff very lightly. With D, sew remainder of side edge together, stuffing as you go. Sew all fronds to top, gathering top as you sew. Sew coconuts to top of trunk, below fronds. Weave in ends.

One large palm tree measures 10” (25.5 cm) tall

LARGE PALM TREE (make as many as desired) 
Frond (make 4 for each tree or as many as desired)
Make the same as small palm tree fronds.

Large Frond (make 2 for each tree or as many as desired)
With smaller hook and one strand of B, ch 11.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, [ch 6, sc in next ch] 8 times, ch 6, (sc, ch 6, sc) in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, [ch 6, sc in next ch] 9 times. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing to tree.

Trunk (make 1 for each tree)
With smaller hook and one strand of D, beginning at top of trunk, ch 15.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—14 sc.
Rows 2–27: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 28: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, change to A in last sc, turn.
Row 29: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across, turn—28 sc.
Row 30: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 14 times, turn—42 sc.
Row 31: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 32: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 14 times, turn—56 sc.
Row 33: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 34: Ch 1, working in front loops only, ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 14 times, turn—42 sc.
Row 35: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 36: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, sc2tog] 14 times, turn—28 sc.
Row 37: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 38: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 14 times, turn—14 sc.
Row 39: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 7 times—7 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through last 7 stitches and pull to gather. Continuing with tail, sew side edges of lower section together, and stuff very lightly. With D, sew remainder of side edge together, stuffing as you go. Sew all fronds to top, gathering top as you sew. Sew one coconut to top of trunk, below fronds. Weave in ends.

JEEP
Note
Sides, front, back, bottom, and hood of jeep are all double-layered. Two pieces are made and then joined around edges and stuffed. This makes the jeep sturdy.

Side (make 4)
Beginning at front edge with smaller hook and one strand of G, ch 10.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—9 sc.
Rows 2–8: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, sc2tog, turn; leave remaining sts unworked—6 sc.
Row 10: Do not ch 1, skip the sc2tog, sc2tog, sc in last 3 sc, turn—4 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—3 sc.
Rows 12–14: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 15: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—4 sc.
Row 16: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in last 3 sc, turn—5 sc.
Row 17: Ch 1, sc in next 5 sc, turn.
Row 18: Ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, sc in next 5 sc, turn—9 sc.
Rows 19–23: Ch 1, sc in next 9 sc, turn.
Fasten off.

Joining Round: Hold two side pieces together, matching sts. With one strand of G and working through both thicknesses, join yarn with sc anywhere in edge of pieces, sc evenly spaced all the way around, working 3 sc in each corner and stuffing lightly before closing completely. Repeat to join other two side pieces.

Front (make 2)
With smaller hook and one strand of G, ch 10.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—9 sc.
Rows 2–12: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off.

Joining Round: Hold two front pieces together, matching sts. With one strand of G and working through both thicknesses, join yarn with sc anywhere in edge of pieces, sc evenly spaced all the way around, working 3 sc in each corner and stuffing lightly before closing completely.

Back (make 2)
Make same as front.

Hood (make 2)
With smaller hook and one strand of G, ch 11.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—10 sc.
Rows 2–8: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off.

Joining Round: Hold two hood pieces together, matching sts. With one strand of G and working through both thicknesses, join yarn with sc anywhere in edge of pieces, sc evenly spaced all the way around, working 3 sc in each corner and stuffing lightly before closing completely.

Bottom (make 2 – 1 with F and 1 with H)
With smaller hook and one strand of yarn, ch 11.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—10 sc.
Rows 2–23: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off.

Joining Round: Hold two bottom pieces together, matching sts. With one strand of G and working through both thicknesses, join yarn with sc anywhere in edge of pieces, sc evenly spaced all the way around, working 3 sc in each corner and stuffing lightly before closing completely.

Assemble Body of Jeep
Arrange front, sides, and back into a square. Take care that openings in sides match. With G and sewing through 2 loops, sew corners together. With G, sew hood to top of sides and front. With G, sew bottom to bottom of jeep, take care to place H-colored side of up, so that it forms the inside floor of the jeep. Weave in ends.

Grill
With smaller hook and one strand of I, ch 7.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—6 sc.
Rows 2–6: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Using photograph as a guide, sew to front center of jeep. With F, embroider 2 vertical lines evenly spaced on front of grill.

Headlight (make 2)
With smaller hook and one strand of E, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc around.
Round 4: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 4 times—8 sc.
Fasten off. Stuff and sew to front of jeep, sewing one headlight to each side of grill.

Wheel Front (make 5)
With smaller hook and one strand of H, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc. Fasten off.
Round 3: With right side facing, join I with sc in any st, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc. Fasten off.
Round 5: With right side facing, join F with sc in any st, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—30 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off.

Wheel Back (make 5)
With smaller hook and one strand of F, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc. 
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc. 
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Hold one wheel front and one wheel back with stitches of last round matching. With tail sew pieces together, stuffing piece before closing. With I, sew through both thicknesses, between Rounds 2 and 3, sewing around in a circle to pull center of wheel in. Sew one wheel at each corner of sides of jeep. Sew one wheel to back of jeep.

Steering Wheel
With smaller hook and one strand of H, ch 12; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in same ch as joining, sc in each remaining ch around—12 sc.
Round 2: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 3: Slip st in each sc around. Fasten off. Sew steering wheel to inside edge of hood, to one side.

ROWBOAT
Note
Sides, back, and bottom of rowboat are all double-layered. Two pieces are made and then joined around edges and stuffed. This makes the boat sturdy.

Side (make 4)
With smaller hook and one strand of J, ch 21.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—20 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 19 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—21 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 18 sc, hdc in next 2 sc, 2 hdc in last sc, turn—22 sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 18 sc, hdc in next 3 sc, 2 hdc in last sc, turn—23 sts.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in first 18 sc, hdc in next 4 sc, 2 hdc in last sc, turn—24 sts. Fasten off.

Joining Round: Hold two side pieces together, matching sts. With one strand of J and working through both thicknesses, join yarn with sc anywhere in edge of pieces, sc evenly spaced all the way around, working 3 sc in each corner and stuffing lightly before closing completely. Repeat to join other two side pieces.

Back (make 2)
With smaller hook and one strand of J, ch 11.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—10 sc.
Rows 2–8: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.

Joining Round: Hold two back pieces together, matching sts. With one strand of J and working through both thicknesses, join yarn with sc anywhere in edge of pieces, sc evenly spaced all the way around, working 3 sc in each corner and stuffing lightly before closing completely. 

Bottom (make 2)
With smaller hook and one strand of E, ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—10 sc.
Rows 4–8: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—8 sc.

materials: StitcH NatioN by Debbie Stoller™ “alpaca Love™”: 2 balls 3350 Espresso a, and 1 ball 3810 Lake B.
crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9] and 6.5mm [US K-10 ½].
abbreviations: FBtr2tog (Front and Back tr2tog): yo twice, insert hook in specified st working in front of the previous row, yo, draw through st, [yo and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice (2 loops remain on hook), yo twice, insert hook in same st working behind the previous row, yo, draw through st, [yo and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice (3 loops remain on hook), yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

a, B, c = color A, B, C; ch = chain; dc = double crochet; hdc = half double crochet; mm = millimeters; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); tr = treble crochet; [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified; * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 6” wide x 29½” long. Hat measures 21½” in circumference.
gauge: With larger hook, 15 sts = 4”; 0 rows = 4”. With smaller hook, first 4 rounds of hat = 4” in diameter. cHEcK YoUR GaUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Hat
With smaller hook and a, ch 4, join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring, join with a slip st in first sc – 8 sc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in same st, 2 dc in each dc around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2 – 16 dc.
Round 3: Ch 2, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next st, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with sl st in top of beginning ch-2 – 24 dc.
Round 4: Ch 2, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, *dc in each of next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with sl st in top of beginning ch-2 – 32 dc.
Round 5: Ch 2, dc in each of next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st; *dc in each of next 3 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2 – 40 dc.
Round 6: Ch 2, dc in each of next 3 sts, 2 dc in next; *dc in each of next 4 sts, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with sl st in top of beginning ch-2 – 48 dc.
Round 7: Ch 2, dc in each of next 4 sts, 2 dc in next st; *dc in each of next 5 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with sl st in top of beginning ch-2 – 56 dc.
Round 8: Ch 2, dc in each of next 5 sts, 2 dc in next st; *dc in each of next 6 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with sl st in top of beginning ch-2 – 64 dc.
Round 9: Ch 2, dc in each of next 6 sts, 2 dc in next st; *dc in each of next 7 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with sl st in top of beginning ch-2 – 72 dc.
Round 10: Ch 2, dc in each st around; join with sl st in top of beginning ch-2 – 72 dc.
Round 11: Ch 1, sc in same st, ch 1, skip next st, *sc in next st, ch 1, skip next st; repeat from * around; join with sl st in first sc – 36 sc; 36 ch-1 spaces.
Round 12: Ch 5 (counts as tr, ch 1), skip next st; *tr in next st, ch 1, skip next st; repeat from * around; join with sl st in 4th ch of beginning ch-5 – 36 tr; 36 ch-1 spaces, switching to B in last st, drop a, do not cut.
Round 13: With B, ch 1, sc in first st, *FBtr2tog in unused st 2 rounds below, sc in next st on current rnd; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with sl st in first sc, switching to a in last st – 36 sc; 36 FBtr2tog.
Round 14: With a, repeat round 11.
Round 15: With a, repeat round 12.
Round 16: With B, repeat round 13.
Round 17: With a, ch 1, sc in same st, sc in each st around, join with sl st in first sc – 72 sc. Fasten off.
Scarf
With larger hook and a, ch 16.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 15 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 5 (counts as tr, ch 1), skip next st, *tr in next st, ch 1, skip next st; repeat from * across to last st, tr in last st, switching to B in last st, turn – 8 tr; 7 ch-1 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, *FBtr2tog in unused sc 2 rows below, sc in next tr on current row; repeat from * across, switching to a in last st, turn – 7 FBtr2tog; 8 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first st, *ch 1, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * across, switching to B in last st, turn – 8 sc, 7 ch-1 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 5 (counts as tr plus 1 ch), *skip next st, tr in next st, ch 1; repeat from * across to last st, tr in last st, switching to a in last st, turn – 8 tr, 7 ch-1 spaces.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in same st, *FBtr2tog in unused st 2 rows below, sc in next tr on current row; repeat from * across, switching to B in last st, turn – 7 FBtr2tog; 8 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first st, *ch 1, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * across, switching to a in last st, turn – 8 sc; 7 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 8-49: Repeat rows 2-7, 7 times.
Rows 50-53: Repeat rows 2-5.
Row 54: (buttonhole row) Ch 1, turn, sc in same st, *FBtr2tog in unused sc 2 rows below, sc in next tr on current row*; repeat from * to * 3 times, sc in next ch-1 space, sc in next st; repeat from * to * 3 times, switching to B in last st, turn – 6 FBtr2tog; 9 sc.
Row 55: Repeat row 7.
Rows 56-60: Repeat rows 2-6, do not change color after row 60. Do not fasten off.
Edging 
Round 1: With a, ch 1, sc in each st across top edge (15 sc), working along long side edge, work 81 sc evenly spaced across, working across foundation row, sc in each ch across (15 sc), working along long side, work 81 sc evenly spaced across, join with sl st in first sc – 192 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, hdc in next st, dc in next st, ch 2, *sc in next st, hdc in next st, dc in next st, ch 2; repeat from * around; join with sl st in first sc – 64 repeats. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
FiniSHinG
With needle and matching thread sew button onto stitch number 8 of row 9 on right side of scarf.

materials: Cream 14 ¼ oz (405 g) for size 6
Cream 3½ oz (100 g) for Doll's Version
Sizes G/6 (4.00 mm), H/8 (5.00 mm), and K/10 ½ (6.50 mm) crochet hooks
abbreviations: CL = (Yoh. Draw up a loop in next st) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all 7 loops on hook.
measurements: Sizes for Girl’s Version: Chest measurement 2 22 ins [56 cm], 4 24 ins [61 cm], 6 26 ins [66 cm]; Finished chest 2 26 ins [66 cm], 4 28 ins [71 cm], 6 30 ins [76 cm]; Doll’s Version Size: To fit 18 ins [45 cm] Springfield Collection Doll.
gauge: Cardigan: 12 dc and 8 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with size H/8 hook. Hat: 14 dc and 9 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with size G/6 hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes, the instructions will be written thus (  ).

Girl’s Cardigan
Note: Cardigan is worked sideways.

BACK
With size H/8 hook, ch 36 (42-46).
1st row:(WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as first dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn.
34 (40-44) sts.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as first dc). Miss first dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 13 (14-15) ins [33 (35.5-38) cm]. Fasten off.

RIGHT FRONT
With size K/10½ hook, ch 36 (42-46) loosely. (Front edge).
1st row: With size H/8 hook, 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 18 (23-26) ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 (2-3) ch. Turn. Leave rem 11 (12-12) ch unworked. 23 (28-32) sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 (2-3) sc. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. Miss first dc. 1 dc in each of next 22 (27-31) sts. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch of foundation ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Turn. Leave rem 5 (6-6) ch unworked. 29 (34-38) sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. Miss first dc. 1 dc in each of next 28 (33-37) sts. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch of foundation ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 1 (2-2) ch. Turn. 34 (40-44) sts.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
7th row: (WS). Ch 5. CL in first sc. Ch 1. Miss next 2 sc. *(1 dc. Ch 2. CL) all in next sc. Ch 1. Miss next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
***8th row: Ch 2. *2 sc in next ch-2 sp. Working behind previous row, 1 dc in next sc of 6th row. Rep from * to turning ch-5. 2 sc in ch-5. 1 sc in 3rd ch of turning ch-5. Turn.
9th row: Ch 3. Miss first st. 1 dc in each st to end of row. 1 dc in top of turning ch-2. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 7th to 10th rows once more.
Next row: As 9th row.
Size 6 only: Next row: Ch 3. Miss first st. 1 dc in each st to end of row.
All Sizes: Fasten off.
***

LEFT FRONT
Rep from ** to ** as given for Right Front. Fasten off. Do not turn.
Rejoin yarn with ss to first sc of last row and proceed as follows:
Next row: (WS). Ch 5. CL in same sc as last ss. Ch 1. Miss next 2 sc. *(1 dc. Ch 2. CL) all in next sc. Ch 1. Miss next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
Rep from *** to *** as given for Right Front.

SLEEVES 
With size H/8 hook, ch 23 (25-25).
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 21 (23-23) sts.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each dc to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. Turn. 23 (25-25) sts.
3rd row: Ch 3. Miss first dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows 5 (8-9) times more, then 2nd row 2 (0-0) times.  37 (41-43) sts. Fasten off.

Sleeve Ribbing (make 2 alike)
With size H/8 hook, ch 5.
****1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in back loop only of each sc to end of row. Turn.****
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 7 (7½-7½) ins  [18 (19-19) cm], when slightly stretched. Fasten off.

Body Ribbing (make 1)
With size H/8 hook, ch 7.
Rep from **** to **** as given for Sleeve Ribbing.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 25 (27-29) ins [63.5 (68.5-73.5) cm], when slightly stretched. Fasten off.

Band: With size H/8 hook, ch 110 (123-136).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 109 (121-135) sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 82 (91-98) sc. [Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 (6-6) sc] 4 (4-5) times. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 (2-2) sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and ch-1 sp to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams. Place markers 6 (6½-7) ins [15 (16.5-18) cm] down from shoulder seams on Fronts and Back of Cardigan. Sew in Sleeves between markers. Sew ribbing onto Sleeves. Sew Sleeve and side seams. Sew ribbing onto Body. Sew Band onto Cardigan. Sew buttons to correspond to buttonholes.

Girl’s Cap
With size G/6 hook, ch 4. Ss to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as first dc). 11 dc in ring. Ss to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last ss. 2 dc in each dc around. Ss to top of ch 3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last ss. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Ss to top of ch 3. 36 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last ss. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Ss to top of ch 3. 48 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last ss. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Ss to top of ch 3. 60 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last ss. *1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 9 dc. 1 dc in each of last 9 dc. Ss to top of ch 3. 66 dc.
7th rnd: Ch 3. Miss first dc (where last ss was worked). 1 dc in next dc and each dc around. Ss to top of ch 3.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. 1 sc in each dc around. Ss in first sc.
9th rnd: Ch 5. CL in same st as last ss. Ch 1. Miss next 2 sc. *(1 dc. Ch 2. CL) all in next st. Ch 1. Miss next 2 sc. Rep from * to end of rnd. Ss in 3rd ch of ch-5.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first ch-2 sp. Working behind previous rnd, 1 dc in next sc of 8th rnd. *2 sc in next ch-2 sp. Working behind previous rnd, 1 dc in next sc of 8th rnd. Rep from * to end of rnd. Ss in first sc.
11th rnd: Ch 3. Miss first sc (where last ss was worked). 1 dc in next sc and each st around. Ss to top of ch 3.
Rep 8th to 11th rnds once more, then 8th rnd once. Fasten off.

Doll’s Cardigan
Note: Cardigan is worked sideways.

BACK
With size H/8 hook, ch 24.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as first dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 22 sts.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as first dc). Miss first dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 6½ins [16.5 cm]. Fasten off.

FRONTS (make 2 alike)
With size H/8 hook, ch 24 loosely. 1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 20 ch. 22 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 5. CL in first sc. Ch 1. Miss next 2 sc. *(1 dc. Ch 2. CL) all in next sc. Ch 1. Miss next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. *2 sc in next ch-2 sp. Working behind previous row, 1 dc in next sc of 3rd row. Rep from * to turning ch-5. 2 sc in ch-5. 1 sc in 3rd ch of turning ch-5. Turn.
6th row: Ch 3. Miss first st. 1 dc in each st to end of row. 1 dc in top of turning ch-2. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
8th and 9th rows: Ch 3. Miss first st. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of 9th row.

SLEEVES 
With size H/8 hook, ch 15.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 14 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. Miss first st. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each dc to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep 3rd and 4th rows twice more. 20 sts. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Place markers on top edge of Back, 2½ins [6 cm] in from left and right sides. Sew Fronts to Back along shoulders to markers. Place markers 3¼ins [8.5 cm] down from shoulder seams on Fronts and Back. Sew in Sleeves between markers. Sew side and sleeve seams. 
Front, Neck and Bottom Edging: Join yarn with ss to bottom corner of Right Front. With size H/8 hook, ch 1. Work 21 sc up right front, 3 sc in corner st, 24 sc around neck edge, 3 sc in corner st, and 21 sc down Left Front. Ch 1. Work 45 sc along bottom edge.
2nd row: (Bottom edge only). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 45 sc. Fasten off.

Sew on buttons as illustrated. Note: Spaces between dc posts create buttonholes.

Doll’s Cap
With size G/6 hook, ch 4. Ss to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as first dc). 11 dc in ring. 12 dc. Ss to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last ss. 2 dc in each dc around. 24 dc. Ss to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last ss. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Ss to top of ch 3. 36 dc. Ss to top of ch 3.
4th to 7th rnds: Ch 3. Miss first dc (where last ss was worked). 1 dc in next dc and each dc around. Ss to top of ch 3.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc around. Ss in first sc. Fasten off.

pattern_name: Crochet Spiral Hat & Ribbed Scarf Set
materials: Red Heart® Heat Wave™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 198 yds/181 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Hat: To fit child 2/4 (6/8) yrs. Scarf: Approx 5" x 35" [12.5 x 89 cm].
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.

HAT
Notes:
• When working in rnds, RS of work will be facing you, however you will be working into sts on WS.
• Rnds are worked in a spiral. Do not join at end of rnds.
• Place marker on first st at end of each rnd and move marker each rnd.

Ch 3.
1st rnd: (RS). 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook.
2nd rnd: *Work 2 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram). Rep from * around. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: *Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar in next st. Work 2 hdc in horizontal bar in next st. Rep from * around. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: *Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar in each of next 2 sts. Work 2 hdc in horizontal bar in next st. Rep from * around. 32 hdc.
5th rnd: *Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar in each of next 3 sts. Work 2 hdc in horizontal bar in next st. Rep from * around. 40 hdc.
6th rnd: *Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar in each of next 4 sts. Work 2 hdc in horizontal bar in next st. Rep from * around. 48 hdc.
7th rnd: *Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar in each of next 5 sts. Work 2 hdc in horizontal bar in next st. Rep from * around. 56 hdc.
8th rnd: *Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar in each of next 27 (6) sts. Work 2 hdc in horizontal bar in next st. Rep from * around. 58 (64) hdc.
9th rnd: *Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar in each st around. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 6½ (7½)" [16.5 (19) cm].
Final rnd: Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar in each of next 3 sts. Sl st in horizontal bar in each of next 2 sts. Fasten off.
Note: WS of work is shown. Arrow indicates horizontal bar to work into.

Pompom: Wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 100 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Attach to top of Hat.

SCARF
Note: Scarf is worked lengthwise.
• Ch 2 at beg of rows does not count as hdc.

Ch 119.
Foundation row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 117 hdc.
1st row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked - see diagram). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep these 2 rows until work from beg measures approx 5" [12.5 cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off.

pattern_name: Sock It to Me Scarf & Headband
materials: RED HEART® “Heart & Sole® with Aloe”: 2 balls 3965 Razzle Dazzle.
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 4” wide x 60” long (each half measures 4” wide x 30” long). Headband measures 3” wide (including ruffle) x 18” long (slightly stretched).
gauge: 16 sts = 4”; 10 rows = 4” in scarf pattern, using smaller hook; 20 sts = 4” in headband pattern (slightly stretched lengthwise), using larger hook and holding 2 strands of yarn together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
First Half
Foundation ch: With larger hook and 2 strands held together ch 100. Fasten off.
Round 1 (Right Side): With smaller hook, join 1 strand with slip st in first ch of foundation ch, ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 4 dc in same ch, dc in each ch across to last ch, 5 dc in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, dc in each ch across to last ch; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—206 dc. Fasten off.
Round 2 (Right Side): With Right Side facing and smaller hook, working in spaces between sts, join 1 strand with slip st in space between first and 2nd dc of 5-dc group at one end, ch 3, (dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in same space (corner made), dc in next space, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in next space (corner made), dc in each space across to 5-dc group at other end, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in space between first and 2nd dc of 5-dc group (corner made), dc in next space, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in next space (corner made), dc in each space to end of round; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—4 corners, with 1 dc between corners on short ends, and 100 dc between corners on long sides. Fasten off.
Round 3 (Right Side): With Right Side facing and smaller hook, slip st in ch-1 space of first corner, ch 3, dc in same ch-1 space, skip next 2 dc of corner, 2 dc in next space (between last dc of corner and next dc), 2 dc in next space, skip first 2 dc of next corner, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in corner ch-1 space, skip next 2 dc of corner, 2 dc in next space, *skip next space, 2 dc in next space; repeat from * across to next corner, skip first 2 dc of next corner, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in corner ch-1 space, skip next 2 dc of corner, 2 dc in next 2 spaces, skip first 2 dc of next corner, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in corner ch-1 space, skip next 2 dc of corner, 2 dc in next space, **skip next space, 2 dc in next space; repeat from ** to first corner, skip first 2 dc of corner, 2 dc in same ch-1 space as beginning, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Rounds 4 and 5 (Right Side): Ch 3, dc in same ch-1 space (of first corner), skip next dc, 2 dc in next space (between the dc sts of the next 2-dc of corner), *skip next 2 dc, 2 dc in next space (between the dc sts of the next 2-dc of corner), repeat from * across to 1 dc before next corner ch-1 space, skip next dc, [(2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in corner ch-1 space, skip next dc, 2 dc in next space, **skip next 2 dc, 2 dc in next space; repeat from ** across to 1 dc before next corner ch-1 space, skip next dc] 3 times, 2 dc in same ch-1 space as beginning, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off.
Second Half
Make same as first half. Do not fasten off at the end of Round 5.
Join Halves: Hold short edges of both halves together; working through both thicknesses across short edge, slip st in corner ch-1 space, slip st in each space between 2-dc groups across to next corner, slip st in corner ch-1 space. Fasten off. If preferred, fasten off and sew short edges together.
Corner Petals
With Right Side facing and larger hook, join matching color with sc in corner ch-1 space of scarf, [ch 6, sc in same ch-1 space] 5 times. Fasten off. Repeat to work petals in remaining 3 corners.
FInISHInG
Weave in ends.
HEADBAnD
With larger hook and 2 strands held together, ch 14.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc), [ch 1, skip next ch, dc in next ch] 5 times, turn—7 dc and 5 ch-1 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), [dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next dc] 5 times, dc in top of turning ch, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures about 20” from beginning, slightly stretched.
Join Ends: Hold foundation ch and last row together, with sts matching, working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st across. Fasten off.
Ruffle
Join 1 strand with sc in end of any row, ch 5, sc in end of same row, *ch 5, (sc, ch 5, sc) in end of next row; repeat from * around, ch 5; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. With 1 strand repeat around other edge.
FInISHInG
Weave in ends.
RED HEART® “Heart & Sole® with Aloe”, Art. E745 available in solid color and multi color 1.76 oz (50 g), 213 yd (195 m) balls.

materials: RED HEART® Baby Hugs™ Light: 2 balls 3820 Sky A and 1 ball 3001 Frosting B
pompom maker or small piece of heavy cardboard
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Chest: 18" (45.5 cm), Finished Length: 8" (20.5 cm), Hat measures 14" (35.5 cm) circumference at brim.
gauge: 19 sts = 4" (10 cm); 13 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
SWEATER
Right Front
With A, ch 31.
Row 1 (Right Side): Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—30 hdc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, working in back loops only here and throughout, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Repeat Row 2. 
Right Neck Shaping
Row 4: Ch 1, hdc in each st across to last st, 2 hdc in last st, turn—31 hdc.
Row 5: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in each st across, turn—32 hdc.
Rows 6 and 7: Repeat Rows 4 and 5—34 hdc.
Row 8: Repeat Row 2.
Row 9: Ch 5, hdc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch and st across, turn—38 hdc.
Rows 10–13: Repeat Row 2.
Right Armhole Shaping
Row 14: Ch 1, hdc in first 23 sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—23 hdc. 
Rows 15 and 16: Repeat Row 2.
Row 17: Ch 16, hdc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch and st across, turn—38 hdc.
Back
Rows 18–21: Repeat Row 2.
Left Neck Shaping
Row 22: Ch 1, hdc in each st across to last st; leave last st unworked, turn—37 hdc. 
Row 23: Ch 1, hdc2tog, hdc in each st across, turn—36 hdc.
Rows 24–37: Repeat Row 2. 
Rows 38 and 39: Repeat Rows 4 and 5—38 hdc.
Rows 40–43: Repeat Row 2.  
Left Armhole Shaping
Rows 44–51: Repeat Rows 14–21.
Left Front
Row 52: Ch 1, hdc in first 34 sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—34 hdc.
Row 53: Repeat Row 2.
Rows 54–57: Repeat Rows 22 and 23 twice—30 hdc.
Rows 58 and 59: Repeat Row 2. 
Fasten off.
Sew shoulder seams.
SLEEVE (work twice)
Note When changing colors, drop A to right side and B to wrong side of work. 
Round 1: With right side of Armhole facing and working in ends of rows, join A with sc at center of underarm, sc in next row; working in opposite side of Armhole ch, sc in each ch around to underarm, sc in end of next row; join with slip st in first sc, changing to B, turn—33 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, working in back loops only here and throughout, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc, changing to A, turn—33 hdc.
Rounds 3–5: Repeat last round 3 times, alternating colors at end of each round, ending with change to B.
Round 6: Ch 1, hdc2tog, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc, changing to A, turn—32 hdc.
Round 7: Repeat Round 6; change to B—31 hdc.
Rounds 8 and 9: Repeat Round 2, alternating colors at end of each round. 
Rounds 10–17: Repeat Rounds 6 and 7 four times—23 hdc.
Rounds 18–21: Repeat Round 2, alternating colors at end of each round. 
Fasten off A.
Cuff
Rounds 22–24: With B only, repeat Round 2. 
Fasten off.
NECK AND BUTTON BAND
Border
Row 1: With right side facing, join B with sc in first hdc at lower Right Front edge, sc in next 29 hdc up Right Front to Right Neck Shaping; work 12 sc evenly spaced in ends of rows across Right Neck Shaping to right shoulder; work 17 sc evenly spaced in ends of rows across Back neck to left shoulder; work 12 sc evenly spaced in ends of rows across Left Neck Shaping to Left Front; sc in each hdc down Left Front edge, turn—101 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 29 sc, 3 sc in next sc (corner), sc in next 41 sc, 3 sc in next sc (corner), sc in last 29 sc, turn—99 sc and two 3-sc corners. Place 4 markers for buttonholes evenly spaced on right side of Button Band for girl’s sweater or left side for boy’s sweater. 
Row 3: Ch 1, *sc in each sc across to marked sc, ch 2, skip next 2 sts (buttonhole); repeat from * 3 times, sc in each remaining sc, working 3 sc in center st of each corner, turn—91 sc, two 3-sc corners, and 4 ch-2 buttonholes. 
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, working 2 sc in each buttonhole and 3 sc in center st of each corner, turn—109 sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each st across. Fasten off.
Sew buttons opposite buttonholes.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
BOOTIE (make 2)
Leaving a long tail, with A, ch 41.
Row 1 (right side): Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—40 hdc. 
Rows 2–6: Ch 1, working in back loops only here and throughout, hdc in each st across, turn. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Toe Shaping
Row 7: With right side facing, join A with slip st in back loop of 10th st of Row 6, hdc in same st and next 21 sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—22 hdc.
Rows 8 and 9: Ch 1, hdc2tog, hdc in each st to last 2 sts, hdc2tog, turn—18 hdc. 
Row 10: Ch 1, [hdc2tog] across, turn—9 hdc. 
Row 11: Ch 1, [hdc2tog] twice, hdc in next st, [hdc2tog] twice—5 hdc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold Bootie in half along Row 1. With beginning tail, sew through both thicknesses for back seam. With end tail, for front seam, sew sts of Row 6 together, then working in ends of rows, sew Toe Shaping together; weave yarn through last 5 sts and pull tightly to close toe. Fasten off.
Top Edging
Round 1: With right side facing and working in ends of rows, join B with sc at back seam, work 21 sc evenly spaced around; join with slip st in first sc, turn—22 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc—22 hdc. 
Fasten off.
HAT
With A, ch 30.
Row 1 (right side): Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch, turn—29 hdc.
Rows 2–44: Ch 1, working back loops only, hdc in each st across, turn.
Joining Row: Ch 1, with right sides together, fold Hat in half crosswise, working through back loops only of foundation ch and last row, slip st edges together. Fasten off.
Cuff
Round 1: With right side of either edge facing and working in ends of rows, join B with sc at center back of Hat, work 44 sc evenly spaced around; join with slip st in first sc, turn—45 sts.
Rounds 2–5: Ch 1, working in back loops only, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc, turn. 
Fasten off.
Top Tie
With B, work as many ch as needed for a 12" (30.5) tie. Flatten Hat with joining row centered at back and front of Hat facing. Working through 4th st from top edge and beginning at center of front, weave Tie in and out of sts around. Pull Tie to gather Hat and tie ends in a bow. 
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Pompom (make 4)
With B, following pompom maker directions, make 1¼" (3 cm) pompom or make pompom as follows: Wrap yarn around 1¼" (3 cm) piece of heavy cardboard (the more wraps, the fuller the pompom). Gently remove wraps from cardboard. Cut a 12" (30.5 cm) length of B and tie it tightly around center of wraps. Do not cut the ends of this center tie. Cut ends of wraps. Fluff and trim pompom. Use ends of center tie to attach pompom.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 2 balls 9401 Elephant A, 1 ball each 9200 Baby Yellow B and 9505 Aqua D
RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball 4614 Black C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5mm [H-8 US] and 6mm [J-10 US]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses in same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures 15 (17, 19)” [38 (43, 48.5) cm] circumference at brim. Pillow measures 8” (20.5 cm) diameter.
gauge: 11 hdc = 3” (7.5 cm) in pattern; 11 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com
©2014 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 2
Prince Bear 
Pillow and Hat
Crochet your huggable little guy a Prince 
Bear Pillow and earflap Hat both with regal 
crowns on top. We know he is the center of 
your world and deserves to be treated royally!
Round 4: Ch 1, (hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in 
next st) 10 times; join with slip st in first 
st—40 hdc.
Round 5: Ch 1, (hdc in next 3 sts, 2 hdc in 
next st) 10 times; join with slip st in first 
st—50 hdc.
Size Baby only
Round 6: Ch 1, (hdc in next 9 sts, 2 hdc in 
next st) 5 times; join with slip st in first st— 
55 hdc.
Rounds 7–15: Ch 1, hdc in each st; join with 
slip st in first st. Do not fasten off. 
Size Toddler only
Round 6: Ch 1, (hdc in next 4 sts, 2 hdc in 
next st) 10 times; join with slip st in first 
st—60 hdc.
Round 7: Ch 1, (hdc in next 29 sts, 2 hdc 
in next st) 2 times; join with slip st in first 
st—62 hdc. 
Rounds 8–17: Ch 1, hdc in each st; join with 
slip st in first st. Do not fasten off.
Size Child only
Round 6: Ch 1, (hdc in next 4 sts, 2 hdc in 
next st) 10 times; join with slip st in first 
st—60 hdc.
Round 7: Ch 1, (hdc in next 5 sts, 2 hdc in 
next st) 10 times; join with slip st in first 
st—70 hdc. 
Rounds 8–19: Ch 1, hdc in each st; join with 
slip st in first st—70 hdc. Do not fasten off.
All sizes
Right Earflap
Row 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first hdc 
here and throughout), skip next st, hdc in 
next 7 sts, skip next st, hdc in next; leave 
remaining sts unworked, turn—9 hdc.
Directions for hat are for size Baby. 
Changes for sizes Toddler and Child are in 
parentheses.
Hat measures 15 (17, 19)” [38 (43, 48.5) cm] 
circumference at brim 
Pillow measures 8” (20.5 cm) diameter
Special Stitch 
Picot = Ch 3, slip st in 3rd ch from hook.
Special Technique
Adjustable-ring method—Wrap yarn in a 
ring, ensuring that the tail falls behind the 
working yarn. Grip ring and tail firmly between 
middle finger and thumb. Insert hook through 
center of ring, yarn over (with working yarn) 
and draw up a loop. Work stitches of first 
round in the ring. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail 
to tighten ring when instructed.
Notes
1. Hat is worked from top down in joined
rounds with right side facing at all times.
2. Earflaps are worked back and forth in rows.
3. Pillow is made of 2 sides, each worked in
joined rounds. Bear features are made in
separate pieces and sewn to pillow.
HAT
Working from top down, with smaller hook and 
A, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1 (right side): Work 10 hdc in ring; 
join with slip st in top of first hdc—10 hdc. 
Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring. 
Place marker for beginning of round and move 
marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Ch 1 (does not count as a st here or 
throughout), 2 hdc in each st; join with slip st 
in first st—20 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 1, (hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st) 
10 times; join with slip st in first st—30 hdc.
pattern; 11 rows = 4” (10 cm). 
CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size 
hook to obtain the gauge.
RED HEART® Soft 
Baby Steps®, Art. E746 
available in solid color  
5 oz (141 g), 256 yd (234 m); prints 4 oz (113 g), 204 yd (187 m), and heather 4 oz (113 g), 212 yd (194 m) balls
Designed by Salena Baca
What you will need:
RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 2 
balls 9401 Elephant A, 1 ball each 
9200 Baby Yellow B and 9505 Aqua D
RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball 4614 
Black C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks:  
5mm [H-8 US] and 6mm [J-10 US].
Yarn needle, stitch markers, 
polyester fiberfill
GAUGE: 11 hdc = 3” (7.5 
cm) in pattern; 11 rows = 4” (10 cm)
ROWS 2, 4, and 6: Ch 1, sc in each st to 
beginning ch, sc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in next 5 sts, 
skip next st, hdc in next, turn—7 hdc.
Row 5: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in next 3 sts, 
skip next st, hdc in next, turn—5 hdc.
Row 7: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in next st, skip 
next st, hdc in next, turn—3 hdc. Fasten off. 
With right side of hat facing, place marker 
in 22nd (24th, 26th) st to the left of last st in 
Row 1.
Left Earflap
With smaller hook, join A with slip st in 
marked st.
Work same as Rows 1–7 of right earflap.
Border
Round 1: With smaller hook and right side 
facing, join A in any st at back of hat, ch 1, 
sc in same st as join and in each st around, 
working 3 sc in end of each row of earflap; 
join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. 
Ears (make 2)
With smaller hook, A, and leaving a long tail, 
make an adjustable ring, ch 2.
Row 1 (wrong side): Work 11 dc in ring 
(beginning ch counts as first dc), turn—12 dc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, hdc in each st around, with 
wrong side facing, ch 3, slip st through center 
of ring—12 hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail 
for sewing. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to 
tighten ring.
Crown
With B, ch 40; taking care not to twist ch, join 
with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in each ch; join 
with slip st in first st—40 sc. Place marker for 
beginning of round and move marker up as 
each round is completed.
Round 2: [Slip st in next st, (sc, picot, sc) in 
next st] 20 times; join with slip st in first st. 
Fasten off.
Round 3: With right side facing, join D with 
slip st around post of any st in Round 1, slip st 
loosely around post of each st. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
With seam at center back, flatten hat and 
place stitch markers on each end of Round 7 
for placement of ears. With beginning and end 
tails, tie each ear to marked stitch.
With B, whipstitch crown to Round 4.
Braids
Cut 18 lengths of A, each measuring 25” (63.5 
cm). Separate into 6 hanks of 3 strands each. 
Thread 3 hanks through last row of earflap 
and fold over so strands are doubled. Braid 
doubled hanks until 4” (10 cm) of strands 
remain, tie an overhand knot tightly, and trim 
ends evenly. Repeat with remaining hanks for 
other earflap.
Weave in ends.
PILLOW 
Sides (make 2: 1 in A and 1 in C)
With larger hook and two strands yarn held 
together, make an adjustable loop, ch 1.
Work same as Rounds 1–7 of size Child hat.
Ears (make 2)
With larger hook, 2 strands of A held together, 
and leaving a long tail, make an adjustable 
ring, ch 2. 
Work same as Rows 1 and 2 of ears of hat.
Crown
With larger hook and 2 strands of B held 
together, ch 28; taking care not to twist ch, 
join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Work same as Rounds 1–3 of crown of hat.
Nose
With larger hook and C, make an adjustable 
loop, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 11 dc in ring 
(beginning ch counts as first dc); join with slip 
st in top of beginning ch—12 dc. Fasten off, 
leaving a 10” (25.5 cm) tail for sewing.
Eye (make 2)
With larger hook and C, make an adjustable 
loop, ch 1.
Round 1 (right side): Work 8 sc in ring; join 
with slip st in top of first st—8 sc. Fasten off, 
leaving a 10” (25.5 cm) tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Using photograph as a guide, sew eyes and 
nose to side A of pillow.
To form mouth, join C with slip st to lower 
center edge of nose, work 4 slip sts evenly 
down to Round 5. Fasten off. Join C with slip 
st between Rounds 4 and 5 around 5th st 
from either side of vertical stitching just made; 
working around sts along curve of the rounds, 
work 9 slip sts evenly—10 slip sts. Fasten off.
Border
With wrong sides together, larger hook, 2 
strands of A held together, and working 
through both thicknesses, join yarn with slip st 
to left lower end of sides, ch 1, sc in same st 
as join and in each st around; leave 20 sts at 
bottom unworked. 
Place marker in last stitch so it does not 
unravel, drop hook, and sew remaining pieces.
Center crown on top of pillow over border and 
sew in place.
Sew ears on each side of crown.
Stuff pillow with fiberfill.
Sc in remaining sts of border; join with slip st 
in first sc. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Cocoon measures 13 (16)" (33 (40.5) cm) in length and 19 (21½)" (48.5 (54.5) cm) in circumference. Beanie measures 6 (6½)" (15 (16.5) cm) in length and 13½ (16)" (34.5 (40.5) cm) in circumference.
gauge: 15 hdc = 4" (10 cm); 10 hdc rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COCOON
With A, ch 71 (81).
Round 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end, join round with slip st in first sc – 70 (80) sts.
Rounds 2 and 3: Ch 1, * fpdc around next st, bpdc around next st; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first fpdc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in each st around, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 5 (wrong side): Ch 1, turn, hdc in each st around, join with slip st in first hdc.
Round 6 (right side): Ch 1, turn, * fpdc around each of next 2 sts 2 rounds below, sc in each of next 2 sts, fpdc around each of next 4 sts 2 rounds below, sc in each of next 2 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first fpdc.
Round 7: Repeat Round 5.
Round 8: Ch 1, turn, * fpdc around each of next 2 sts 2 rounds below, sc in each of next 2 sts, skip next 2 post sts 2 rounds below, fptr around each of next 2 post sts 2 rounds below, working in front of sts just made, fptr around 2 skipped sts 2 rounds below, sc in each of next 2 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first fpdc.
Rounds 9 and 11: Repeat Round 5.
Round 10 and 12: Repeat Round 6.
Next 29 (41) rounds: Repeat Rounds 7-12 4 (6) more times, then repeat rounds 7-11 only once more.
Shape Bottom
Next 13 rounds:
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, turn, * fpdc around each of next 2 sts 2 rounds below, sc in each of next 2 sts, [fpdc2tog over next 2 sts 2 rounds below] twice, sc in each of next 2 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first fpdc – 56 (64) sts.
Round 2 (wrong side): Ch 1, turn, hdc in each st around, join with slip st in first hdc.
Round 3: Ch 1, turn, * fpdc2tog over next 2 sts 2 rounds below, sc in each of next 2 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first fpdc2tog – 42 (48) sts.
Round 4: Repeat Round 2.
Rounds 5 and 7: Ch 1, turn, * fpdc around next st 2 rounds below, sc in each of next 2 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first fpdc.
Round 6 and 8: Repeat Round 2.
Round 9: Ch 1, turn, * fpdc around next st 2 rounds below, sc2tog over next 2 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first fpdc – 28 (32) sts.
Round 10: Repeat Round 2.
Round 11: Ch 1, turn, * fpdc2tog over next 2 post sts 2 rounds below skipping the sc between them, sc in next st; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first fpdc2tog – 14 (16) sts.
Round 12: Repeat Round 2.
Round 13: Ch 1, turn, * hdc2tog over next 2 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first hdc2tog – 7 (8) sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Use yarn needle to weave tail through each st in the last round, then pull tight to close opening and secure in place.
BEANIE
With A, ch 51 (61).
Round 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end, join round with slip st in first sc – 50 (60) sts.
Round 2: Ch 1, * fpdc around next st, bpdc around next st; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first fpdc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each st around, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 4 (wrong side): Ch 1, turn, hdc in each st around, join.
Round 5 (right side): Ch 1, turn, * fpdc around each of next 2 sts 2 rounds below, sc in each of next 2 sts, fpdc around each of next 4 sts 2 rounds below, sc in each of next 2 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first fpdc.
Round 6: Repeat Round 4.
Round 7: Ch 1, turn, * fpdc around each of next 2 sts 2 rounds below, sc in each of next 2 sts, skip next 2 post sts 2 rounds below, fptr around each of next 2 post sts 2 rounds below, working in front of sts just made, fptr around 2 skipped sts 2 rounds below, sc in each of next 2 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first fpdc.
Rounds 8, 10 and 12: Repeat Round 4.
Rounds 9 and 11: Repeat Round 5.
Round 13: Repeat Round 7.
Round 14: Repeat Round 4.
Round 15: Repeat Round 5.
Round 16: Repeat Round 4.
Repeat the last 2 rounds 0 (2) more times.
Shape Crown
Next 9 rounds:
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, turn, * fpdc around each of next 2 sts 2 rounds below, sc in each of next 2 sts, [fpdc2tog over next 2 sts 2 rounds below] twice, sc in each of next 2 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first fpdc – 40 (48) sts.
Round 2 (wrong side): Ch 1, turn, hdc in each st around, join.
Round 3: Ch 1, turn, * fpdc2tog over next 2 sts 2 rounds below, sc in each of next 2 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first fpdc2tog – 30 (36) sts.
Round 4: Repeat Round 2.
Round 5: Ch 1, turn, * fpdc around next st 2 rounds below, sc2tog over next 2 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first fpdc – 20 (24) sts.
Round 6: Repeat Round 2.
Round 7: Ch 1, turn, * fpdc2tog over next 2 post sts 2 rounds below skipping the sc between them, sc in next st; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first fpdc2tog – 10 (12) sts.
Round 8: Repeat Round 2.
Round 9: Ch 1, turn, * sc2tog over next 2 sts; rep from * around, join with slip st in first sc2tog – 5 (6) sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Use yarn needle to weave tail through each st in the last round, then pull tight to close opening and secure in place.
Flower (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): 12 hdc in 2nd ch from hook, join with slip st in first hdc.
Fasten off.
Round 2 (wrong side): Join B with slip st in any hdc, 
ch 1, sc in same st, bobble in next st, [2 
sc in next st, Bobble in next st], repeat around, sc again in first st (where you already have one sc), join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
Sew one flower near edge of each piece.
Drawstring (optional)
With B, Ch 150 (160), slip st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end.
Fasten off.
Weave drawstring through round 2 of Cocoon and tie into bow.
FINISHING
Weave in all loose ends, tacking together the small gap in the foundation ch with beginning yarn tail of each piece.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream Denims (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Sizes 2 4 6 Vest Main Color (MC) 01116 (Blue Jeans) 1 2 2 ball(s)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Length of 1 inch [2.5 cm] wide elastic to fit waist measurement for Skirt
measurements: Vest: To fit chest measurement 2 yrs 21 ins [53.5 cm], 4 yrs 23 ins [58.5 cm], 6 yrs 25 ins [63.5 cm]. Finished chest 2 yrs 22 ins [53.5 cm], 4 yrs 24 ins [58.5 cm], 6 yrs 26 ins [66.0 cm]. Skirt: To fit waist measurement 2 yrs 20 ins [51 cm], 4 yrs 21 ins [53.5 cm], 6 yrs 22 ins [56 cm].
gauge: 13 hdc and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
SKIRT
Note: Ch 2 for turning ch does not count as st.
Front and Back (make alike).
Beg at waist with MC, ch 38 (41-43).
1st row: (RS).1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 36 (39-41) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 2 ins [5 cm]. Place marker on last row.
Cont even until work from marked row measures 5 (6-8) ins [12.5 (15-20.5) cm], ending with a RS row.
Sizes 2 and 4 only: Next row: (WS). Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 6 (18) hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 41 hdc.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc across. Turn.
All sizes: 1st row: With A, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 3 hdc. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next hdc. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook – dc3tog made. *1 dc in each of next 3 hdc. 3 dc in next hdc. 1 dc in each of next 3 hdc. Dc3tog. Rep from * to last 4 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 dc in last hdc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Dc3tog. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 3 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Dc3tog. Rep from * to last 4 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in last dc. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from marked row measures 8 (10-12) ins [20.5 (25.5-30.5) cm]. Fasten off.
Pockets (make 2).
With MC, ch 2.
1st row: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 3 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 
Rep last row once more. 11 sc at end of last row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row 6 times more. Fasten off.
Finishing
Sew side edges tog. Fold top edge to marked row on WS to form casing and sew in position, leaving an opening to insert elastic. Cut elastic to waist measurement and insert through casing. Sew ends of elastic tog securely. Sew opening closed. With A yarn, embroider pockets using running st. Sew Pockets to back of Skirt as shown in picture.

VEST
Note: Ch 2 for turning ch does not count as st.
Back
With MC, ch 40 (44-48).
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 38 (42-46) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 3 (3-4) ins [7.5 (7.5-10) cm], ending with a WS row. 
Shape armholes: Next row: Sl st in each of first 4 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 4 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
30 (34-38) hdc.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until armhole measures 4 (5-6) ins [10 (12.5-15) cm], ending with a WS row.  Fasten off.
Left Front
**With MC, ch 12. 
1st row: (RS). 2 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to last ch. 2 hdc in last ch. Turn. 14 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc across to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 
Rep last row 3 (4-5) times more. 22 (24-26) hdc.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 3 (3-4) ins [7.5 (7.5-10) cm], ending with a WS row.  Place marker on last row.**
Shape armhole: Next row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 4 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - Hdc2tog made. Turn. 17 (19-21) hdc.
Neck shaping: 1st row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 4 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 12 (14-16) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row.  Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 2.  1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 
10 (12-14) sts. 
Cont even until work from beg measures same length as Back to shoulders, ending with a WS row. Fasten off.
Right Front 
Work from ** to ** as given for Left Front.
Shape armhole: Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 4 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 18 (20-22) hdc.
Next row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 
Neck shaping: 1st row: Sl st in each of first 4 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn.
2nd row:Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog.  Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 
10 (12-14) sts.
Cont even until work from beg measures same length as Back to shoulders, ending with a WS row. Fasten off.
Collar (make 2)
With A, ch 20 (22-26).
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of next 5 (7-9) ch. 1 sc in each of last 11 (11-13) ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 11 (11-13) sc. 1 dc in each of next 7 (9-11) dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 6 (8-10) dc. 1 sc in each of next 11 (11-13) sc. Turn.
Sizes 2 and 4 only: Fasten off.
Size 6 only: Rep 2nd row once more. Fasten off.
Pockets (make 2).
Work as given for Skirt Pockets.
FINISHING
Pin garment pieces to measurements and cover with a damp cloth and allow cloth to dry. Sew shoulder and side seams. 
Buttonhole band: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to marked row of Right Front edge. 
1st row: Ch 1. Work 17 (19-21) sc evenly along Front edge to neck shaping. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Ch 2. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 (6-7) sc. Rep from * once more. Ch 2. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Fasten off.
Buttonband
With RS facing, join MC with sl st to first row of neck shaping of Left Front edge.
1st row: Ch 1. Work 17 (19-21) sc evenly along front edge to marked row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew Collar to Neck edge as shown in picture. Sew buttons to correspond to buttonholes.

pattern_name: Riverside Button Crochet Slouchy Hat & Fingerless Gloves
materials: Sugar Bush® Crisp™ (1.75 oz/50 g: 95 yds/87 m)
Lichen (2029) 3 balls for Hat, 2 balls for Gloves, 5 balls for Set
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook for Gloves, Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook for Hat
2 Buttons 1" [25 mm] for Gloves, 1 Button 1¼" [30 mm] for Hat
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Puff Stitch = (Yoh. Draw up a loop) 4 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through first 8 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through remaining 2 loops on hook
Trbp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times
Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times
measurements: HAT: One size to fit Adult. GLOVES: Width 3½" [9 cm]. Length 7" [18 cm].
gauge: Gloves: 18 dc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] with F/5 (3.75 mm) hook in dc. Hat: 16 dc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] with G/6 (4 mm) hook.
instructions:
Notes: Ch 3 at beg of row or rnd counts as dc. Ch 2 at beg of row or rnd does not count as dc. 

HAT BAND
With larger hook, ch 9. See diagram on page 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd to 7th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
8th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Turn.
