10th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. Skip next dc. 1 dcbp around next st. 2 dc between last st worked and next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.
11th row: Ch 3. Skip next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dcfp around next st. Skip next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
12th row: Ch 3. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 
13th row: Ch 3. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 1 dcfbp around next st. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 
14th and 15th rows: As 12th and 13th rows. 
16th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dcbp around next st. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Skip next dc. 1 dcbp around next st. 2 dc in last dc. Turn. 
17th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 
18th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Turn. 
19th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Skip next st. 1 trfp around next st. 1 trfp around skipped st. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Turn. 
20th row: As 18th row. 
21st row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. Skip next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 dc between last st worked and next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.
22nd row: Ch 3. Skip next dc. 1 dcbp around next st. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dcbp around next st. Skip next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
23rd to 26th rows: As 13th and 12th rows twice more.
27th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dcfp around next st. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Skip next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 dc in last dc. Turn.
28th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dcbp around next st. Skip next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around next st. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 
29th row: As 9th row.
30th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Skip next st. 1 trbp around next st. 1 trbp around skipped st. 
1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Turn. 
31st to 52nd rows: As 9th to 30th rows once more. 
53rd and 54th rows: As 9th and 10th rows. 
55th row: (Buttonhole row). Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.
56th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st, working 2 sc in ch-2 sp, to end of row. Turn. 
57th row: Ch 1. 3 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 3 sc in last sc. Do not turn. Work down side of band in sc to next corner. 3 sc in corner. Work across foundation ch in sc to next corner. 3 sc in corner. Work up side of Band to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Sew button to correspond to buttonhole. 
HAT
Magic circle: Wrap yarn around index finger of left hand. Holding crochet hook in right hand, insert hook under two yarn loops and pull loop through. See diagram on page 5.
1st rnd: 12 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. Pull ring tight. 12 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *(1 dc. Ch 1) in each sc around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. 12 dc.
3rd rnd: Sl st to first ch-1 sp. Ch 2. Puff st in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 2. Puff st in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of first Puff st. 12 Puff sts.
4th rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *3 dc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Puff st in next ch-1 sp. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Puff st in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 4 dc between 12 Puff sts.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Ch 1. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 60 dc.
7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Puff st in next ch-1 sp. *1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Puff st in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Ch 2. 6 dc between Puff sts.
8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Ch 1. *1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 84 dc.
9th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Puff st in next ch-1 sp. *1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Puff st in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 8 dc between Puff sts.
10th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Ch 1. Skip next Puff st and ch-1 sp. *1 dc in each of next 8 dc. Ch 1. Skip next Puff st and ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 
11th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Puff st in next ch-1 sp. *1 dc in each of next 8 dc. Puff stitch in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
12th to 17th rnds: As 10th and 11th rnds 3 times more.
18th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Dc2tog. Ch 1. Skip next Puff st. *1 dc in each of next 6 sts. Dc2tog. Ch 1. Skip next Puff st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
19th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 sts. Dc2tog. Puff st in next ch-1 sp. *1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Dc2tog. Puff st in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 5 sts between 12 Puff sts.
20th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 sts. Dc2tog. *1 dc in each of next 5 sts. Dc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
21st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Fasten off leaving a long end for sewing.
With WS facing of Band and RS facing of Hat, sew edge of Band across last rnd of Hat, lining up stitches. Make sure 3 center rows of Puff stitch line up with oval and Cross stitches at the front of hat (the button will be to the right side of Hat). Start sewing at overlap of button. 
Sew Band to Hat. Fold Band to right side. 

FINGERLESS GLOVES
Right Glove:
**Beg at top of glove, with smaller hook, ch 34. Join with sl st to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in back loop only of each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 34 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.** 
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * twice more. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 13 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. Skip next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Skip next st. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 12 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. Skip next st. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in next dc. Skip next st. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 13 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. Skip next st. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dcfp around next st. Skip next st. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 14 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Skip next dc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 15 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 10 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next dc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 16 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
9th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Ch 6. Skip next 3 dc (Thumb opening). 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Skip next 2 sts. 1 trfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 trfp around each of 2 skipped sts. 1 dc in each of next 18 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
10th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 ch. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. 1 dc in each of next 18 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 
11th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. (Dc2tog. 1 dc in next dc) twice. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Skip next dc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dc between last st and next st. 1 dcfp around next 2 sts. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 17 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
12th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 sts. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each of next 4 sts. Skip next dc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 3 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
13th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 8 sts. Skip next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc between last worked st and next st. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc between last worked st and next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 12 sts. Dc2tog. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
14th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Skip next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 10 dc. Dc2tog. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
15th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Skip next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
***Cuff: 16th to 24th rnds: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first st. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 dcbp around last st. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.
Thumb: 1st rnd:  Join yarn with sl st to first skipped dc of Thumb opening at 9th rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Work 13 sc around thumbhole. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc. 
2nd to 4th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off at end of last rnd.*** 
Left Glove:
Rep from ** to ** as given for Right Glove. 
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 12 dc. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * twice more. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 
4th rnd:  Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. Skip next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Skip next st. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
5th rnd:  Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 12 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. Skip next st. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in next dc. Skip next st. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 13 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around next st. Skip next st. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dcfp around next st. Skip next st. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 14 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts.  Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Skip next dc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 10 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 15 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next dc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 964 Primary A and 320 Cornmeal B.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [US I-9] for Yoke, Button band, Headband and Booties; 6mm [US J-10]; and 5mm [H-8] for flower.
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Chest: 19½ (21½, 21½)” (49.5 [54.5, 54.5] cm); Finished Length: 11½ (11½, 15)” (29 [29, 38] cm)
gauge: With medium hook, 9 sc = 4” (10 cm); 10 rows = 3” (7.6 cm)
instructions:
YOKE
With A and medium hook, ch 43.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each of next 5 ch, 2 sc in next ch, *sc in each of next 6 ch, 2 sc in next ch; repeat from * across, turn—48 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, *sc in each of next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—54 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, *sc in each of next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—60 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, *sc in each of next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—66 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, *sc in each of next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—72 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, *sc in each of next 11 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—78 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, *sc in each of next 12 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—84 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, *sc in each of next 13 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—90 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, *sc in each of next 14 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—96 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, *sc in each of next 15 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—102 sc.
Sizes M and L Only
Row 11: Ch 1, *sc in next 16 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—108 sc.
All Sizes
Trim Row: Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in first sc, skip next sc, *(sc, ch 2, sc) in next sc, skip next 2 sts; repeat from * across, sc in last sc—33 (35, 35) ch-2 spaces. Fasten off A. Do not turn. Mark this side as right side.
SKIRT
Row 1 (RS): With right side and largest hook, working behind Trim Row, working remaining back loops of sts in Row 10 (11, 11) of Yoke, join B with a slip st in first st, ch 1, sc in first 11 (13, 12) sc (first front), ch 3, skip next 26 (27, 28) sc (for sleeve), sc in each of next 28 (28, 28) sc (back), ch 3, skip next 26 (27, 28) sc (for sleeve), sc in each of last 11 (13, 12) sc, turn—50 (54, 52) plus 2 ch-3 spaces.
Directions are given for size Small (3 months). Changes for Medium (6 months) and Large (12 months) are in parentheses. When there is only 1 number, it is the same for all sizes.
Finished Chest: 19½ (21½, 21½)” (49.5 [54.5, 54.5] cm)
Finished Length: 11½ (11½, 15)” (29 [29, 38] cm)
Note
Garment is made from top down in one piece.
Special Stitches Used
Shell: ([Dc, ch 1] 4 times, dc) in indicated st or space.
Back Post Single Crochet (BPsc): Insert hook from back to front to back again around the post of next st, yarn over, draw yarn through st, yarn over, draw yarn through 2 loops on hook.
Cluster: *Yarn over, insert hook in next st yarn over, draw yarn through st, yarn over, draw yarn through 2 loops on hook; repeat from * 5 more times, yarn over, draw yarn through 7 loops on hook, ch 1.
Single crochet 2 together (sc2tog): Insert hook in next st, yarn over, draw yarn through st, insert hook in next st, yarn over, draw yarn through st, yarn over, draw yarn through 3 loops on hook.
DRESS
Yoke
With A and medium hook, ch 43.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each of next 5 ch, 2 sc in next ch, *sc in each of next 6 ch, 2 sc in next ch; repeat from * across, turn—48 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, *sc in each of next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—54 sc.
= 3” (7.6 cm); 10 rows = 3” (7.6 cm); with largest hook, 1 repeat = 3” (7.6 cm); 4 rows in = 2¾” (7 cm) in Skirt pattern.
RED HEART® Super Saver®, Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); multicolor, heather and print 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m), flecks 5 oz (141 g), 260 yds (238 m) skeins.
Designed by Kim Guzman
What you will need:
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 964 Primary A and 320 Cornmeal B.
Note: 1 skein each makes entire set of 3 projects in any of the sizes.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [US I-9] for Yoke, Button band, Headband and Booties; 6mm [US J-10]; and 5mm [H-8] for flower.
5 size ½” buttons, Yarn needle, Sewing thread, Sewing needle.
GAUGE: With medium hook, 9 sc = 4” (10 cm); 10 rows = 3” (7.6 cm).
Size S Only
Row 2: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in each sc and in each ch across, turn—55 sc.
Size M Only
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc and in each ch across, turn—61 sc.
Size L Only
Row 2: Ch 1, *2 sc in first sc, sc in each st across to next ch-3 space, sc in each of next 3 ch; repeat from * once, sc in each st across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—61 sc.
Begin Lace
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *skip next 2 sc, shell in next sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—9 (10, 10) shells.
Row 4: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in first sc, *(sc, ch 3) in each of next 3 ch-1 spaces, sc in next ch-1 space**, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in next sc; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, 2 dc in last sc, turn.
Row 5: Ch 3, dc in first dc, *(sc, ch 3) in each of next 2 ch-3 spaces, sc in next ch-3 space**, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, 2 dc in last dc, turn.
Row 6: Ch 3, dc in first dc, *sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space**, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, 2 dc in last dc, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *shell in next ch-3 space**, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **,sc in last dc.
Sizes S and M Only
Rows 8-11: Repeat Rows 4-6. At end of last row, change to A. Fasten off B. With A, repeat Row 7. Fasten off A.
Size L Only
Rows 8-14: Repeat Rows 4-7 once; then repeat Rows 4-6 once. At end of last row, change to A. Fasten off B. With B, repeat Row 7. Fasten off A.
Button Band
Row 1: With right side facing, with medium hook, join B with slip st in top left-hand corner of left front edge, ch 1, sc evenly across to bottom edge, turn.
Rows 2-3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Fasten off.
Buttonhole Band
Row 1: With right side facing, join B with slip st in bottom right-hand corner of right front, ch 1, sc evenly across to neck edge, turn.
Row 2: Mark 3 evenly-spaced buttonhole positions on edge of Yoke as pictured, ch 1, sc in each sc across, working (ch 1, skip next sc) at each marker, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st and space across. Fasten off.
Flower (make 1 for Sweater)
With smallest hook and B, leaving at least 6” (15 cm) yarn tail, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 10 sc in top loop only of 2nd ch from hook, join with a slip st in first sc, cinch yarn tail to secure the ring and secure—10 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around, join with a slip st in first sc—20 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, Working behind sts in Round 2, *BPsc around the post of sc in Round 1, ch 2; repeat from * around, join with a slip st in first sc—10 ch-2 spaces.
Round 4: Slip st in first ch-2 space, ch 1, *(sc, hdc, dc, 3 tr) in ch-2 space, ch 3, slip st in 3rd ch from hook for picot, (3 tr, dc, hdc, sc]) in next ch-2 space; repeat from * around, join with a slip st in first sc—5 petals. Fasten off B.
Finishing
With yarn needle, attach Flower as shown in photo. Weave in ends. With sewing needle and thread, sew buttons to left front opposite buttonholes.
HEADBAND
Row 1: With medium hook and A, ch 4, do not skip a stitch, slip st in back loop of each ch across, turn—4 slip sts.
Row 2: (Do not ch 1 at beginning of slip st rows) Slip st in back loop of each st across, turn—4 sts.
Repeat Row 2 until Headband measures 14 (15, 15)” (35.5 [38, 38] cm). Fasten off, leaving a sewing length. Note: Headband will stretch up to 4” (10 cm) more. With yarn needle, sew the last row to foundation ch. Weave in ends.
Flower
Work same as Sweater Flower.
Finishing
With yarn needle, sew Flower to Headband over seam as pictured. Weave in ends.
BOOTIE (make 2)
Sole
With medium hook and B, ch 8 (10, 12). 
Round 1: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each of next 2 (3, 4) ch, hdc in each of 3 (4, 5) ch, 3 sc in last ch, working across opposite side of foundation ch, hdc in each of next 3 (4, 5) ch, sc in each of next 2 (3, 4) ch, join with slip st in first sc—16 (20, 24) sts.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 2 (3, 4) sc, hdc in each of next 3 (4, 5) hdc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, hdc in each of next 3 (4, 5) hdc, sc in each of next 2 (3, 4) sc, join with a slip st in first sc—20 (24, 28) sts.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 3 (4, 5) sc, hdc in each of next 3 (4, 5) hdc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, hdc in each of next 3 (4, 5) hdc, sc in each of next 2 (3, 4) sc, with A, slip st to first sc—24 (28, 32) sts. Fasten off B.
Sides
Round 1: With A, ch 1, working in back loops only, sc around, slip st to first sc—24 (28, 32) sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each st around—24 (28, 32) sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each of first 14 (16, 18) sc, cluster over next 6 sts, sc in each of next 4 (6, 8) sc, with B, join with a slip st in first sc—19 (23, 27) sts. Fasten off A.
Round 4: With B, ch 1, sc in each of first 2 sc, [sc2tog over next 2 sts] twice, sc in each of next 13 (17, 21) sts, join with slip st in first sc—17 (21, 25) sc. Fasten off.
Strap
With B, ch 10, slip st in 5th ch from hook, slip st in each ch across. Fasten off B. Using photo as a guide and yarn needle, attach Strap to top of Bootie. Sew button opposite buttonhole of Strap.
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz/109 m/120 yds)
Contrast A: (Lt Blue) 1 ball for Teddy Set
Contrast A: (Pink) 1 ball for Sweetheart Set
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
1¼ yards [1.15 m] of ¼ inch [6.50 mm] ribbon for Teddy Set Bib and Booties
1 yard [.9 m] of ¼ inch [6.50 mm] ribbon for Sweetheart Set Booties
measurements: Finished sizes vary depending on versions chosen.
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]
instructions:
Note: when working from chart, wind small balls of the colors to be used, one for each separate area of color in the design. Start new colors at appropriate points. To change colors, work until there are 2 loops on hook of last st before color change. Draw next color through 2 loops and proceed.

BIB
With MC, ch 20.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 19 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row. 23 sts.
Bear Version: 5th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. Work 1st row of Bear Chart across next 17 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of last 3 sts. Turn. (See chart on page 10.) Chart is now in position.
Heart Version: 5th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sts. Work 1st row of Heart Chart across next 19 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Turn. Chart is now in position.
Both Versions: 6th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. Keeping cont of chart, work 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. Turn.
7th row: Keeping cont of chart, ch 1. Work 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
8th and 9th rows: Rep last 2 rows once more. 27 sts.
Cont even, working chart of choice to end of chart. Break A.
With MC, cont even until work from beg measures 6½ ins [16.5 cm], ending with RS facing for next row.
Shape neck: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sts. Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook– sc2tog made. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn. 5 sts.
Work 10 rows even.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows twice more. Fasten off.
With RS of work facing, miss next 11 sts. Join MC with sl st to next st. Ch 1. Sc2tog over this st and next st. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Work to correspond to first side, reversing all shapings.

Sweetheart or Teddy Set (to crochet)

Edging: Join A with sl st to top left corner of neck edge. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. Work 1 row sc evenly around all edges. Join MC with sl st to first sc.
Next row: With MC, working around outer edge only, ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last st. Fasten off.
Next row: With RS of work facing, join A with sl st to first st of last row. Ch 1. Miss first st. *1 sc in next st below ch 1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next st. Rep from * ending with 1 sc in last sc. Fasten off. With A, make button loop at center back on left side. Sew button in position.
Bear Version: Cut 7 ins [18 cm] length of ribbon. Tie around bear’s neck in bow as illustrated. Stitch securely in position on WS.

BOOTIES
With A, ch 28. Join in rnd with sl st in first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join MC with sl st to first sc. 28 sc.
2nd rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around ending with ch 1. Miss last sc. Join A with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: With A, ch 2. Miss first sc (where last ss was worked). *1 sc in sc from 1st rnd below next ch 1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in sc from 1st rnd below last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to first ch of ch 2.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch 1 sp. Rep from * around ending with 1 sc in last sc. Join MC with sl st to first sc.
5th to 7th rnds: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: (Eyelet rnd). 1 sc in each of first 2 sts. *Ch 1. Miss next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Join with sl st to first sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 23 sc.
Instep: 1st row: With RS of work facing, miss first 7 sts. Join MC with sl st to next st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Turn. 9 sts.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
With RS of work facing, join MC with sl st at center back. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Work 5 sc down side of instep. 3 sc in corner sc. 3 sc across end of instep. 3 sc in corner sc. Work 5 sc along other side of instep. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Join with sl st to first st. 33 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join A with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, work 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off. Join center foot seam. Weave ribbon through eyelet row.

materials: RED HEART® Anne Geddes™: 2 (2, 3) balls 941 Scooter A, and 1 (1, 1) ball 100 Lily B
abbreviations: A and B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 21 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet using larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CARDIGAN
Body
With larger hook and A, ch 77 (85, 93).
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn – 76 (84, 92) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat last row until piece measures 4½ (5, 5½)” (11.5 (12.5, 14) cm) from beginning.
Divide at Underarm for Fronts and Back
First Front
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in first 19 (21, 23) sts, turn; leave remaining sts unworked for back and second front – 19 (21, 23) sc. Note: The beginning of Row 1 is the front edge, the end of the row is the armhole edge. The armhole edge will be shaped in the following rows.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across, turn—18 (20, 22) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—17 (19, 21) sc.
Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Rows 2 and 3—15 (17, 19) sc at the end of Row 5.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat last row until first front measures 2½ (3, 3½)” (6.5 (7.5, 9) cm) from divide, make sure the last row you work ends at front (neck) edge.
Shape Neck
Row 1: Slip st in first 6 (7, 8) sc, ch 1, sc in each remaining sc across, turn—9 (10, 11) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—8 (9, 10) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across, turn—7 (8, 9) sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. Repeat last row until first front measures 4½ (5, 5½)” (11.5 (12.5, 14) cm) from divide. Fasten off.
Cardigan directions are for size 0-3 months. Changes for sizes 6-9 months and 12 months are in parentheses.
Bootie directions are for size 0-3 months. Changes for size 6-9 months are in parentheses.
Cardigan
Finished Chest: 20 (22, 24)” (51 (56, 61) cm), including front bands
Finished Length: 9 (10, 11)” (23 (25.5, 28) cm)
Booties
Finished Length: 3 (3¾)” (7.5 (9.5) cm)
Special Stitches
Bpdc (Back post double crochet) = Yarn over, insert hook from back side of work to front and to back again around the post of indicated stitch; yarn over and pull up a loop (3 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 2 loops (2 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 2 loops (1 loop on hook).
Fpdc (Front post double crochet) = Yarn over, insert hook from front side of work to back and to front again around post of indicated stitch; yarn over and pull up a loop (3 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 2 loops (2 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 2 loops (1 loop on hook).
sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Notes
1. Body of cardigan is worked in one piece beginning at lower edge. Piece is divided at underarm and back and fronts worked separately.
2. Sleeves are worked separately and sewn into armholes.
Continued...
Back
Row 1: With larger hook, join A with sc in first unwroked st of last row of body following first front, sc in next 37 (41, 45) sc, turn; leave remaining sts unworked for second front—38 (42, 46) sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—30 (34, 38) sc at the end of Row 5.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Repeat last row until back measures 3½ (4, 4½)” (9 (10, 11.5) cm) from divide.
Shape First Side of Back Neck
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in first 9 (10, 11) sts, turn; leave remaining sts of back unworked for second side of neck—9 (10, 11) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across, turn—8 (9, 10) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—7 (8, 9) sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Repeat last row until this side of back measures same as first front. Fasten off.
Shape Second Side of Back Neck
Row 1: Skip 12 (14, 16) unworked sts of back following first side of back neck, with larger hook, join A with sc in next st, sc in remaining 8 (9, 10) unworked sts, turn—9 (10, 11) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—8 (9, 10) sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across, turn—7 (8, 9) sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Repeat last row until this side of back measures same as first front. Fasten off.
Second Front
Row 1: With larger hook, join A with sc in first unwroked st of last row of body following back, sc in each remaining st, turn—19 (21, 23) sts. Note: The beginning of Row 1 is the armhole edge, the end of the row is the neck edge. The armhole edge will be shaped in the following rows.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—18 (20, 22) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across, turn—17 (19, 21) sc.
Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Rows 2 and 3—15 (17, 19) sc at the end of Row 5.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Repeat last row until first front measures 2½ (3, 3½)” (6.5 (7.5, 9) cm) from divide, make sure the last row you work ends at the armhole edge.
Shape Neck
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in first 9 (10, 11) sts, turn; leave remaining sts unworked—9 (10, 11) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across, turn—8 (9, 10) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—7 (8, 9) sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Repeat last row until piece measures same as first front. Fasten off.
Sleeves (make 2)
Beginning at lower (cuff) edge, with larger hook and A, ch 27 (29, 31).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—26 (28, 30) sc.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each st across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—28 (30, 32) sc.
Rows 6–21: Repeat last 4 rows 4 more times—36 (38, 40) sc at the end of Row 21.
Row 22: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Repeat last row until piece measures 4½ (5, 5½)” (11.5 (12.5, 14 cm) from beginning.
Shape Cap
Next 4 Rows: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across—32 (34, 36) sc remain.
Fasten off.
Cuff Ribbing
With right side facing and smaller hook, draw up a loop of B in lower corner to work across cuff edge.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc), work 25 (27, 29) more dc evenly spaced across cuff edge, turn—26 (28, 30) dc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 2 (counts as hdc), *Bpdc around next st, Fpdc around next st; repeat from * to last st, hdc in last st (top of turning ch), turn. Fasten off.
FINISHING CARDIGAN
Sew shoulder seams. Sew side seams.
Lower Ribbing
With right side facing and smaller hook, draw up a loop of B in lower front corner to work across lower edge.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc), work 75 (83, 91) more dc evenly spaced across lower edge to opposite lower front corner, turn—76 (84, 92) dc.
Rows 2 and 3: Work same as Rows 2 and 3 of cuff ribbing. Fasten off.
Neckband
With right side facing and smaller hook, draw up a loop of B in corner of front neck to work around neck edge.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc), work 17 (18, 19) more dc evenly spaced across neck edge to first shoulder seam, work 20 (22, 24) dc evenly spaced across back neck edge, work 18 (19, 20) dc evenly spaced across remainder of neck edge to opposite front corner, turn—56 (60, 64) dc.
Rows 2 and 3: Work same as Rows 2 and 3 of cuff ribbing. Fasten off.
Buttonband (work across left front edge for girls, right front edge for boys)
With right side facing and smaller hook draw up a loop of B in front corner to work across front edge.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc), work 39 (47, 55) more dc evenly spaced across entire front edge (including edge of neckband), turn—40 (48, 56) dc.
Rows 2 and 3: Work same as Rows 2 and 3 of cuff ribbing. Fasten off.
Buttonhole Band (work across right front edge for girls, left front edge for boys)
With right side facing and smaller hook draw up a loop of B in front corner to work across front edge.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc), work 39 (47, 55) more dc evenly spaced across entire front edge (including edge of neckband), turn—40 (48, 56) dc.
Row 2 (buttonhole row): Ch 2 (counts as hdc), Bpdc around next st, Fpdc around next st, Bpdc around next st, *ch 3, skip next dc, Bpdc around next st, [Fpdc around next st, Bpdc around next st] 3 (4, 5) times; repeat from * 3 more times, ch 3, sk next dc, Bpdc around next st, Fpdc around next st, hdc in last st, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, Bpdc around next st, FPdc around next st, dc in next ch-3 space, *[Fpdc around next st, Bpdc around next st] 3 (4, 5) times, Fpdc around next st, dc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * 3 more times, Fpdc around next st, Bpdc around next st, Fpdc around next st, hdc in last st. Fasten off.
FINISHING BOOTIES
Weave in ends. Turn down cuff.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Baby™ (4.9 oz/140 g; 362 yds/331 m) Sizes 6 mos 12 mos White (02000) 1 1 ball
Sizes U.S. C/2 (3 mm) and U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook). Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Picot = Ch 4. Sl st in 4th ch from hook
measurements: To fit chest measurement: 6 mos  17"  [43 cm], 12 mos  18" [45.5 cm]. Finished chest: 6 mos  20" [51 cm], 12 mos  22½" [57 cm]. Bonnet and Booties: One size to fit 6 mos.
gauge: Cardigan and Bonnet: 19 sts and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook in pat. Booties: 17 hdc and 12½ rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes.

Cardigan
Body
With larger hook, ch 100 (113).
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 98 (111) sts.

2nd row: Ch 3. Skip first dc. *1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in top of ch-3. Turn.

3rd row: Ch 3. Skip first dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in top of ch-3. Turn.

Last 2 rows form pat.

Rep last 2 rows 6 times more, then 2nd row once. PM at beg of last row.

Right Front: 1st row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 2 sts. Ch 3. Pat across 21 (22) sts. Turn. 22 (23) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.

2nd row: Sl st in each of first 2 sts. Ch 3. Pat to last st. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.

Rep last row once more. 18 (19) sts.

Proceed as follows:

1st row: (WS). Ch 3. Pat to last st. Turn. Leave rem st unworked.

2nd row: Sl st in each of first 2 sts. Ch 3. Pat to end of row. Turn.

Rep last 2 rows twice more, then 1st row once. 11 (12) sts. Fasten off.

Back: With RS facing, skip next 4 (8) sts of marked row. Join yarn with sl st to next st and proceed as follows:

Next row: (RS). Ch 3. Pat across 43 (45) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 44 (46) sts.

Next row: Sl st in each of first 2 sts. Ch 3. Pat to last st. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.

Rep last row once more. 40 (42) sts.

Work 7 rows even in pat. Fasten off.

Left Front: With RS facing, skip next 4 (8) sts of marked row. Join yarn with sl st to next st and proceed as follows:

Next row: (RS). Ch 3. Pat to last st. Turn. Leave turning ch unworked. 22 (23) sts.

Next row: Sl st in each of first 2 sts. Ch 3. Pat to last st. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.

Rep last row once more. 18 (19) sts.

Proceed as follows:

Next row: (WS). Sl st in each of first 2 sts. Ch 3. Pat to end of row. Turn.

Next row: Ch 3. Pat to last st. Turn. Leave rem st unworked.

Rep last 2 rows twice more, then 1st row once. 11 (12) sts. Fasten off.

Sleeves
With larger hook, ch 31 (35).
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 29 (33) sts.

2nd row: Ch 3. Skip first dc. Pat to last st. 2 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.

Rep 2nd row 7 times more. 37 (41) sts.

Next row: Ch 3. Skip first dc. Pat to end of row. Turn.

Size 12 mos only: Rep last row twice more.

All Sizes: Shape Top: Next row:  Sl st in each of first 4 (6) sts. Ch 3. Pat to last 3 (5) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.

Next 4 (6) rows: Sl st in first 3 sts. Ch 3. Pat to last 2 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.

Size 12 mos only: Next row: Sl st in each of first 4 sts. Ch 3. Pat to last 3 sts.

All Sizes: Fasten off.

FINISHING
Hem Edging: With RS facing and smaller hook, join yarn with sl st to hem edge corner of Left Front. Work 1 sc in each ch of foundation chain. Turn. 97 (109) sc.

Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Picot. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. Picot. Skip 1 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Fasten off.

Sew shoulder seams, leaving center back 18 sts free to form Back neck.

Front and Neck Edging: With WS facing and smaller hook, join yarn with sl st to lower edge of hem at base of Left Front. Work 47 sc evenly up Left Front, 18 sc across Back neck and 47 sc down Right Front to lower edge of hem. Turn. 112 sc.

Next row: (Buttonhole row). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * twice more. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.

Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. *Picot. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Picot. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Fasten off.

Cuff Edging:  With RS facing and smaller hook, join yarn with sl st to hem edge of Sleeve. Work 1 sc into each ch of foundation ch. Turn. 29 ( 33) sts.

Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Picot. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. Picot. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Fasten off.

Sew in Sleeves. Sew Sleeve seams. Sew on buttons to correspond to buttonholes. 

Bonnet
Bonnet Back:  With larger hook, ch 23.

1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 21 sts.

2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). Skip first dc. *1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in top of ch-3. Turn.

3rd row: Ch 3. Skip first dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in top of ch-3. Turn.

Last 2 rows form pat.

Work 3 rows in pat, ending on a WS row.

Next row: Sl st in each of first 2 sts. Ch 3. Pat to last st. Turn. Leave rem st unworked.

Next row: Sl st in each of first 2 sts. Ch 3. Pat to last st. Leave rem st unworked. Fasten off.

Bonnet Body: With RS facing and larger hook, join yarn with sl st to bottom right corner of Back just worked. Working up the right side of Back, proceed as follows: Ch 3. 1 dc around same dc post as last sl st. (2 dc around next dc post. Ch 1. 1 dc around next dc post) 4 times. Skip last dc post. Pat across top of Back. Working down left side of Back, proceed as follows: Skip first dc post. 1 dc around next dc post. Ch 1. (2 dc around next dc post. 1 dc around next dc post. Ch 1) 3 times. (2 dc around next dc post) twice. Turn. 53 sts.

Work 8 rows even in pat. PM at each end of last row.

Brim: Work 3 rows in pat.

Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp to end of row. Turn.

Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Picot. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. Picot. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Fasten off.

Bonnet Band:  Fold back Brim at markers. With larger hook, join yarn with sl st to bottom left corner of Bonnet. Ch 1. Work 46 sc along bottom edge of Bonnet between markers. Ch 17. Turn.

1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 15 ch. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.

3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.

4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 4 sts. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.

5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew button on Bonnet Band to correspond to buttonhole.

Booties
Note: Ch 2 at beg or rnd does not count as st.

With larger hook, ch 12.
1st rnd: 4 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 5 dc). 1 dc in each of next 7 ch. 9 dc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 dc in each of next 7 rem loops. 4 dc in same sp as first 4 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 32 dc.

2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 2 hdc in each of next 4 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 dc. 2 hdc in each of next 9 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 dc. 2 hdc in each of next 4 dc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 50 hdc.

3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 15 hdc. (Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts) 6 times. 1 hdc in each of next 11 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 44 sts.

4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 12 hdc. (Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts) 6 times. 1 hdc in each of last 8 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 38 sts.

5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 10 hdc. (Dc2tog) 8 times. 1 dc in each of last 11 hdc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 30 sts.

6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.

7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *Picot. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. Picot. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Right Strap: With larger hook, ch 14. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 11 ch. 4 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, ch 2. Skip next 2 loops. 1 sc in each of next 9 loops. 2 sc in last loop. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.

Left Strap: With larger hook, ch 14. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 9 ch. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 4 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 11 loops. 2 sc in last loop. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew strap to Bootie as illustrated. Sew button to correspond to buttonhole.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 334 Buff A, 313 Aran B, 319 Cherry Red C, and 312 Black D.
Yarn needle, stuffing material, split-lock stitch marker.
abbreviations: h-inc (hdc increase) = 2 hdc in next st.
s-inc (sc increase) = 2 sc in next st.
dec (decrease) = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Hat directions are for baby size (18” circumference); changes for toddler size (20½” circumference) are in parentheses. Sock Monkey measures 14” high.
gauge: 14 sts = 4”; 10 rounds = 4” in hdc rounds. 16 sts = 4”; 16 rounds = 4” in sc rounds. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauges.
instructions:
BABY HAT
Round 1: With A, make a loop over your fingers, insert hook into the loop and draw up 1 ch; 9 hdc into loop; join with a slip st in first hdc; draw up end to tighten loop – 9 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc in same st as joining, [h-inc] 8 times; join with a slip st in top of ch 2 – 18 sts.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next hdc, [h-inc, hdc in next hdc] 5 times; join – 27 sts.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next 2 hdc, [h-inc, hdc in next 2 hdc] 8 times; join – 36 sts.
Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next 3 hdc, [h-inc, hdc in next 3 hdc] 8 times; join – 45 sts.
Round 6: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next 4 hdc, [h-inc, hdc in next 4 hdc] 8 times; join – 54 sts.
Round 7: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next 5 hdc, [h-inc, hdc in next 5 hdc] 8 times; join – 63 sts.
Toddler Hat Only- Round 8: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next 6 hdc, [h-inc, hdc in next 6 hdc] 8 times; join – 72 sts.
Both Sizes-Round 8 (9): Ch 2, hdc in next hdc and in each hdc around; join.
Rounds 9 and 10 (10 and 11): With B, repeat Round 8 (9).
Rounds 11 and 12 (12 and 13): With C, repeat Round 8 (9).
Rounds 13 and 14 (14 and 15): With B, repeat Round 8 (9).
Round 15 (16): Ch 1, slip st in each st around. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Ear (Make 2)
Row 1: With B, ch 3; 4 hdc in 3rd ch from hook; turn – 5 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc in first hdc, [h-inc] 4 times; turn – 10 sts.
Row 3: Ch 2, hdc in first hdc, hdc in next hdc, [h-inc, hdc in next hdc] 4 times; turn – 15 sts.
Row 4: Ch 2, hdc in first hdc, hdc in next 2 hdc, [h-inc, hdc in next 2 hdc] 4 times; turn – 20 sts.
Toddler Size Only-Row 5: Ch 2, hdc in first hdc, hdc in next 3 hdc, [h-inc, hdc in next 3 hdc] 4 times; turn – 25 sts.
Both Sizes-Row 5 (6): Ch 1, slip st in each st across. Fasten off.
Ear Lining (Make 2)
With C, work as for Ear through Row 3 (4). Fasten off.
FiniSHinG
Sew Ear Linings to Ears. Sew Ears to sides of Hat. Weave in all ends.
MOnKEY
Legs (Make 2)
Round 1: With B, make a loop over your fingers, insert hook into the loop and draw up 1 ch; 6 sc into loop; draw up end to tighten loop – 6 sc. Do not join but work in continuous rounds. Mark last sc of round. Move marker up each round.
Round 2: [S-inc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Rounds 3-8: Sc in each sc around.
Rounds 9-26: With A, sc in each sc around. Cut yarn and set aside first leg. Make 2nd leg, but do NOT cut yarn.
Join Legs/Body
Round 1: Ch 2 for crotch, sc in the 12 sc of first leg, sc in each ch between legs, sc in the 12 sc of 2nd leg, sc in remaining loops of ch – 28 sc.
Rounds 2-16: Sc in each sc around.
Round 17: [Dec, sc in next 5 sc] 4 times – 24 sc.
Round 18: [Dec, sc in next 4 sc] 4 times – 20 sc.
Round 19: [Dec, sc in next 3 sc] 4 times – 16 sc. Fasten off.
Head
Round 1: With A, make a loop over your fingers, insert hook into the loop and draw up 1 ch; 6 sc into loop; draw up end to tighten loop – 6 sc. Do not join but work in continuous rounds. Mark last sc of round. Move marker up each round.
Round 2: [S-inc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Round 3: [S-inc, sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 4: [S-inc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Rounds 5-11: Sc in each sc around.
Round 12: [Dec, sc in next 4 sc] 4 times – 20 sc.
Round 13: [Dec, sc in next 3 sc] 4 times – 16 sc. Fasten off.
Muzzle
Rounds 1-3: With B, work as for Head through Round 3.
Rounds 4 and 5: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off.
Ears (Make 2)
Row 1: With A, ch 3; 8 dc in 3rd ch from hook; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, slip st in each st across. Fasten off.
Arms (Make 2)
Work as for Legs.
Hat
Round 1: With B, make a loop over your fingers, insert hook into the loop and draw up 1 ch; 9 hdc into loop; join with a slip st in first hdc; draw up end to tighten loop – 9 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc in same st as joining, [h-inc] 8 times; join with a slip st in top of ch-2 – 18 sts.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next hdc, [h-inc, hdc in next hdc] 5 times; join – 27 sts.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in next hdc and in each hdc around; join.
Round 5: Ch 1, slip st in each st around. Fasten off.
FiniSHinG
Stuff Legs, Body, Head, Arms and Muzzle. Sew Head to Body. Sew Muzzle and Ears to Head. Flatten tops of Arms and sew to sides of Body. Embroider eyes with D French knots. Embroider mouth with C and make 6 satin sts across Muzzle. For topknot, cut eight (8) 10” strands of C; thread strands through a st at top of hat. Knot strands together with an overhand knot at base. Trim to 1”. Sew Hat to Head.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Pooling®: 1 skein 8310 Haute A
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 311 White B
Susan Bates® Easy Pom Pom Maker, 1½" (4 cm) diameter
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 8 x 22" (20.5 x 56 cm) not including brim edging; Cowl measures 8 x 30" (20.5 x 76 cm). All measurements given with pieces laid flat, before assembly.
gauge: 3 full sc sts per each length of one color in Moss st. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
MOSS STITCH
Ch an even number of sts.
Row 1: Skip 3 ch, sc in next ch, * ch 1, skip 1 foundation ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * to end, turn.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Repeat Row 3 only for Moss st.
HAT / COWL
With A, ch through at least 1 full color sequence, with the last loop on hook being the first loop of a new color just after a color change in the yarn.
Row 1 (right side): Skip 2 ch (counts as a sc), sc in the 3rd ch from hook, * ch 1, sc around the foundation ch (instead of going into a ch st); repeat from * until 1 full color sequences has been completed. The number of sc made in each individual color in the colorway should be 3. Leave remaining ch sts unworked. Undo one st repeat (sc, ch 1), turn.
Note: If at this point you are NOT getting 3 sc per color then redo the row with a different hook size. Getting 3 sc per color with this yarn is essential to making this technique work.
Row 2 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn.
Note: As you work this row and all remaining rows, you MUST get the correct number of sc in each color in order to maintain the planned color pooling. Change hook sizes, or actual st used, to get the correct color in place.
Row 3 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: The color of the sts on this row will shift to the left or right by 1 st from the previous right side row depending on the colorway and if you are right or left handed. It doesn’t matter which direction the st shifts as long as it is off-set by 1.
Row 4 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: The color of the sts on this row will shift to the left or right by 1 st from the previous wrong side row depending on the colorway and if you are right or left handed. It doesn’t matter which direction the st shifts as long as it is off-set by 1.
Repeat Rows 3 and 4 until piece measures 22" (56 cm) ending on a Row 4 (wrong side row).
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Squish or stretch the sts on foundation chain to match the width of the rest of the piece. You can slide the sts around along the foundation chain, as with an adjustable ring. Unravel unused foundation ch sts and weave in yarn tail to secure foundation.
For Hat only:
Brim Edging
With B and right side facing and working across side edge, join with slip st.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), skip one row, * sc in next row, ch 1, skip on row; rep from * to end.
Row 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), * fpdc around next sc, dc in next ch-1 sp; repeat from * to end, turn.
Rows 3 – 6: Ch 2 (does not account as a st), * fpdc around next st, bpdc around next st; repeat from * to end, turn.
Fasten off.
Sew together foundation chain edge and final row of piece.
Position the seam to the back of the hat, then seam together the non brim edge of hat together.
With B, make 2 pompoms and sew one to each corner of Hat.
Weave in all loose ends.
For Cowl only:
Sew together foundation chain edge to the final edge of piece.
Weave in all loose ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn”: 1 ball each 9779 Berry A, 4420 Guacamole B, 3720 Lavender C, and 6768 Pink D.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: To Fit Hand: One size fits most; Finished Hat Circumference: 15 (18)”; Finished Mitten Length: 5”
gauge: 18 sts = 4”; 8 rows = 4” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Beginning at crown with A, ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (RS): Ch 5 (counts as first dc and ch-2 space), [3 dc in ring, ch 2] 4 (5) times, 2 dc in ring; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5, slip st in next ch-2 space, changing to B—5 (6) ch-2 spaces.
Round 2: With B, ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, (sc, ch 3, sc) in center dc of next 3-dc group, [(2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space, (sc, ch 3, sc) in center dc of next 3-dc group] 4 (5) times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3, slip st in next dc, slip st in next ch-2 space, changing to C—5 (6) ch-2 spaces and 5 (6) ch-3 spaces.
Round 3: With C, ch 3, (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space,(2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space, [(2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space] 4 (5) times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3, slip st in next dc, slip st in next ch-2 space, changing to D—10 (12) ch-2 spaces.
Round 4: With D, ch 3, (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space; skip next 2 dc, [dc in space before next dc, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space, skip next 2 dc] 9 (11) times, dcs in space before beginning ch-3; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3, slip st in next dc, slip st in next ch-2 space, changing to A.
Round 5: With A, ch 3, (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, skip next 2 dc, FPdc around next dc, [(2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space, skip next 2 dc, FPdc around next dc] 9 (11) times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3, slip st in next dc, slip st in next ch-2 space, changing to B.
Round 6: With B, repeat Round 5, changing to C in last st.
Round 7: With C, repeat Round 5, changing to D in last st.
Round 8: With D, repeat Round 5, changing to A in last st.
Repeat Rounds 5-8 once (twice) more, ending last Round at ** – DO NOT CHANGE COLOR.
Edging Round: With D, ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in next dc, 3 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in next 2 dc, slip st in next FPdc, *sc in next 2 dc, 3 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in next 2 dc, slip st in FPdc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—80 (96) sts (including slip sts). Fasten off.

MITTENS (make 2)
With D, ch 4.
Round 1: Work 11 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch-3 counts as first dc); join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in same st as join, dc in next dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—18 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in each of next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—24 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in each dc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Rounds 5 and 6: Repeat Round 4, changing to A in last st of Round 6.
Round 7 (Beginning Cuff): With A, ch 3, skip next 2 dc, *(2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next dc, skip next 2 dc**, dc in next dc, skip next 2 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3, slip st in each of next 2 dc, slip st in next ch-2 space, changing to B—4 ch-2 spaces.
Round 8: With B, ch 3, (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, [skip next 2 dc, FPdc around next dc, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space] 3 times, FPdc around next dc (beginning ch-3 of previous round); join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3, slip st in next dc, slip st in next ch-2 space, changing to C.
Round 9: With C, ch 3, (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, FPdc around next FPdc, [(2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space, FPdc around next FPdc] 3 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 **, slip st in next dc, slip st in next ch-2 space, changing to D.
Round 10: With D, repeat Round 9, ending at ** – DO NOT CHANGE COLOR.
Last Round: Repeat Edging Round of Hat—32 sts (including sl sts). Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in all ends.

Flower
Top Layer
With A, ch 5; join with slip st to form a ring. Ch 1, [sc in ring, ch 5] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc and 8 ch-5 spaces. Fasten off.
Middle Layer
With C, ch 5; join with slip st to form a ring. Ch 1, [sc in ring, ch 9] 10 times; join with slip st in first sc—10 sc and 10 ch-9 spaces. Fasten off.
Bottom Layer
With D, ch 5; join with slip st to form a ring. Ch 1, [sc in ring, ch 11] 12 times; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc and 12 ch-11 spaces. Fasten off.
Sew flower layers together and sew flower to top of hat. Using yarn needle and a double strand of B, embroider a French knot through center of flower.

Mitten Ties (make 2)
With C, ch 70. Fasten off.

Tassel
Cut one 4” strand each of A, B, C, and D. Fold the 4 strands of yarn in half. Insert hook in one end of tie and into fold of strands. Draw fold through to form a loop (do not pull the strands all the way through, just the folded end). Insert ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten. Trim ends evenly. Repeat for tassel on other end of tie. Weave tie through Round 6 of Mitten and tie ends in a bow.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton (Solids: 50 g/ 1.75 oz/73 m/80 yds)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Finished measurements: Bib measures 6½ ins [16.5 cm].
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]
instructions:
BIB
With MC, ch 20.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. T urn. 19 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. Ch 1. T urn.
3rd row: 1 sc in each st to end of row. T urn.
4th to 9th rows: Rep last 2 rows 3 times more.
27 sts.
Cont even until work from beg measures 6½ ins [16.5 cm], ending with RS facing for next row.
Shape neck: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sts. Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made. Turn.Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each st to end of row. T urn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. T urn. 5 sts.
Work 10 rows even.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. T urn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last st. 2 sc in last st. T urn.
Rep last 2 rows twice more. Fasten off.
With RS of work facing, miss next 11 sts. Join MC with sl st to next st. Ch 1. Sc2tog over this st and next st. 1 sc in each st to end of row. T urn.
Work to correspond to first side, reversing all shapings.
Edging: Join A with sl st to top left corner of neck edge. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 1 row sc evenly around all edges. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Working around outer edge only, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 3. Ss in first ch – picot made. Rep from * to opposite side. Fasten off. With A, make button loop at center back on left side. Sew button in position. If desired, embroider day of week onto bib as illustrated. With A, split yarn into 2 plys and embroider letters using chain stitch.

BOOTIES
With MC, ch 16.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch.  T urn. 15 sts.
2nd row: Working into back loop only of each st, ch 1. Work 1 sc in each st to end of row. T urn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 6¼ ins [16 cm] when slightly stretched. Do not fasten off.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 23 sc evenly across long edge of cuff. Join A. T urn.
2nd row: With A, ch 1. Work 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Instep: 1st row: With RS of work facing, miss first 7 sts. Join A with sl st to next st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. T urn. 9 sts.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. T urn.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2tog. T urn.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
Sew center back seam. With RS of work facing, join A with sl st at center back. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Work 5 sc down side of instep. 3 sc in corner sc. 3 sc across end of instep. 3 sc in corner sc. Work 5 sc along other side of instep. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Join with sl st to first st. 33 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join MC with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in back loops only, work 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off. Join center foot seam.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 (2, 2) skeins each 319 Cherry Red A and 316 Soft White B, 1 skein 385 Royal C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 4mm [G-6 US] and 5.5mm [I-9 US]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Hat measures 16 (18, 20)" [40.5 (45.5, 51) cm] circumference at brim. Blanket measures 24" x 24" (30" x 30", 36" x 36") [61 x 61 (76 x 76, 91.5 x 91.5) cm]
gauge: 12 dc = 4” (10 cm) in pattern; 7 rows = 4” (10 cm) with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BLANKET
With larger hook and A, ch 73 (91, 109).
Row 1 (right side): Dc into 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc) and in each ch across, turn—72 (90, 108) sts.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each st to beginning ch, dcin top of beginning ch; change to B in last st, turn.
Rows 3 and 4: Repeat Row 2; change to A in last st of Row 4.
Rows 5 and 6: Repeat Row 2; change to B in last st of Row 6.
Rows 7–42 (7–50, 7–62): Repeat Rows 3–6 nine (eleven, fourteen) times. Do not change to B or fasten off.
BORDER
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in each st across; work 2 sc in end of each row to first row; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch; work 2 sc in end of each row to last row; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off.
HAT
With larger hook and C, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), work 11 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 sts. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 2, dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 sts.
Round 3: Ch 2, dc in same st as join, dc in next st, [2 dc in next st, dc in next st] 11 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 sts.
Round 4: Ch 2, dc in same st as join, dc in next 2 st, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 st] 11 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 sts.
Directions are for size Small. Changes for sizes Medium and Large are in parentheses
Rounds 5–10: Ch 2, dc in each st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Do not fasten off.
Size Medium only
Round 5: Ch 2, dc in same st as join, dc in next 7 st, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 7 st] 5 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—54 sts. 
Rounds 6–11: Ch 2, dc in each st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Do not fasten off.
Size Large only
Round 5: Ch 2, dc in same st as join, dc in next 3 st, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 3 st] 11 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—60 sts.
Rounds 6–12: Ch 2, dc in each st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Do not fasten off.
Right Earflap
Row 1 (right side): Ch 2, dc2tog, dc in next 3 sts, dc2tog, dc in next st, turn—7 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc into each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, [dc2tog, dc in next st] twice—5 sts. Fasten off.
Left Earflap 
With right side facing, join C with slip st in 17th (19th, 22nd) st to the left of last st of right earflap. Work same as Rows 1–3 of right earflap. 
Border 
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, join C with slip st in any st at back of hat, ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc evenly around, working 3 sc in first and last sts of each row of each earflap; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Round 2: With right side facing, join B with slip st in any st at back of hat, ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Star (make 3)
With smaller hook and B, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), work 9 hdc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—10 sts. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: [Ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, hdc into next ch, dc in next ch, skip last ch, skip next st, slip st in next st (point made)] 5 times—5 points. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Braids 
Cut six 28” (71 cm) lengths of each color. Separate each 6-strand group into 2 hanks of 3 strands each. Thread one hank of each color through last row of earflap and fold over so strands are doubled. Braid doubled hanks until 4” (10 cm) of strands remain, tie an overhand knot tightly, and trim ends evenly. Repeat with remaining hanks for other earflap.
Sew stars on hat as desired.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Treasure™: 3 balls 1918 Abstract, 1901 Mosaic, or 1913 Spectrum
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat Circumference: 20 (22)” (51 (56) cm), Scarf measures 6” x 60”, (15 cm x 152.5 cm)
gauge: 12 sts = 4” [10cm]; 9 rows/rounds = 4” [10cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
Igloo Snail Hat 
and Scarf
This clever hat is crocheted without joining 
the rounds and reminded the designer of a 
snail’s shell…thus the name, Snail Hat. Add a 
scarf for the perfect set to warm you. This is 
a superb gift set idea!
For All Sizes
Next Round: Dc in each dc around.
Repeat last round until piece measures 6” 
[15cm] from beginning, end 3 sts before 
beginning marker, hdc in next st, sc in next st, 
slip st in last st.
Fasten off.
SCARF
Ch 22.
Row 1: Working in front loops only, dc in 4th 
ch from hook and in each ch across – 20 dc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, 
sc in each st across.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, dc in each st across.
Repeat last 2 rows until piece measures 60” 
[152.5cm], end with Row 2.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
NOTE
Hat is worked in continuous rounds, working 
in back loops only of each st throughout. 
Scarf is worked in front loops of only of each 
st throughout.
HAT
Ch 4, slip st to first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and 
throughout), work 11 dc into ring – 12 dc.
Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Working in back loops only 
throughout, 2 dc in each dc around – 24 dc.
Round 3: [2 dc in next st, dc in next dc] 
around – 36 dc.
Round 4: [2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 dc] 
around – 48 dc.
Round 5: [2 dc in next st, dc in next 3 dc] 
around – 60 dc.
For Large Size Only
Round 6: [2 dc in next st, dc in next 9 dc] 
around – 66 dc.

materials: Red Heart® Soft® (5 oz/141 g; 256 yds/234 m) White (4600) 6 balls
Size U.S. H/8 [8 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2½ yds of ¼-inch white double-faced satin ribbon.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Scbp = Draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook - 1 scbp made
Shell = (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in indicated stitch
measurements: Blanket: Approx 37" x 38" [94 x 96.5 cm]. Sweater, Booties and Hat: To fit Infant 0-6 months. Finished Chest Measurement: 20" [51 cm].
gauge: 6 rows of Shells = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Note: Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as dc. SWEATER Ch 74. 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 73 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 3. Skip next 3 sc. Shell in next sc. *Skip next 3 sc. Shell in next sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. Skip next 3 sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. 17 shells. 4th row: Ch 3. *Shell in ch-1 sp of next Shell. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. Rep 4th row for pat until work from beg measures 7½" [19 cm]. Do not fasten off. Sleeves With 2nd ball of yarn, ch 24. 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 23 sc. 2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 6th row: Ch 3. Skip next sc. Shell in next sc. *Skip next 2 sc. Shell in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Skip next sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. 7th row: Ch 3. *Shell in ch-1 sp of next Shell. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. Rep 7th row for pat until work from beg measures 7½" [19 cm]. Fasten off. Yoke Pick up yarn at end of last row of body. 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 1 sc in each dc of next 3 shells. *With WS of last row of sleeve facing. Skip 1 dc and first shell on sleeve. 1 sc in each dc of next 5 shells.** Skip 2 shells of body (for underarm). 1 sc in each dc of next 7 shells. Rep from * to **. Skip 2 shells of body. 1 sc in each dc of last 3 shells. 1 sc in last dc. Turn. 94 sc for yoke. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 71 sts. 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 4th row:  (Eyelet row). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of the first 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc for eyelet. 1 sc in each sc to last 4 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and 2 sc in each ch-2 sp. Turn. 6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of the next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn. 62 sts. 7th to 9th rows: Repeat Rows 3-5. 10th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from *, ending with sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 50 sts. 11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of the first 2 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 38 sts. 12th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 13th row: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in next st, *Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * around neck. Sl st in last dc. Fasten off. Sew sleeve seams and underarms. Cut 36" [91.5 cm] of ribbon. Weave under and over dc of 12th row. Knot ends of ribbon and cut ends at an angle below knots. HAT Ch 41. 1st row: (RS). Shell in 5th ch from hook. *Skip next 3 ch. Shell in next ch. Rep from * to last 4 ch. Skip next 3 ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. (9 shells and 1 dc at each side). 2nd row: Ch 3. Shell in ch-1 sp of each shell, ending with dc in top of turning ch-3. Turn. 3rd to 7th rows: As 2nd row. Fasten off at end of last row. Back of Hat: Join yarn with sl st in ch-3 sp of beg chain before 4th shell from side. 1st row:  (RS). Ch 3. Shell at base of each of the next 3 shells. 1 dc in next ch-3 space. Turn. Work in pat for 3 more rows. 5th row: Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in each shell. 1 dc in top of turning ch-3. Turn. Rep 5th row once more. Fasten off. Sew back seam. Lower Edge: Join yarn with sl st on RS at lower front edge. 1st row: (RS). Working across neck edge. 2 sc in each shell row, 11 sc across back edge. 2 sc in each row on other side. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and 2 sc in each ch-2 sp. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Cut 36" [91.5 cm] of ribbon. Lace through eyelets at neck edge. Finish ribbon as for Sweater. BOOTIES Note: Do not join at end of rnd. Work in spiral rnds. Ch 10. 1st rnd: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of the next 7 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working along other side of chain, 1 sc in each of the next 7 sc. Do not turn. PM for beg of rnd. 2nd rnd: 2 sc in each of the next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of the next 7 sc. 2 sc in each of the next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of the next 7 sc. 3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * twice. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of the next 7 sc. 4th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. 5th rnd:  (Ridge around sole). *1 scbp around next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 6th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Rep last rnd twice more. Join with sl st to first sc at end of last rnd. Fasten off. INSTEP Ch 4. 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 2 ch. Turn 3 sc. 2nd row:  Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc (increase made). 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc. 3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of the next 3 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sc. 4th to 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of the next 7 sc. Turn. Fasten off at end of last row. UPPERS Ch 8. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in each of next 7 sc of Instep. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 8. Shell in 4th ch from hook. Skip next 2 ch. Shell in next ch. Skip next 2 sts. Shell in next sc. Skip next 3 sc. Shell in next sc *Skip next 2 sts. Shell in next st. Rep from *, ending with: skip next st. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 3rd to 6th rows: Ch 3. Shell in each shell to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. Fasten off at end of last row. Sew back seam. Sew instep and uppers to sole. Cut two 18" [45.5 cm] long pieces of ribbon. Weave through sps just above instep. Finish ribbon as for Sweater. BLANKET Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. Ch 127. 1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 125 dc. 2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of the next 5 dc. (Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc) 56 times. Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp across. Turn. 125 sc. 5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of the next 5 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. (Skip next 3 sc. Shell) 13 times. Skip next 2 sc. 1 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. (Shell. Skip next 3 sc) 12 times. Shell in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next 3 sc. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 dc in each of the last 5 dc and in top of beginning ch-3. Turn. 6th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of the next 5 dc. Ch 1. Skip ch-1 space, dc in next dc. Ch 1. (Shell in ch-1 space of next shell] 13 times. 1 dc in center single dc. (Shell in ch-1 space of next shell] 13 times. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 space. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 7th to 55th rows: Repeat 6th row. 56th row: Ch 1. Work 125 sc spaced evenly across to match 4th row. Turn. 57th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of the next 5 sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. 1 dc in each of last 6 sc. Turn. 58th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of the next 5 dc. *1 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from *, ending with 1 dc in each of last 6 dc. Turn. 59th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 60th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off. With WS facing, join yarn with sl st at beg of foundation chain. Ch 1. Work 125 sc across foundation chain. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Stripes™”: 6 balls 944 Breezy Stripe A.
RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 ball each 316 Soft White B, 883 Spa Blue C, 256 Carrot D, and 327 Light Coral E.
Crochet Hooks: 5mm [US H-8] for blanket; 4mm [US G-6] for doll.
Yarn needle, split lock stitch marker, stuffing, brown and red pearl cotton for embroidery.
abbreviations: bobble = * [yo] twice, insert hook in next sc and draw up a loop, [yo and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice; repeat from * 4 more times in same sc, yo and draw through all 6 loops on hook.
