With RS of work facing, miss next 11 sts. Join MC with sl st to next st. Ch 2. Hdc2tog over this st and next st. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Work to correspond to first side, reversing all shapings.
Edging: Join A with sl st to top left corner of neck edge. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 1 row sc evenly around all edges. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Working around outer edge only, ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc to opposite side. Fasten off. With A, make button loop at center back on left side. Sew button in position.
BOOTIES
With A, ch 28.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 27 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join MC.  Turn.
3rd row: With MC, ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. *Ch 1. Miss next st. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Ch 1. Miss next st. 1 hdc in next st. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each st or ch 1 sp to end of row. Join A. Turn.
5th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Long tr in next missed ch 2 rows below. Miss next st (behind long tr). 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Long tr in next missed ch 2 rows below. Miss next st (behind long tr). 1 sc in last st. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sts. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 sc in each of last 3 sts. Turn. 23 sts.
7th row: (Eyelet row). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sts. *Ch 1. Miss next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st or ch 1 sp to end of row. Fasten off.
Instep: 1st row: With RS of work facing, miss first 7 sts. Join A with sl st to next st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Turn. 9 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row.  Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
Sew center back seam. With RS of work facing, join A with sl st at center back seam. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Work 5 sc down side of instep. 3 sc in corner sc. 5 sc across end of instep. 3 sc in corner sc. Work 5 sc along other side of instep. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Join with sl st to first st. 35 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join MC with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in back loops only work 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 13 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 13 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st.
Fasten off. Join center foot seam.
Drawstring: 
With MC, chain a length to measure 16 ins [40.5 cm]. Fasten off. Weave drawstring through eyelet row. Knot ends of drawstring.

pattern_name: Holiday Photo Op Dress and Hat
materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 2 (3, 3, 4) balls of 9925 Really Red A
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
( ) = work directions in parenthesis the number of times specified
measurements: Dress Finished Chest: 21 (24, 25, 28)" [53.5 (61, 63.5, 71) cm]; Finished Length: 18 (20, 22, 24)" [45.5 (50.5, 56, 60.5) cm]; Hat circumference at bottom edge: 18 (20)" [46 (51 cm]
gauge: 12 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern stitch (1 row worked in hdc and 1 row worked in dc).
instructions:
DRESS
With A, work 46 (50, 50, 54) Fsc loosely. Set Up Row (Right Side): Ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), turn, dc in next 7 (8, 8, 9) sts for one side of back, 3 dc in next st, place marker in center dc as corner st, dc in next 8 sts for sleeve, 3 dc in next st, place marker in center dc as corner st, dc in next 12 (14, 14, 16) sts for front, 3 dc in next st, place marker in center dc as corner st, dc in next 8 sts for sleeve, 3 dc in next sc, place marker in center dc as corner st, dc in next 7 (8, 8, 9) sts for opposite side of back – 54 (58, 58, 62) sts; 8 (9, 9, 10) sts in each back section, 10 sts in each sleeve section, 14 (16, 16, 18) sts in front section and 4 marked corner sts.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, turn, [hdc in each st to marked center st, 3 hdc in marked st] 4 times, hdc in each st to end of row – 62 (66, 66, 70) sts; 9 (10, 10, 11) sts in each back section, 12 sts in each sleeve section, 16 (18, 18, 20) sts in front section and 4 marked corner sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, turn, [dc in each hdc to marked st, 3 dc in marked st] 4 times, dc in each st to end of row – 70 (74, 74, 78) sts; 10 (11, 11, 12) sts in each back section, 14 sts in each sleeve section, 18 (20, 20, 22) sts in front section and 4 marked corner sts.
Repeat Rows 1-2 for 2 (2, 3, 3) more times, then work Row 1 for 0 (1, 0, 1) time – 102 (114, 122, 134) sts total on last row worked; 14 (16, 17, 19) sts each back section, 22 (24, 26, 28) sts in each sleeve section, 26 (30, 32, 36) sts front section and 4 marked corner sts.
Piece should measure 4½ (5, 5½, 6)" [11.5 (12.5, 14, 15) cm] from beginning.
Divide for Underarms  Keeping in pattern stitch, work across back sts to marked st, remove marker and work marked st, ch 3, skip 22 (24, 26, 28) sleeve sts, remove marker, work marked st and across 26 (30, 32, 36) front sts to marked st, remove marker, work marked st, ch 3, skip 22 (24, 26, 28) sleeve sts, remove marker, work marked st, work to end of row – 58 (66, 70, 78) sts and two ch-3 spaces. Mark center ch of each ch-3 for side seam.
Body of Dress  Keeping in pattern stitch, work in each st and ch to end of row – 64 (72, 76, 84) sts. Mark center st worked in ch-3 space. Work one row even. 
Increase Row: [Work to 2 sts before marked st, work 2 sts in next st, work 3 sts keeping marker in center st, work 2 sts in next st] twice, work to end of row – 68 (76, 80, 88) sts.
Keeping in pattern, repeat Increase Row every 4th row 6 (7, 8, 9) times – 92 (104, 112, 120) sts on last row worked.
Work in pattern stitch until piece measures 13 (14½, 16, 17½)" [33 (37, 40.5, 44.5) cm] from underarm or ½" [1.5 cm] shorter than desired length, end with a wrong side row.
Bottom Edging Row (Right Side): Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, ch 2, 2 hdc in same st as sc, skip next st, [sc in next st, ch 2, 2 hdc in same st as sc, skip next st] to end of row, sc in last st. Fasten off, leaving a tail long enough for sewing up back seam.
Armhole Edging  With right side facing, join yarn at center of underarm with a slip st, ch 1, sc in same st, ch 2, 2 hdc in same st as sc, skip next st, [sc in next st, ch 2, 2 hdc in same st as sc, skip next st] to end of row, slip st in first st. Fasten off.
SNOWFLAKE POCKETS (make 2)  With B, ch 5, slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1: Ch 1, work 12 sc in center of ring, slip st in first sc – 12 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, work 2 sc in each sc, slip st in first sc – 24 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in next sc, [ch 7, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc] 5 times, ch 7, skip next 3 sc, slip st in first sc – 6 ch-7 spaces and 6 sc.
Round 4: Slip st in first ch-7 space, ch 1, [(sc, hdc, 2 dc, tr, picot, 2 dc, hdc, sc) all in ch-7 space] 6 times, slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING  Sew back seam. Sew pockets in place. Weave in ends.
HAT
Round 1 (Right Side): With A, ch 3 (counts as dc here), work 8 dc in 3rd ch from hook, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 9 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, turn, work 2 hdc in each dc, slip st in first hdc – 18 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 1, turn, [dc in next hdc, 2 dc in next hdc] 9 times, slip st in first dc – 27 dc.
Round 3: Ch 1, turn, [hdc in next 2 dc, 2 hdc in next dc] 9 times, slip st in first hdc – 36 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 1, turn, [dc in next 3 hdc, 2 dc in next hdc] 9 times, slip st in first dc – 45 dc.
Round 5: Ch 1, turn, [hdc in next 4 dc, 2 hdc in next dc] 9 times, slip st in first hdc – 54 hdc.
Large Size Only
Round 6: Ch 1, turn, [dc in next 8 hdc, 2 dc in next hdc] 6 times, slip st in first dc – 60 dc.
Both Sizes  Keeping in pattern stitch (work 1 round in dc and 1 round in hdc), work until Hat measures 6½ (7)" [16.5 (18) cm] or desired height, end with a wrong side row.
Edging Round (Right Side): Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, ch 2, 2 hdc in same st as sc, skip next st, [sc in next st, ch 2, 2 hdc in same st as sc, skip next st] around, slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Pompom  Using Pompom maker and B, make a 2"-3" [5-7.5 cm] pompon. Sew on top of Hat. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 312 Black A, 356 Amethyst B, 316 Soft White C, and 400 Grey Heather D
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses in same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Blanket measures: 24” x 24” (30” x 30”, 36” x 36”) [61 x 61 (76 x 76, 91.5 x 91.5) cm], without border. Hat measures: 14 (16, 18, 20)” [35.5, (40.5, 45.5, 51) cm] circumference at brim.
gauge: 12 dc = 4” (10 cm) in pattern; check your gauge. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BLANKET
With A, ch 74 (92, 110).
Row 1 (wrong side): Dc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc) and in each ch across, turn—72 (90, 108) sts.
Row 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), dc in first st, [skip next st, dc in next st, working in front of st just made, dc in skipped st] 35 (44, 53) times, dc in top of beginning ch; change to B, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, dc in each st across.
Row 4: Ch 2, dc in first st, [skip next stitch, dc in next stitch, working in front of stitch just made, dc in skipped stitch] 35 (44, 53) times, dc in last st; change to C in last st, turn.
Rows 5–40 (48, 56): Repeat Rows 3 and 4 twenty (twenty-four, twenty-eight) times and change color as in the following color sequence: Work 2 rows with C, 2 rows with D, *2 rows with A, 2 rows with B, 2 rows with C, 2 rows with D; repeat from * 3 (4, 5) times. Change to A in last st of Row 40 (48, 56).
Sizes Small and Medium only
Rows 41 (49) and 42 (50): Repeat Rows 3 and 4 once more.
Fasten off.
Size Large only
Rows 57–62: Repeat Rows 3 and 4 three times more and change color as in the following color sequence: Work 2 rows with A, 2 rows with B, 2 rows with C.
Fasten off.
Border
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, join D with sc in first st of last row, 2 sc in same st, sc in each st across to last st, 3 sc in last st; working in ends of rows of first side, *4 sc in next even-numbered row, skip next odd-numbered row; repeat from * to first row; working across opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch, sc in each ch across to last ch, 3 sc in last ch; working in ends of rows of other side, **skip next odd-numbered row, 4 sc in next even-numbered row; repeat from ** to first sc; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
HAT
With A, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), work 11 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 sts. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 2, dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 sts.
Round 3: Ch 2, dc in same st as join, dc in next st, [2 dc in next st, dc in next st] 11 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 sts.
Round 4: Ch 2, dc in same st as join, dc in next 2 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts] 11 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 sts.
Sizes Medium, Large, and Extra Large only
Round 5: Ch 2, same st as join, dc in next 7 (3, 3) sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 7 (3, 3) sts] 5 (11, 11) times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—54 (60, 60) sts.
Size Extra Large only
Round 6: Ch 2, same st as join, dc in next 9 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 9 sts] 9 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—66 sts.
All sizes
Round 5 (6, 6, 7): Ch 1, sc in each st around; change to B; join with slip st in first sc—48 (54, 60, 66) sts.
Round 6 (7, 7, 8): Ch 2, dc in the last st of previous round, [skip next stitch, dc in next stitch, working in front of stitch just made, dc in skipped stitch] 23 (26, 29, 32) times; change to A; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 7 (8, 8, 9): Repeat Round 5 (6, 6, 7); change to C.
Round 8 (9, 9, 10): Repeat Round 6 (7, 7, 8).
Round 9 (10, 10, 11): Repeat Round 5 (6, 6, 7); change to D.
Round 10 (11, 11, 12): Repeat Round 6 (7, 7, 8).
Round 11 (12, 12, 13): Repeat Round 5 (6, 6, 7).
Round 12 (13, 13, 14): Ch 2, dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Do not fasten off.
Sizes Large and Extra Large only
Round 14 (15): Repeat Round 13 (14). Do not fasten off.
Earflaps
Note: Continue in rows.
Right Earflap
Row 1: Ch 2, skip next st, dc in next 7 (9, 9, 9) sts, skip next st, dc in next st; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—9 (11, 11, 11) sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, skip next st, dc in next 5 (7, 7, 7) sts, skip next st, dc in the last st—7 (9, 9, 9) sts.
Row 3: Ch 2, skip next st, dc in next 3 (5, 5, 5) sts, skip next st, dc in the last st—5 (7, 7, 7) sts.
Row 4: Ch 2, skip next st, dc in next 1 (3, 3, 3) st(s), skip next st, dc in the last st—3 (5, 5, 5) sts.
Size Small only
Fasten off.
Sizes Medium, Large, and Extra Large only
Row 5: Ch 2, skip next st, dc in next st, skip next st, dc in the last st—3 (3, 3) dc. Fasten off.
Left Earflap
With right side facing, join A with slip st in 18th (20th, 22nd, 24th) st to the left of last st of right earflap. Work same as right earflap.
Border
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, join D with sc in any st at center back of hat, sc in each st around, working 2 sc in ends of each row of ear flaps; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® 'Soft Baby ™', Art.E705 (7 ounce/575 yard solid; 6 ounce/430 yard print, multicolor and twinkle skeins)
CA: 5 (5 1/2, 6, 6 1/2) Ounces for Cardigan; 1 3/4 (2, 2 1/4) ounces for Hat
CB: small amounts each for Cardigan or Hat
Yarn needle, stitch markers, five 3/4" buttons, sewing needle and thread
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
gauge: 13 sts = 3"; 22 rows = 5" in pat with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CARDIGAN
BACK: With larger hook and CA, ch 50 (54, 58, 62). Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 49 (53, 57, 61) sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * tr in next sc, sc in next sc; rep from * across; turn. Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn. Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, * tr in next sc, sc in next sc; rep from * to last sc; sc in last sc; turn. Row 5: Rep Row 2. Rep Rows 2-5 for pat until 9 1/2 (10 1/2, 11, 11 1/2)" from beg. Fasten off. Ribbing: With right side facing and smaller hook, attach CB at lower edge; ch 3, work 47 (51, 55, 59) dc across changing to CC in last st; turn – 48 (52, 56, 60) sts. Work Ribbing Row twice with CC, then once with CB. Fasten off.
LEFT FRONT: With larger hook and CA, ch 24 (26, 28, 30). Work in pat same as for back over 23 (25, 27, 29) sts until 8 (9, 9 1/2, 10)" from beg, end wrong side row. Shape Neck: Keeping continuity of pat, work across first 18 (20, 21, 23) sts; turn and leave rem 5 (5, 6, 6) sts unworked. Dec 1 st at neck edge on next 2 rows – 16 (18, 19, 21) sts. Work even until front measures same as Back. Fasten off. Ribbing: Work same as for Back over 22 (24, 26, 28) sts.
RIGTH FRONT: Work same as Left Front, reversing neck shaping.
SLEEVES: With larger hook and CA, ch 32. Work 2 rows in pat same as for Back over 31 sts. Shape sides by inc 1 st each end of every right side row until there are 43 (49, 49, 53) sts, working added sts into pat. Work even until 5 1/2 (6 1/2, 7, 7 1/2)" from beg. Fasten off. Ribbing: Work same as for Back over 30 sts.
FINISHING - Neckband: Sew shoulder seams. With right side facing and smaller hook, attach CB at right front neck edge, ch 3, dc in next 4 (4, 5, 5) sts, work 9 dc to seam, 16 (16, 18, 18) dc across back, 9 dc down left neck, 5 (5, 6, 6) dc across front changing to CC; turn – 44 (44, 48, 48) sts. Work Ribbing Row twice with CC, then once with CB. Fasten off.
Button Band (right for boys, left for girls): With right side facing and smaller hook, attach CB and work 1 row sc evenly across front edge. Work 3 rows sc with CC, then 1 row with CB. Fasten off.
Buttonhole Band (left for boys, right for girls): Work 2 rows same as for Button band. Mark for 5 evenly spaced buttonholes. Next Row: Ch 1, [sc to marker, ch 2, skip 2 sc] 5 times, sc to end; turn. Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across and 2 sc in each sp; turn. Work last sc row with CB. Fasten off.
Mark 5 (5 1/2, 5 1/2, 6)" down from shoulders on front and back. Place center of sleeve tops at shoulder seams and sew in place between markers. Sew side and sleeve seams. Sew on buttons. Weave in ends.
HAT: With larger hook and CA, ch 74 (78, 83). Work in pat same as for Cardigan Back over 73 (77, 81) sts until 4 1/2 (5, 5 1/2)" from beg. Shape Crown: Ch 1, sc in first sc; * draw up a lp in next 2 sts, yo and draw through all 3 lps on hook – sc2tog made; rep from * across; turn – 37 (39, 41) sc. Rep last row 2 (1, 2) times – 10 (20, 11) sc. Size Medium Only: Ch 1, * sc2tog; rep from * across – 10 sc. All Sizes: Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Weave tail through tops of rem sc; gather tightly and fasten securely. Ribbing: Work same as for Back over 72 (76, 80) sts. Sew back seam.
With 1 strand each CB and CC held together, make a 2" pompom. Attach to top of hat.

materials: Patons® Shetland Chunky (100 g / 3.5 oz) Mittens (03607 Harvest Variegate) 4 balls
Sizes 5.5 mm (U.S. I or 9) and 6 mm (U.S. J or 10) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
measurements: One size to fit Average Lady.
gauge: 12 sc and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Mittens
Right Mitten
**With smaller hook, ch 8. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 7 sc. T urn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. 
Rep last row until work, when slightly stretched, measures 7 ins [18 cm]. 
Change to larger hook. Ch 1. T urn and working along side edge of ribbing, proceed as follows:
1st row: Work 25 sc along side edge evenly spaced. T urn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. 
Rep last row until Mitten above cuff measures 1½ ins [4 cm], ending with RS facing for next row.** 
Shape thumb gusset: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. T urn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. T urn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. T urn. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. T urn. 
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. T urn. 
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Ch 1 (place marker for thumb). Miss next 11 sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. 25 sts. T urn. 
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st and ch 1 sp to end of row. T urn. 
Cont even until Mitten above cuff measures 6 ½ ins [16.5 cm], ending with RS facing for next row. 
***Proceed as follows:
1st row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of first 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook– sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 21 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. T urn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 17 sc. 
4th row: As 2nd row. 
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 13 sc. Fasten off. 
Sew top and side seam. 
Thumb: With RS of work facing and larger hook, join yarn with ss at ch 1 marker for Thumb. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as ss. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with ss to first sc. 12 sc. 
Rep last rnd until Thumb measures 2½ ins [6 cm]. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts. Fasten off leaving a long end. Thread yarn through darning needle and draw through rem sts. Fasten tightly.*** 
Left Mitten
Work from ** to ** as given for Right Mitten. 
Shape thumb gusset: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. T urn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. T urn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. T urn. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. T urn. 
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. T urn. 
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Ch 1 (place marker for Thumb). Miss next 11 sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 25 sts. T urn. 
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st and ch 1 sp to end of row. T urn. 
Cont even until Mitten above cuff measures 6½ ins [16.5 cm], ending with RS facing for next row. 
Work from *** to *** as given for Right Mitten. 
Hat
With larger hook, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with ss to first sc.  
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last ss. 2 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with ss to first sc. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last ss. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * twice more. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with ss to first sc. 20 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last ss. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with ss to first sc. 25 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last ss. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join with ss to first sc. 30 sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last ss. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join with ss to first sc. 36 sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last ss. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Join with ss to first sc. 42 sc. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * 4 times more. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with ss to first sc. 48 sc. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with ss to first sc. 
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * twice more. 2 sc in next sc. Join with ss to first sc. 52 sc. 
11th rnd: As 9th rnd. 
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Rep from * twice more. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join with ss to first sc. 56 sc. 
13th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last ss. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Join with ss to first sc. 61 sc. 
14th to 16th rnds: As 9th rnd. 
17th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * 3 times more. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join with ss to first sc. 66 sc. 
18th to 20th rnds: As 9th rnd. 
21st rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last ss. *1 sc in each of next 12 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Join with ss to first sc. 71 sc. 
22nd and 23rd rnds: As 9th rnd. 
24th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * 3 times more. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Join with ss to first sc. 76 sc. 
25th and 26th rnds: As 9th rnd. 
27th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last ss. *1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Join with ss to first sc. 81 sc. 
28th rnd: As 9th rnd. 
29th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Rep from * 3 times more. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Join with ss to first sc. 86 sc. 
30th and 31st rnds: As 9th rnd. 
32nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left, as usual (see diagram), work 1 sc in each sc around for reverse sc. Join with ss to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® 'Soft Yarn ™', Art. E728 (5 ounce/256 yard solid; 4 ounce/204 yard multi color ball)
abbreviations: CA, CB, CC = Colors A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Scarf measures 5½" x 60". Hat Circumference: 18 (20, 22)". Wrist circumference: 7 (7½, 8)".
gauge: Scarf: 8 sts = 4"; 10 rows = 4" with 3 strands using larger hook in pat. Hat & Wristlets: 15 sts = 4"; 18 rows = 4" with one strand and smaller hook in pat.
instructions:
SCARF
With larger hook and one strand each CA, CB, and CC held tog as one, ch 121.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 120 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in BACK LP ONLY of each sc across; turn.
Rep Row 2 for pat until there are a total of 14 rows – about 7" when slightly stretched. Fasten off.
FINISHING: Make 2 large pompoms: wrap CA, CB, and CC held tog around a 3" cardboard 75 times. Remove from cardboard, tie tightly in middle; clip, then trim ends. Gather ends of scarf, fasten securely. Sew a pompom to each end. Weave in ends.

HAT
With smaller hook and CA, ch 35 (39, 43).
Work in pat same as for Scarf over 34 (38, 42) sc until there are a total of 76 (80, 84) rows – about 18 (20, 22)" when slightly stretched. Fasten off.
FINISHING: Sl st seam tog: Holding beg ch edge with wrong side facing, sl st into first ch AND into BACK LP ONLY of last sc row, continue across both edges sl st corresponding ch and back lps tog across. Fasten off.
Crown Shaping: Turn right side out. With right side facing, smaller hook and CA, attach yarn at seam; ch 1, work 76 (80, 84) sc around entire top edge; join with a sl st in first sc.

WRISTLETS (Make 2)
With smaller hook and CA, ch 20 (22, 24).
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 19 (21, 23) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in BACK LP ONLY of first 9 (10, 11) sc, ch 1, skip next sc, sc in BACK LP ONLY of next 9 (10, 11) sc; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in BACK LP of each sc and ch across; turn.
Rep Rows 2 and 3 for pat until there are a total of 30 (32, 34) rows. An eyelet for wrist tie is created by ch-1 sps.
FINISHING: Sl st side seam tog as for back seam of Hat. Turn right side out.
Top Edging: Work same as for Hat Brim Edging working 28 (30, 32) sc at top edge.
Bottom Edging: Work same as for Hat Brim Edging working 30 (32, 34) sc at bottom edge.
Weave in ends.
Tie (Make 2): With smaller hook and CA, ch 85. Fasten off. Beg and ending at side edge, weave tie through ch-1 sps at wrist. Make 4 small pompoms: wrap CA, CB, and CC around a 1½" cardboard 30 times; remove from cardboard, tie in center; clip, then trim ends. Sew one pompom on each end of each tie. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™: 2 balls of 100 Lily A; 1 ball each of 112 Night Night B, 902 Ladybug C and 691 Grass D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 4.25 mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle, stitch marker and three ½” (13mm) sew-on snaps.
abbreviations: A, B, C, D = color A, B, C, D
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Finished Chest: 20 (22, 24)” (51 [56, 61] cm), Finished Length: 9 (10½, 12)” (23 [26.5, 30.5) cm), Hat: To fit head size 15 (17)” (38 [43] cm)
gauge: 14 sts and 16 rows in Puff Stitch Pattern = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Body
With A, ch 70 (78, 86)
Set-up Row: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across turn – 69 (77, 85) sc. 
Work even in patt until body measures 5 (6, 7)” (12.5 [15, 18] cm) from beginning, ending with a wrong side row.
Divide for Fronts and Back
Right Front
Row 1: Work in patt across first 17 (19, 21) sts, turn. 
Work even in patt on 17 (19, 21) sts until front measures 2 (2½, 3)” (5 [ 6.5, 7.5] cm), ending with a right side row. 
Shape Neck
Next Row: Work in patt across to last 8 sts, turn, leaving remaining sts unworked – 9 (11, 13) sts.
Work even on 9 (11, 13) sts until Right Front measures 4 (4½, 5)” (10 [11.5, 12.5] cm) from beginning of armhole. Fasten off.
Back
Row 1: With right side facing, join A with a slip st in first st to the left of Row 1 of Right Front, work in established patt across first 35 (39, 43) sts, turn, leaving remaining sts unworked.
Work even on 35 (39, 43) sts, until Back measures 4 (4½, 5)” from beginning of armhole. Fasten off.
Left Front
Row 1: With right side facing, join A with a slip st in first st to the left of Row 1 of Back, work in established patt across last 17 (19, 21) sts, turn. 
Work even in patt on 17 (19, 21) sts until Left Front measures 2 (2½, 3)” (5 [ 6.5, 7.5] cm), ending with a wrong side row.
Sweater directions are for child’s size 6 months. Changes for 12 months and 18 months are in parentheses. 
Hat directions are for size Small. Changes for Large are in parentheses.
Sweater is worked in one piece to underarm, then divided into fronts and back.
Puff St Pattern (patt)
(Worked on a multiple of 4 + 1 sts). 
Ch a multiple of 4 + 1 + 1 (for turning ch).
Set-up Row: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across turn.
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 1, sc in each of first 3 sc, *puff st in next sc**, sc in each of next 3 sts; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, sc in last ch, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *puff in next sc, sc in each of next 3 sc; repeat from * across, turn.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2.
Repeat Rows 1-4 for patt.
Sew Fronts to Back at shoulders.
Sleeve (make 2)
With A, ch 22 (22, 26). 
Set-up Row: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across turn – 21 (21, 25) sc. 
Work in patt, inc 1 st at each end of every 4th row 4 (6, 7) times. Then, work even in patt on 29 (33, 39) sts until Sleeve measures 6 (7, 8)” (15 [18, 20.5] cm) from beginning. Fasten off, leaving a long sewing length. Sew Sleeve seams. Sew top of Sleeves into armholes.
Left Front Band
Row 1: With right side facing, join A with a slip st to top left-hand corner of Left Front edge, ch 1, work 27 (33, 38) sc evenly space across to bottom edge, turn. 
Rows 2-4: Ch1, sc in each st across, turn. 
Fasten off. 
Right Front Band
Row 1: With right side facing, join A with a slip st to bottom right-hand corner of Right Front edge, ch 1, work 27 (33, 38) sc evenly space across to neck shaping, turn. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. Fasten off. 
Edging
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in each st across Right Front to neck, 2 sc in corner st, sc evenly around neck edge, 2 sc in corner st, sc in each st across Left Front edge to bottom edge. Turn. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across Left Front to neck, 2 sc in corner st, sc evenly around neck edge, 2 sc in corner st, sc in each st across Right Front edge to bottom edge. Fasten off.
Big Black Buttons (make 3)
With B, ch 2. 
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join, work in a spiral. Mark beginning of each round, moving marker up as work progresses. 
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: [Sc2tog over next 2 sts] around – 6 sts. Fasten off, leaving a 12” (30.5 cm) sewing length. Thread sewing length onto yarn needle. Run through top of sts in last round and gather.
FINISHING
With Right Front Band over left for girls and Left Front Band over Right for boys, sew snaps to appropriate front band starting 1” (2.5 cm) below neck edge, and spacing remaining snaps 2 (2½, 3)” (5 [6.5, 7.5] cm) apart down front band. Sew one Button over each snap on top band.
HAT
Back
With A, ch 2. 
Round 1: Work 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join, work in a spiral. Mark beginning of each round, moving marker up as work progresses. 
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around – 16 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 24 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in each of next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 32 sc.
Round 5: *Sc in each of next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 40 sc.
Round 6: *Sc in each of next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 48 sc.
Round 7: *Sc in each of next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 56 sc.
Round 8: *Sc in each of next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 64 sc.
Round 9: *Sc in each of next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 72 sc. Do not fasten off.
Size L Only
Round 10: *Sc in each of next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 80 sc. Do not fasten off.
All Sizes
Sides
Work now progresses in rows.
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 1, turn, sc in each of first 53 (61) sts, turn, leaving remaining sts unworked.
Work even in patt until Sides measure 5 (6)” (12.5 [15] cm) from beginning. Fasten off A.
Attached Scarf
Row 1: With C, ch 32, with right side of Bonnet facing, *working across side edge of Side, [sc2tog over next 2 row-end sts]*; repeat from * to * across to back neck edge, starting in base of last st worked, [sc2tog over next 2 sts], then work [sc2tog over next 2 sts] 9 times across back neck, repeat from * to * across other side edge of Sides, ch 33, turn.
Row 2 (wrong side): With C, hdc in 3rd ch from hook, hdc in each ch and st across – 94 (98) hdc. Drop C to be picked up later. Do not turn.
Row 3: With wrong side facing, join D with a slip st in beginning ch-2 of Row 2, ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in each st across, turn. Drop D to be picked up later. 
Row 4 (right side): Pick up C through last st of previous row, ch 2, hdc in each st across. Drop C to be picked up later. Do not turn.
Row 5: Pick up D through last st of previous row, ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn. Drop D to be picked up later. 
Repeat Rows 4-5 once, then repeat Row 3 once. Fasten off C and D. Weave in ends.
BOOTS (make 2)
Cuff
With A, ch 24, and without twisting ch, join into a ring with a slip st in first ch. 
Round 1: Ch 2, hdc in each ch around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2 – 24 hdc. 
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2.
Repeat Round 2 until cuff measures 4” (10 cm) from beginning. Fasten off A.
Foot
Round 1: With right side facing, skip first 8 sts, join C with a slip st in next st, ch 1, sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc – 24 sc. 
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with a slip st in first sc. 
Instep
Work now progresses in rows.
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in each of first 9 sts, turn, leaving remaining sts unworked – 9 sts. 
Rows 2-4 (6): Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 5 (7): Ch 1, sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 5 sts, sc2tog over last 2 sts – 7 sts. Fasten off.
Continue Foot
Work now progresses in rounds.
Round 1: With right side facing, join C 8th st at center back of heel, ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc in each of next 7 sts, working in row-end sts, work 4 (6) hdc evenly space across edge of instep, 2 hdc in corner, hdc in each of 7 sts across toe, 2 hdc in corner, work 4 (6) hdc evenly space across edge of instep, hdc in each of next 7 sts on back of heel; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2 – 34 (38) sts  
Rounds 2-3: Ch 2, hdc in each st around join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2. Fasten off.
Sole
Round 1: With right side facing, join B with a slip st in first st, ch 1, skip first st, sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 12 (14) sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next st, sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 12 (14) sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts; join with a slip st in first st – 29 (33) sts. 
Round 2: Ch 1, sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 10 (12) sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next st, sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 10 (12) sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts; join with a slip st in first st – 25 (29) sts. 
Round 3: Ch 1, sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 8 (10) sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next st, sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 8 (10) sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts; join with a slip st in first st – 21 (25) sts. 
Round 4: Ch 1, sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 6 (8) sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in next st, sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 6 (8) sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts; join with a slip st in first st – 17 (21) sts.  Fasten off, leaving a 12” (30.5) sewing length. Sew Sole seam closed, lengthwise. Weave in ends. 
Fold cuff down.

materials: RED HEART® 'Baby Econo®' 1 skein each of 1001 White A, 1802 Baby Blue B, and 1668 Serene Green C.
Yarn needle, Three ½” buttons, Sewing needle and matching sewing thread.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Finished Chest: 21 (22, 23, 24)”. Finished Length: 9½ (9¾, 10, 10¾)”. Hat circumference: 15½ (17)”.
gauge: 14 sc = 4”; 17 rows sc = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With A, Ch 4, slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 11 dc in ring, slip st in top of ch-3 – 12 dc.
Round 2: *2 sc in next dc, repeat from * around – 24 sc. Do not join, work in a spiral, marking last st with a split ring marker and move marker up as work progresses.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, repeat from * around – 36 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc to join.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next sc, 2 dc in next sc, *dc in next 2 sc, 2 dc in next sc, repeat from * around, join with a slip st in top of ch-3 – 48 dc.
Round 6: Sc in each dc around.
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in next 6 sc, 2 dc in next sc, *dc in next 7 sc, 2 dc in next sc, repeat from * around, join with a slip st in top of ch-3 – 54 dc.
Sizes 18 Months And 24 Months Only
Round 8: Ch 3, dc in next 7 sc, 2 dc in next sc, *dc in next 8 sc, 2 dc in next sc, repeat from * around, join with a slip st in top of ch-3 – 60 dc. Drop A to wrong side to be picked up later. Join B.
All Sizes
Round 8 (9): With B, ch 3, dc in each st around, join with a slip st in top of ch-3. Drop B, join C.
Round 9 (10): With C, ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, *With A, dc in next 3 dc, with C, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from * to last 3 sts, with A, dc in last 3 sts, join with a slip st in top of ch-3.
Round 10 (11): Working with A over C sts and working with B over A sts to create a checkered pattern, ch 3, dc in each dc around, join with a slip st in top of ch-3.
Rounds 11-12 (12-13): With C, ch 3, dc in each dc around, join with a slip st in top of ch-3.
Round 13 (14): Ch 1, sc in each st around, join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 14 (15): Ch 3, dc in each st around, join with a slip st in top of ch-3.
What little boy wouldn’t look picture perfect in this spiffy set? Most of the sweater is worked in single crochet, and bands of double crochet in changing colors accent the design with a collegiate look for your favorite little man.

Row 15-37 (15-39, 15-41, 15-44): With C, ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
Right Front
With B, ch 11 (13, 15, 17).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each st across; turn – 10 (12, 14, 16) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across; turn – 11 (13, 15, 17) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 4-5: Repeat rows 2-3 – 12 (14, 16, 18) sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across; turn – 13 (15, 17, 19) sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off
Row 8: Ch 6, with wrong side facing, with B, starting on right-hand side, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in each sc across, sc in each of next 6 ch sts; turn – 19 (21, 23, 25) sc.
Rows 10-12: Repeat row 3.
Row 13: With A, ch 3, dc in next 2 sc, *with C, dc in next 3 sc, with A, dc in next 3 sc; repeat from * across to last 4 (0, 2, 4) sc; with A, dc in next 3 sc, dc in last 1 (0, 2, 1) sc; turn.
Row 14: Working with A over C sts and with B over A sts, to create a checker pattern, ch 3, dc in each dc across; turn.
Row 15-26 (15-28, 15-30, 15-32): With C, repeat row 3.
Row 27 (29, 31, 33): Ch 1, sc in first st, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, skip next sc, sc in last sc; turn – 18 (20, 22, 24) sc.
Row 28 (30, 32, 34): Ch 1, skip first st, sc in each sc across; turn – 17 (19, 21, 23) sc.
Rows 29-32 (31-36, 33-40, 35-44): Repeat rows 27-28 two (3, 4, 5) times – 13 sc.
Work 5 (3, 1, 0) rows even in sc. Fasten off.
Left Front
Work as for Right Front reversing all shaping and reversing placement of B and C.
Right Sleeve
With A, ch 22 (25, 28, 28).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each st across; turn – 21 (24, 27, 27) sc.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each dc across; turn.
Row 4: Repeat row 2. Drop A to wrong side to be picked up later. Join C.
Row 5-10: With C, ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 11: With A, ch 3, dc in next 2 sc, *with C, dc in next 3 sts, with A, dc in next 3 sts; repeat from * across; turn.
Row 12: Working with A over C sts and working with B over A sts, to create a checker pattern, ch 3, dc in each dc across; turn.
Round 15 (16): Ch 1, sc in each st around, join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Ear Flaps (Make 1 with B and 1 with C)
Starting at top edge, ch 11.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across; turn – 10 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, skip next sc, sc in last sc; turn – 8 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Rows 5-8: Repeat rows 3-4 (twice) – 3 sc at end of last row.
Row 9: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 2 sc; turn – 2 sc.
Row 10: Skip first sc, slip st in next sc, ch 31 for tie. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Hat Construction
Fold bottom of hat up ½” to right side for a brim. Sew flaps to inside of hat on opposite sides.
Pom Pom
Wrap B 30 times around 4 fingers of one hand. Slide loops off and tie at one end with a separate piece of yarn, cut loops at the other end. Wrap yarn around the top of the tassel several times and weave in ends. Tie pom-pom to the top of hat and trim ends to 1” long.
SWEATER
Back
With B, ch 23 (25, 27, 29).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across; turn – 22 (24, 26, 28) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each sc across to last st, 2 sc in last st, turn – 24 (26, 28, 30) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 4-7: Repeat rows 2-3 (twice) – 28 (30, 32, 34) sc at end of last row. Fasten off.
Row 8: Ch 5, with wrong side facing, sc in each sc across; ch 5; turn – 38 (40, 42, 44) sts.
Row 9: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 3 ch, sc in each sc across, sc in each of next 5 ch; turn – 37 (39, 41, 43) sc.
Row 10-12: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 13: With A, ch 3, dc in next 2 sc, *with C, dc in next 3 sc, with A, dc in next 3 sc; repeat from * across to last 4 (0, 2, 4) sc; with A, dc in next 3 (0, 0, 3) dc, with next color in sequence, dc in last 1 (0, 2, 1) sc; turn.
Row 14: Working with A over C sts and working with B over A sts, to create a checker pattern, ch 3, dc in each dc across; turn.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each 9925 Really Red A, 4600 White B, 9851 Royal Blue C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [US I-9] for cocoon and hat, 4.0mm [US G-6] for stars
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Cocoon fits up to a 3 month old. Cocoon measures 20” (51 cm) in circumference and 14.5” (37 cm) long. Hat measures 12” (14”) (30.5 [35.5] cm) in circumference and 5.5” (6”) (14 [15] cm) tall.
gauge: With 5.5mm [I-9] hook, 18 dc = 5” [12.5 cm]; 7 rows dc = 4” [10 cm]
instructions:
COCOON
With A, make an Adjustable Loop, make another ch (ch-2 counts as dc here and throughout, unless otherwise noted).
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 11 dc in Loop; slip st to top of beginning ch to join—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 2, dc in same st (increase made), 2 dc in each dc around; slip st in top of beginning ch to join—24 dc. Fasten off A.
Round 3: Join B, ch 2, dc in same st, dc in next dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc] 11 times; slip st in top of beginning ch to join—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 2, dc in same st, dc in next 2 dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next 2 dc] 11 times; slip st in top of beginning ch to join—48 dc. Fasten off B.
Round 5: Join A, ch 2, dc in same st, dc in next 3 dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next 3 dc] 11 times; slip st in top of beginning ch to join—60 dc.
Round 6: Ch 2, dc in same st, dc in next 4 dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next 4 dc] 11 times; slip st in top of beginning ch to join—72 dc. Fasten off A.
Rounds 7-8: Join B, ch 2, dc in each dc around; slip st in top of beginning ch to join—72 dc. Fasten off B.
Rounds 9-10: Join A, ch 2, dc in each dc around; slip st in top of beginning ch to join—72 dc. Fasten off A.
Rounds 11-24: Repeat sequence of Rows 7-10 three times; repeat Rows 7-8 once. At end of Round 24, fasten off B.
Rounds 25-26: Join A, ch 2, dc in each dc around; slip st in top of beginning ch to join—72 dc.
Round 27: Ch 1 (counts as sc), sc in each dc around; slip st in top of beginning ch to join – 72 sc. Fasten off A; weave in ends.

HAT
With C, make an Adjustable Loop, make another ch (ch-2 counts as dc here and throughout, unless otherwise noted).
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 11 dc in Loop; slip st to top of beginning ch to join—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 2, dc in same st (increase made), 2 dc in each dc around; slip st in top of beginning ch to join—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 2, dc in same st, dc in next dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc] 11 times; slip st in top of beginning ch to join—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 2, dc in same st, dc in next 5 dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next 5 dc] 5 times; slip st in top of beginning ch to join—42 dc.
Rounds 5-9: Ch 2, dc in each dc around; slip st in top of beginning ch to join – 42 dc. Do not fasten off; continue to make Right Earflap.
Round 4: Ch 2, dc in same st, dc in next 2 dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next 2 dc] 11 times; slip st in top of beginning ch to join—48 dc.
Rounds 5-10: Ch 2, dc into each dc around; slip st in top of beginning ch to join – 48 dc. Do not fasten off; continue to make Right Earflap.

Right Earflap
Row 1: Ch 2, dc2tog, dc in next 3 dc, dc2tog, dc in next dc; ch 1, turn—7 sts.
Row 2: Sc in each st across; ch 2, turn—7 sc.
Row 3: Dc2tog, dc in next sc, dc2tog, dc in last sc—5 sts. Fasten off; weave in ends.

Note for sizes 12” and 14” (30.5 cm) and (35.5 cm): With Right Earflap facing and Hat seam to the right, place a stitch marker 18 (20) stitches to the left of the last stitch of the Earflap.

Left Earflap
With Right Side facing, draw up a loop of A in marked stitch; repeat Rows 1-3 for Right Earflap.

Border
Round 1: With Right Side facing, draw up a loop of C in center back of hat, ch 1; sc evenly around, working 3 sc into the side of each dc row of Earflaps; slip st to join. Fasten off C.
Round 2: Join B, ch 1, sc in each sc around; slip st to join. Fasten off; weave in ends.

Braids (Make 2)
Cut 3 strands of each color measuring 28” (71 cm) each and separate each color into bundles. Referring to photograph for placement, evenly attach bundles between stitches on last round of Earflap. Braid strands together until 4” (10 cm) of fringe remains, knot to fasten, trim ends evenly.

Star (Make 3)
With B, make an Adjustable Loop, make another ch (ch-2 counts as hdc).
Round 1: Work 9 hdc in Loop; slip st to top of beginning ch to join—10 hdc.
Round 2: [Ch 5, slip st into second ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, skip last ch and one st from Round 1, slip st in next st] 4 times—5 points. Fasten off; weave in ends.

Finishing
Referring to photograph for placement, sew Stars onto Hat.

materials: RED HEART® “LusterSheen®”: 2 (2, 3, 3) skeins 0824 Medium Blue A
Stitch marker (or small piece of contrasting yarn)
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets as specified
measurements: To Fit Chest: 16, (17, 17½, 18, 19)” Finished Chest: 19 (20, 20 ½, 21, 22)” Hat Circumference: 16 (18)”
gauge: 17 sts = 4”; 24 rows = 4” in sc with smaller hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
ROmPER
First Leg
With smaller hook and A, ch 35 (39, 44, 48, 56).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each remaining ch across, turn – 34 (38, 43, 47, 55) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc across to within last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn – 36 (40, 45, 49, 57) sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across.
Repeat rows 3-4 three times more – 42 (46, 51, 55, 63) sc.
Repeat previous row 7 (11, 15, 17, 21) times more. Fasten off.
Second Leg
Repeat as for First Leg, except do not fasten off after row 17 (21, 25, 27, 31).
Joining Legs
Row 1: Still working on Second Leg, ch 1, sc across, ch 4, sc in each sc across First Leg, turn.
Row 2: Ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each of next 3 ch, sc in each sc across First Leg, sc in each of next 4 ch, sc in each sc across Second Leg, turn – 92 (100, 110, 118, 134) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat previous row 18 (22, 24, 28, 30) times more, fasten off.

Seaming
Using yarn needle, sew back seam of Seat and sew leg seams. There is no Wrong Side or Right Side until seaming.

Peplum
Beginning working in the round; rounds are not joined; use marker to mark beginning of each round.
Round 1: With larger hook and Wrong Side facing, join A with slip st to center back of Seat, ch 1, working tbl ONLY, sc in each sc around, do not join.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around – 92 (100, 110, 118, 134) sc.
Repeat previous round until peplum measures 5½ (6, 6½, 7, 7½)”. At end of last round, slip st in next sc. Fasten off.

Bodice
Row 1: With smaller hook and Wrong Side facing, join A with slip st to center back of Seat, ch 1, working in unused front loops ONLY, sc through front loop ONLY of each sc around, do not join, turn – 92 (100, 110, 118, 134) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, except skip 10 sts evenly-spaced around, turn – 82 (90, 100, 108, 124) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat previous 2 rows 0 (0, 1, 1, 3) times more – 82 (90, 90, 98, 94) sc.
Next row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, except skip 0 (4, 2, 8, 0) sts evenly-spaced around, turn – 82 (86, 88, 90, 94) sc.
Next row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat previous row 8 (10, 8, 10, 6) times more.
First Back
Row 1: Slip st across 2 sc, ch 1, sc across 16 (18, 18, 19, 20) sc only, turn, leaving remaining sc unworked.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc2tog across first 2 sc, sc in each sc across, turn – 15 (17, 17, 18, 19) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across to within last 2 sc, sc2tog across last 2 sc, turn—14 (16, 16, 17, 18) sc.
Row 4: Repeat row 2 – 13 (15, 15, 16, 17) sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat previous row 10 (10, 14, 14, 18) times more.
Next row: Ch 1, sc in each of first 5 (5, 6, 6, 6) sc, turn, leaving remaining sc unworked.
Next row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
Front
Row 1: Skip 4 sc from last st of First Back in unworked row of Bodice With smaller hook, join A with slip st in next st, ch 1, sc in each of first 38 (38, 40, 40, 42) sc, turn, leaving remaining sc unworked.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc2tog across first 2 sc, sc in each sc across to within last 2 sc, sc2tog across last 2 sc, turn – 36 (36, 38, 38, 40) sc.
Rows 3-4: Repeat row 2 – 32 (32, 34, 34, 36) sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat previous row 3 (3, 7, 7, 11) times more.
First Shoulder
Next row: Ch 1, sc in each of first 10 (10, 11, 11, 11) sc, turn, leaving remaining sc unworked.
Next row: Slip st across first 3 sc, ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn – 7 (7, 8, 8, 8) sc.
Next row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across to within last 2 sc, sc2tog across last 2 sc, turn – 6 (6, 7, 7, 7) sc.
Next row: Ch 1, sc2tog across first 2 sc, sc in each sc across, turn – 5 (5, 6, 6, 6) sc.
Next row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat previous row 4 times more. Fasten off.
Second Shoulder
Next row: Skip 12 (12, 12, 12, 14) sc from last st of First Shoulder in unworked row of Front. With smaller hook, join A with slip st in next st, ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn – 10 (10, 11, 11, 11) sc.
Next row: Ch 1, sc in each of first 7 (7, 8, 8, 8) sc, turn, leaving remaining sc unworked.
Next row: Ch 1, sc2tog across first 2 sc, sc in each sc across, turn – 6 (6, 7, 7, 7) sc.
Next row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across to within last 2 sc, sc2tog across last 2 sc, turn – 5 (5, 6, 6, 6) sc.
Next row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat previous row 4 times more. Fasten off.
Second Back
Row 1: Skip 4 sc from last st of Front in unworked row of Bodice With smaller hook, join A with slip st in next st, ch 1, sc in each of next 16 (18, 18, 19, 20) sc, turn, leaving remaining 2 sc unworked – 16 (18, 18, 19, 20) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across to within last 2 sc, sc2tog across last 2 sc, turn – 15 (17, 17, 18, 19) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog across first 2 sc, sc in each sc across, turn – 14 (16, 16, 17, 18) sc.
Row 4: Repeat row 2 – 13 (15, 15, 16, 17) sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat previous row 10 (10, 14, 14, 18) times more. Fasten off.
Next row: Skip next 5 (5, 7, 7, 13) sc, join A with slip st in next sc, ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn – 5 (5, 6, 6, 6) sc.
Next row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.

Seaming
With yarn needle and A, sew rows 1-13 (15, 15, 17, 17) of lower portion of Bodice Back.

Armhole Trim
With smaller hook, join B with slip st to bottom of armhole, ch 1, sc evenly around armhole, slip st in first sc. Repeat Armhole Trim around other armhole.

Neckline Trim
With smaller hook, join B with slip st in first of 4 skipped sts at opening in Bodice Back, ch 1, sc evenly across side of Bodice Back, 2 sc at corner, sc evenly around neckline, at opposite corner, [sc, ch 5, sc] in same st (buttonhole loop), sc evenly down opposite side of Bodice Back, slip st to first sc. Fasten off.

BUTTON
Sew button to corner of Back opening opposite buttonhole loop.

FLOWER (make 3)
With smaller hook and B, ch 3, slip st to first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 5 sc in ring, slip st to first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [sc, ch 2 sc] in each sc around, slip st to first sc, slip st in first ch-2 space – 5 ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc, hdc, 2 dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-2 space around, slip st to first sc. Fasten off.
With yarn needle and B, sew Flowers to Dress as shown in photo.

HAT
Rounds are not joined; use marker to mark beginning of each round.
Round 1: With A and larger hook, ch 3, join with slip st to first a ring, ch 1, 5 sc in ring.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around, do not join – 10 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, – 15 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in each of next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, – 20 sc.
Round 5: *Sc in each of next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, – 25 sc.
Round 6: *Sc in each of next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, – 30 sc.
Round 7: *Sc in each of next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, – 35 sc.
Round 8: *Sc in each of next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, – 40 sc.
Round 9: *Sc in each of next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, – 45 sc.
Round 10: *Sc in each of next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, – 50 sc.
Round 11: *Sc in each of next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, – 55 sc.
Round 12: *Sc in each of next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, – 60 sc.

Size L Only
Round 13: *Sc in each of next 11 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, – 65 sc.
Round 14: *Sc in each of next 12 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, – 70 sc.
Round 13 (15): Sc in each sc around—60 (70) sc.
Repeat previous round until hat measures 6 (7)” from beginning. At end of last round, slip st to next sc. Fasten off.

FLOWER (make 2)
Work same as Romper Flower.
With yarn needle and B, sew Flowers as shown in photo.

materials: RED HEART® Baby TLC™: 2 (2, 2) balls 5960 Strawberry Orange OR 2 (2, 2) balls 5932 Baseball
Split-ring stitch markers, three 3/8” (9.5 mm) buttons, yarn needle
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st

* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: To Fit Chest: 15 (17, 18)”, [38 (43, 45.7) cm]; Finished Chest: 17 (18½, 20)”, [43 (47, 51) cm]; Finished Length: 9 (11, 12)”, [23 (28, 30.4) cm]; Finished Cap Circumference: 14 (16, 18)”, [35.5 (40.6, 45.7) cm]
gauge: 19 sts = 4”[10 cm]; 9 rows = 4” [10 cm] in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
