Twin Sweater Set
Almost too cute for words, this darling set 
of sweater and cap will keep your little one 
cozy. Crossed stitches make it interesting to 
crochet while adding a designer touch.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and 
throughout), dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each 
dc around; join with slip st in top of beginning 
ch—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc 
in next dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in 
next 2 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 2 dc; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in 
next 3 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 3 dc; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—60 dc.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in 
next 11 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 11 dc; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—65 dc.
Directions are for size newborn. Changes 
for sizes 6 months and 12 months are in 
parentheses.
Sizes 6 months (12 months) Only
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in 
next 12 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 12 dc; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—70 dc.
Round 8: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in 
next 13 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 13 dc; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—75 dc.
Size 12 months Only
Round 9: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in 
next 14 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 14 dc; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—80 dc.
Round 10: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in 
next 15 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 15 dc; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—85 dc.
All Sizes
Next 4 Rounds: Ch 3, dc in each st around; 
join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Brim
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 3, beginning in same 
st as join, X-dc2, *X-dc3, X-dc2; repeat from 
* to last 2 dc, X-dc3; join with slip st in first
dc—13 (15, 17) X-dc.
Rounds 2–4: Ch 3, turn, *dc in 2nd dc of
next X-dc, ch 1, dc in first dc of same X-dc;
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of
beginning ch.
Round 5 (Wrong Side): Do not turn, slip st
in next dc, (slip st, ch 1, sc, ch 3, dc) in next
ch-1 space, (sc, ch 3, dc) in each ch-1 space
around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off and weave in ends. Fold brim over.
SWEATER
Beginning at neck edge, ch 29.
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook 
(beginning ch counts as first dc), 2 dc in next 
ch, dc in next 2 ch, 2 dc in each of next 2 ch, 
dc in next 14 ch, 2 dc in each of next 2 ch, dc 
in next 2 ch, 2 dc in each of last 2 ch—34 dc.
Note: In the next row, markers are placed to 
indicate four increase locations. In following 
rows, increases (2 dc) are worked in the 
stitches on each side of each increase location 
marker. The markers should be placed 
between the 2-dc groups and moved up as 
each row is worked. You may find it easiest to 
use a length of yarn as a marker and weave 
the length up between the 2-dc groups as you 
work each row.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and 
throughout), turn, dc in first dc, *2 dc in each 
of next 2 dc, place a marker between the two 
2-dc groups, dc in next 4 dc, 2 dc in each of
next 2 dc, place a marker between the two
2-dc groups**, dc in next 16 dc; repeat from *
to ** once, 2 dc in top of beginning ch—44 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, dc in first dc, *dc in each
dc to 1 dc before next marker, 2 dc in each of
next 2 dc; repeat from * 3 more times, dc in
each dc to turning ch, 2 dc in top of turning
ch—54 dc.
Shape Front Neck
Attach Front Neck Foundation Chain: Drop 
loop from hook and place loop on stitch marker 
or safety pin. With a separate length of yarn, 
join yarn with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 
of Row 3, ch 5 (for front neck ch). Fasten off. 
Return dropped loop (at end of Row 3) to hook.
Row 4: Ch 7, turn, dc in 4th ch from hook 
(skipped 3 ch count as first dc) and in next 3 
ch, *dc in each dc to 1 dc before next marker, 
2 dc in each of next 2 dc; repeat from * 3 
more times, dc in each dc to front neck ch, dc 
in each ch of front neck ch—72 dc.
Rows 5–10 (12, 14): Ch 3, turn, skip first dc, 
*dc in each dc to 1 dc before next marker, 2
dc in each of next 2 dc; repeat from * 3 more 
times, dc in each dc to turning ch, dc in top of 
turning ch—120 (136, 152) dc.
Attach Underarm Chains
Drop loop from hook and place loop on stitch 
marker or safety pin. With a separate length of 
yarn, join yarn with slip st in dc immediately 
before first marker, ch 4 (for underarm ch), 
skip all sts to 2nd marker (for armhole), slip 
st in dc immediately following 2nd marker. 
Fasten off. Repeat to attach an underarm ch 
between the 3rd and 4th markers.
Note: There should be 18 (20, 22) sts before the 
first underarm chain (for front), 36 (40, 44) sts 
between the two underarm chains (for back), 
and 18 (20, 22) sts following the 2nd underarm 
chain (for other front) for a total of 72 (80, 88) 
sts and two ch-4 underarm chains. Return 
dropped loop (at end of last row) to hook.
Lower Body
Next Row (Right Side): Working in all front 
and back sts, and underarm chains, skipping 
the armhole sts, ch 3, turn, beginning in first 
dc, [X-dc2] 0 (2, 4) times, *X-dc3, X-dc2; 
repeat from * across to last 0 (4, 8) sts, [X-
dc2] 0 (2, 4) times (last dc of last X-dc2 is 
worked in top of turning ch), dc once more in 
top of turning ch—32 (36, 40) X-dc.
Next Row: Ch 3, turn, *dc in 2nd dc of next 
X-dc, ch 1, dc in first dc of same X-dc; repeat
from * across, dc in top of turning ch.
Repeat last row until lower body measures 4½
(5½, 6)”, [11.4 (14, 15.2) cm] from underarm,
end with a Wrong Side row.
Last Row (Wrong Side): Ch 1, turn, (sc, ch 3,
dc) in first dc, (sc, ch 3, dc) in each ch-1 space
across, sc in top of turning ch. Fasten off.
SLEEVES (make 2)
Round 1 (Right Side): With Right Side 
facing, and working across other side of 
underarm ch, join yarn with slip st in first ch of 
underarm ch, ch 3 (counts as first dc here and 
throughout), dc in next 3 ch, dc in each of the 
skipped armhole sts; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—28 (32, 36) dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, turn, dc in each dc around; join 
with slip st in top of turning ch.
Repeat last round until sleeve measures 3 (4, 
5)”, [7.6 (10, 12.7) cm] from underarm, end 
with a Right Side round.
Next Round (Right Side): Do not turn, ch 3, 
beginning in first dc, *X-dc2; repeat from 
* around; join with slip st in top of turning
ch—14 (16, 18) X-dc.
Last Round: Do not turn, slip st in next dc,
(slip st, ch 1, sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-1 space,
(sc, ch 3, sc) in each ch-1 space around; join
with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Buttonhole Band
Row 1 (Right Side): With Right Side facing, 
join yarn with slip st in beginning of right front 
edge, ch 1, work sc evenly spaced across edge.
Place 3 markers for button placement evenly 
spaced across right front edge between neck 
edge and beginning of lower body.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, [sc in each sc across to next 
marker, ch 2, skip next 2 sc (for buttonhole] 3 
times, sc in each remaining sc across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc and ch across.
Fasten off.
Buttonband
Row 1 (Right Side): With Right Side facing, join 
yarn with slip st in beginning of left front edge, 
ch 1, work sc evenly spaced across edge.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off.
Neck Edging
Row 1 (Right Side): With Right Side facing, 
join yarn with slip st at beginning of neck 
edge, sc evenly spaced across neck edge. 
Fasten off.
Outer Edging
Round 1 (Right Side): With Right Side facing, 
join yarn with slip st to work across right front 
edge and neck edge. If you are right-handed, 
this means you will join in lower right front 
corner. If you are left-handed, this means you 
will join in left front corner of neck edge. Ch 1, 
(sc, ch 3, dc) in same place as join, *skip next 
2 sc, (sc, ch 3, dc) in next sc; repeat from * 
across right front edge and neck edge, ending 
with sc in last sc. Fasten off.
Sew buttons to buttonband, opposite 
buttonholes. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: Hat & Mittens- 1 (1, 1) skein 390 Hot Red; Scarf- 1 skein 321 Gold
abbreviations: Dec (decrease) = draw up a lp in next 2 sts, yo and draw through all 3 lps on hook
Inc (increase) = work 2 sc in next sc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Scarf measures 5” wide x 50” long. Hat Circumference: 16 (18¼, 19½)”.
gauge: Hat: 14 sts = 4”; 10 rnds = 4” in pat on smaller hook. Scarf: 17 sts = 5”; 9 rows = 4” in pat on larger hook. Mittens: 12 sts = 4”; 14 rows = 4” in sc on larger hook.
instructions:
HAT
Ch 56 (64, 68) sts; join with a sl st to first ch, being sure ch is not twisted.
Rnd 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around; join with a sl st in first sc – 56 (64, 68) sts.
Rnd 2: Ch 3, skip first sc, dc in next sc and in each sc around; join in top of ch-3.
Rnd 3: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining and in each dc around; join.
Rep Rnds 2 and 3 until 5½ (6, 6½)” from beg.
Shape Top: Ch 1, [dec, sc in next 9 (11, 12) sts, dec, sc in next sc, place marker] 4 times; do not join at end of rnd. 
Next Rnd: [Dec, sc to 3 sts before next marker, dec, sc in next st] 4 times. Rep last rnd 3 (4, 4) more times – 16 (16, 20) sts.
Size 12-14 Only: [Dec, dec, sc in next st] 4 times – (12) sts.
All Sizes: Work 1 rnd even in sc. Fasten off. Weave yarn end through rem sts; draw up tightly and secure. Make a 2” pom pom and attach at top of hat.

SCARF
Ch 19.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 17 sts.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 2, skip first st; yo, insert hook from front to back to front around the post of the next st, yo and draw lp through, [yo and draw through 2 lps] twice – fpdc made; work 2 more fpdc; yo, insert hook from back to front to back around the post of the next st, yo and draw lp through, [yo and draw through 2 lps] twice – bpdc made; work 2 more bpdc, 3 fpdc, 3 bpdc, 3 fpdc, hdc in top of beg ch; turn.
Rows 4 and 5: Ch 2, skip first st, 3 bpdc, [3 fpdc, 3 bpdc] twice, hdc in top of beg ch; turn.
Rep Rows 2-5 until 50” from beg. Fasten off.

MITTENS
RIGHT MITTEN: **With smaller hook, ch 9 (11, 11).
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 8 (10, 10) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in back lp of each sc across; turn. Rep last row until 20 (22, 24) rows in all have been worked. Now turn to work across long edge. With larger hook, work 21 (23, 25) sc evenly spaced across long edge; turn. Working in rows of sc (in both lps), work 1 (3, 3) rows even. **
Shape Thumb Gusset: Ch 1, sc in first 12 (13, 14) sc, place marker, [inc] twice, place marker, sc in each sc across; turn – 23 (25, 27) sc. 
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each sc to marker, inc, sc in each sc to 1 st before next marker, inc, sc in each sc to end. Rep last row 2 (2, 3) more times – 29 (31, 35) sc. 
Size 12-14 Only: Work 1 row even.
All Sizes-Divide for Thumb: Ch 1, sc in first 11 (12, 13) sc, ch 1, skip next 9 (9, 11) sc, sc in last 9 (10, 11) sc; turn.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each sc and ch across; turn – 21 (23, 25) sc.Work even until 4½ (5, 5½)” above ribbing, dec 0 (2, 0) sts evenly on last row – 21 (21, 25) sc.
Shape Tip: Ch 1, [dec, sc in next 6 (6, 8) sc, dec] twice, sc in last sc; turn – 17 (17, 21) sc. 
Next Row: Ch 1, [dec, sc in next 4 (4, 6) sc, dec] twice, sc in last sc; turn – 13 (13, 17) sc. 
Next Row: Ch 1, [dec, sc in next 2 (2, 4) sc, dec] twice, sc in last sc; turn. – 9 (9, 13) sc. Fasten off.
Sew top and side seam.
Thumb: With right side facing, attach yarn in ch at thumb division; ch 1, sc in same ch and in each sc around; turn – 10 (10, 12) sc.Work even for 1½ (1¾, 2)”. Next Row: Ch 1, [dec] 5 (5, 6) times. Fasten off.
Sew thumb seam.

LEFT MITTEN: Work same as right mitten from ** to **. 
Shape Thumb Gusset: Ch 1, sc in first 8 (9, 10) sc, place marker, [inc] twice, place marker, sc in each sc across; turn – 23 (25, 27) sc. 
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each sc to marker, inc, sc in each sc to 1 st before next marker, inc, sc in each sc to end; turn. Rep last row 2 (2, 3) more times – 29 (31, 35) sc. 
Size 12-14 Only: Work 1 row even.
All Sizes-Divide for Thumb: Ch 1, sc in first 9 (10, 11) sc, ch 1, skip next 9 (9, 11) sc, sc in last 11 (12, 13) sc; turn.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each sc and ch across; turn – 21 (23, 25) sc. Complete same as for right mitten.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Worsted™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 210 yds/192 m) - Ski Band: 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook for Ski Band
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook for Scarf or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Ski Band: One size to fit Average Lady. Scarf: 8" [20.5 cm] wide x 46" [117 cm] long.
gauge: Ski Band: 19 dc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 4 mm hook. Scarf: 16 dc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 5 mm hook.
instructions:
Ski Band
With smaller hook, ch 31. 
Foundation row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 
*Ch 1. Miss next ch. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Ch 3. 
Turn. 29 sts.
1st row: Miss first dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 1. Miss next ch 1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Ch 3. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 19" [48 cm] when slightly stretched omitting turning ch at end of last row. Fasten off. Sew center back seam.
Flap: With RS of work facing, fold Band flat and mark beg and end of center 20 rows along top edge of Band. 
1st row: Join yarn with sl st at first marker and working into sides of dc along Band edge, ch 4. *1 dc into side of next dc of Band edge. Ch 1. Rep from * 17 times more. 1 dc where second marker was placed. Ch 4. Turn.
2nd row: Miss first dc, next ch 1 sp and next dc. 1 dc in next ch 1 sp. *Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 dc in next ch 1 sp. Rep from * across to last dc and ch 4 turning ch. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 dc in 3rd ch of turning ch. Ch 4. Turn.
Rep last row 15 times more (4 dc rem), ending last row with ch 3. Turn.
Next row: Miss first dc. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next dc. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw up a loop in 4th ch of turning ch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook. Fasten off.
Tassel: Cut a piece of cardboard 4" [10 cm] wide. Wind yarn around cardboard 35 times. Break yarn leaving a long end and thread end through a needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops ½" [1 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly. Sew tassel to end of flap.

Close Opening: Next row: Pat across first side of Scarf, then second side. Cont in pat (working stripes as established) for a further 17 rows omitting turning ch at end of last row. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut 10" lengths of MC, A and B. Taking 4 strands tog, knot into fringe in every other st along ends of Scarf alternating MC, A and B throughout as illustrated. Trim fringe evenly.

Scarf
With MC and larger hook, ch 36. 
Foundation row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 
*Ch 1. Miss next ch. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Ch 3. Turn. 34 sts.
1st row: Miss first dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 1. Miss next ch 1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Join A, ch 3. Turn.
Last row forms pat.
With A, work 3 rows pat ending last row with join B. Ch 3. Turn.
With B, work 2 rows pat ending last row with join MC. Ch 3. Turn.
With MC, work 3 rows pat ending last row with join A. Ch 3. Turn.
With A, work 2 rows pat ending last row with join B. Ch 3. Turn.
With B, work 3 rows pat ending last row with join MC. Ch 3. Turn.
**With MC, work 2 rows pat ending last row with join A. Ch 3. Turn.
With A, work 3 rows pat ending last row with join B. Ch 3. Turn.
With B, work 2 rows pat ending last row with join MC. Ch 3. Turn.
With MC, work 3 rows pat ending last row with join A. Ch 3. Turn.
With A, work 2 rows pat ending last row with join B. Ch 3. Turn.
With B, work 3 rows pat ending last row with join MC. Ch 3. Turn.
Rep from ** once more.
Divide for Opening: Next row: Miss first dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *Ch 1. Miss next ch 1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * once more. Ch 1. Miss next ch 1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 3. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Cont in pat (working stripes as established) for 5 more rows. Do not break yarn.
With RS of Scarf facing, join yarn with sl st to first missed dc of dividing row. Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. Miss next ch 1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to end of row.
Cont in pat (working stripes as established) for 5 more rows. Break yarn.

materials: RED HEART® “Baby Econo®”: Sweater - 1 skein each 1001 White CA and 1939 Swim Multi CB; Blanket: 2 skeins each 1001 White CA, 1939 Swim Multi CB.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: To Fit Chest: 18 (20, 22, 23, 24)”. Finished Chest Measurement: 20½ (23, 25, 26, 27½)”. Blanket measures approximately 36” x 36”.
gauge: 14 sts = 4”; Rows 1-9 of Sweater = 3”; Rows 1-12 of Blanket = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: NOTE: Join and cut colors as required. To Change Color: Work last st of row before color change required until 2 lps remain on hook, drop color in use, with next color to be used yo and draw through 2 lps on hook. PAT 1: With CA, ch 1, sc in first st, * sc in next st, hdc in next st; rep from * to last st; sc in last st; turn. PAT 2: With CB, ch 3, skip first sc; * skip next st, dc in next st, dc in skipped st working over dc just worked – CRDC made; rep from * to last sc; dc in last sc; turn. SWEATER-BACK: With CA, ch 37 (41, 45, 47, 49). Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next ch, * hdc in next ch, sc in next ch; rep from * across; turn – 36 (40, 44, 46, 48) sts. Rows 2 and 3: Work Pat 1. Row 4: Work Pat 2. Row 5: With CA, ch 1, sc in each st across and in top of ch-3; turn. Row 6: Work Pat 2. Rows 7-9: Work Pat 1. Rep Rows 4-9 2 (3, 3, 3, 3) more times. Continue with CA only in Pat 1 until 9 (11, 12, 13, 14)” from beg, end wrong side row. Shape Neck/Shoulders: Work in pat across 10 (12, 14, 14, 14) sts; turn. Dec 1 st at neck edge on next 2 rows – 8 (10, 12, 12, 12) sts. Work even until 10 (12, 13, 14, 15)” from beg. Fasten off. With wrong side facing, skip 16 (16, 16, 18, 20) sts of last long row, attach yarn in next st, work in pat to end. Complete to correspond to first side. FRONT: Work same as back until 8½ (10½, 11½, 12½, 13½)” from beg, end right side row. Divide for Neck/Shoulders: Work in pat across 12 (14, 16, 16, 16) sts; turn. Dec 1 st at neck edge on next 4 rows – 8 (10, 12, 12, 12) sts. Work even until front measures same as back to shoulders. Fasten off. With wrong side facing, skip next 12 (12, 12, 14, 16) sts of last long row, attach yarn in next st, work in pat to end. Complete to correspond to first side. SLEEVES: With CA, ch 21 (25, 25, 27, 29). Work Rows 1-9, then Rows 4-7 same as Back across 20 (24, 24, 26, 28) sts, shaping sides by inc 1 st each end of 3rd row, then every right side row 5 more times – 32 (36, 36, 38, 40) sts. Continue in Pat 1 with CA until sleeve measures 6 (7½, 9, 10, 11)” from beg. Fasten off. FINISHING: Sew shoulder seams. Mark 4½ (5, 5, 5½, 5¾)” down from shoulders. Place center of sleeve top at shoulder seam and sew in place between markers. Edging (Work around neck, sleeves and lower body edges): With right side facing, attach CB at a seam; ch 1, work sc evenly around; join with a sl st to first sc. Fasten off. BLANKET: With CA, ch 107. Row 1 (Right Side): Rep Row 1 of Sweater Back – 106 sts. Rows 2-9: Work 8 rows Pat 1. Rows 10-12: Rep Rows 4-6 of Sweater Back. Rows 14-21: Work 9 rows Pat 1. Rep Rows 10-21 of Blanket six more times. Fasten off. Border-Rnd 1: With right side facing, attach CB in first sc of last row worked; ch 1, [(sc, ch 2, sc) all in sc for corner, work 103 sc across to corner] 4 times; join with a sl st in first sc. Rnd 2: Ch 1, ** (sc, ch 3, sc) all in ch-2 sp, ch 3, skip next sc, * sc in next sc, ch 3, skip next sc; rep from * to next corner; rep from ** around to last 2 sc; sc in next sc, (ch 1, dc in first sc) to join and form last sp. Rnd 3: Ch 1, sc over dc, ch 3, ** (sc, ch 3, sc) all in corner ch-3 sp, ch 3, * sc in next ch-3 sp, ch 3; rep from * to next corner; rep from ** around; join with a sl st in first sc. Fasten off. Rnd 4: With right side facing, attach CA in any ch 3 sp; ch 1, * (sc, ch 3, sc) all in sp; rep from * around; join. Fasten off. Rnd 5: With right side facing, attach CB in any ch 3 corner sp; ch 1, ** (sc, ch 3, sc) all in corner sp, ch 3, * sc in next sp, ch 3; rep from * to next corner; rep from ** around working (ch 1, dc in first sc) to join and form last sp. Rnd 6: Rep Rnd 3. Rnd 7: Rep Rnd 4. Fasten off.

materials: Size 5.5 mm (U.S. I or 9) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
16 inch [40.5 cm] square pillow form and 5 buttons for Pillow.
measurements: Afghan: Approx 46½ x 56 ins [118 x 142 cm], Pillow: Approx 16 ins [40.5 cm] square
gauge: 13 dc and 7 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
AFGHAN
Panel A (make 3)
With A, ch 25.
Foundation row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. 23 sts. Ch 3. Turn.
1st row: Miss first st. [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop from front to back around post of next dc. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times – trfp made. 1 dc in next dc] twice. [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop from front to back. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] 3 times around post of next dc. Yoh and draw through rem 4 loops on hook – Trfp Cluster made. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. Trfp Cluster around post of next dc. (1 dc in next dc. Trfp around post of next dc) twice. 1 dc in last dc. Ch 3. Turn.
2nd row: Miss first st. (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop from back to front around post of next st. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times – trbp made. 1 dc in next st. Trbp around post of next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] 3 times around back of post of next st. Yoh and draw through rem 4 loops on hook – Trbp Cluster made. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. Trbp Cluster around post of next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. (Trbp around post of next st. 1 dc in next dc) twice. Ch 3. Turn.
3rd row: Miss first st. (Trfp around post of next st. 1 dc in next st) twice. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Trfp Cluster around post of next st. 1 dc in each of next 7 sts. Trfp Cluster around post of next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. (Trfp around post of next st. 1 dc in next st) twice. Ch 3. Turn.
4th row: Miss first st. (Trbp around post of next st. 1 dc in next st) twice. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Trbp Cluster around post of next st. 1 dc in each of next 5 sts. Trbp Cluster around post of next st. 1 dc in each of next 4 sts. (Trbp around post of next st. 1 dc in next st) twice. Ch 3. Turn.
5th row: Miss first st. (Trfp around post of next st. 1 dc in next st) twice. 1 dc in each of next 4 sts. Trfp Cluster around post of next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Trfp Cluster around post of next st. 1 dc in each of next 5 sts. (Trfp around post of next st. 1 dc in next st) twice. Ch 3. Turn.
6th row: Miss first st. (Trbp around post of next st. 1 dc in next st) twice. 1 dc in each of next 5 sts. Trbp Cluster around post of next st. 1 dc in next st. Trbp Cluster around post of next st. 1 dc in each of next 6 sts. (Trbp around post of next st. 1 dc in next st) twice. Ch 3. Turn.
7th row: Miss first st. (Trfp around post of next st. 1 dc in next st) twice. 1 dc in each of next 6 sts. Trfp Cluster around post of next st. 1 dc in each of next 7 sts. (Trfp around post of next st. 1 dc in next st) twice. Ch 3. Turn.
8th row: As 6th row.
9th row: As 5th row.
10th row: As 4th row.
11th row: As 3rd row.
12th row: As 2nd row.
These 12 rows form pat.
Cont in pat until panel measures approx 54 ins [137 cm] ending on a 12th row of pat and omitting turning ch at end of last row. Fasten off.
Panel B (make 4)
With MC, ch 21.
Foundation row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. 19 sts. Ch 3. Turn.
1st row: Miss first st. 1 dc in next st. Trfp around each of next 6 sts. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Trfp around each of next 6 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Ch 3. Turn.
2nd row: Miss first st. 1 dc in next st. Trbp around each of next 6 sts. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Trbp around each of next 6 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Ch 3. Turn.
3rd row: Miss first st. 1 dc in next st. Miss next 3 sts. Trfp around each of next 3 sts. Working behind last 3 trfp, trfp in each of 3 missed sts – trfp cable made. 1 dc in next st. 5 dc in next st. Drop loop from hook. Reinsert hook in first of 5 dc and draw dropped loop through - bobble made. 1 dc in next st. Trfp cable over next 6 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Ch 3. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
These 4 rows form pat.
Cont in pat until panel measures approx 54 ins [137 cm] ending on a 4th row of pat and omitting turning ch at end of last row. Fasten off.
Sew panels tog in the following sequence: B, A, B, A, B, A, B.
Edging: 1st rnd: With RS of Afghan facing, join MC with sl st in any corner. Work 1 round sc evenly around outer edge, working 3 sc in corner. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. *Bobble in next st. 1 dc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around, working 3 dc in corners. Join MC with sl st to top of ch 3. Break A.
3rd rnd: With MC, work 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 sc in each sc around for reverse sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
PILLOW
FRONT
Panel A (make 1)
Work as given for Afghan until 2 pat reps are complete. Omit turning ch at end of last row. Fasten off.
Panel B (make 2)
Work as given for Afghan until 6 pat reps are complete. Omit turning ch at end of last row. Fasten off.
Sew panels tog in the following sequence: B, A, B.
Top Edging: 1st row: With RS of work facing and MC work 60 sc across top of Pillow Front. Ch 3. Turn.
2nd row: Miss first st. 1 dc in next st and each st to end of row. Ch 1. Turn.
3rd row: 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. *Ch 2. Miss next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. Rep from * 3 times more. Ch 2. Miss next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 3 sts. Ch 3. Turn. (5 buttonholes)
4th row: Miss first st. 1 dc in each st and 2 dc in each ch 2 sp across. Ch 1. Turn.
5th row: 1 sc in each st to end of row.
Edging: Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 sc in each sc around for reverse sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
BACK
With MC, ch 61.
Foundation row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Ch 3. Turn. 60 sts.
1st row: Miss first st. 1 dc in next st and each st to end of row. Ch 1. Turn.
2nd row: 1 sc in each st to end of row. Ch 3. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 18½ ins [47 cm] ending on a 2nd row and omitting turning ch at end of last row. Fasten off. Place markers on side edges of Pillow Back 2½ ins [6 cm] down from final row.
Finishing: Fold Pillow Back at markers (button placket). Sew sides and lower edge of Front and Back tog. Sew buttons onto Back button placket to correspond to buttonholes. Insert pillow form. Close buttons.
Reverse Sc

materials: Red Heart® Baby TLC™:  5 (6) balls 5011 White.
Crochet Hooks: 4mm [US G-6] and 5mm [US H-8] for garments, and 5.5mm [US I-9] for blanket.
1 yd, ¼” wide white ribbon, four ⅜” buttons (for garments), yarn needle.
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Blanket measures 34” x 34”. To Fit: 17 (18)”; Finished Chest: 19 (20)”; Finished Length: 22½ (24)”
gauge: 17 sts = 4”; 24 rows = 4” in single crochet with smallest hook; 2 (ch 3, 3 dc, sc) pattern repeats = 3”; 6 rows = 2¼” in lace pattern with middle-sized hook; 14 sts = 4”; 7 rounds = 4” with 2 strands held together and largest hook (for blanket). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hooks to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
GOWN BODICE
With smallest hook, ch 82 (86).
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—81 (85) sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Divide for Backs and Front
First Half of Back
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, sc in first 17 (18) sc, turn; leave remaining sts unworked for armholes, front and second half of back—17 (18) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across, turn—16 (17) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—15 (16) sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat last row until piece measures 4” from beginning, end with a Wrong Side row.
Shape Shoulder
Next Row (Right Side): Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, turn; leave remaining sts unworked—5 sc.
Next 2 Rows: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off.

FRONT
Row 1 (Wrong Side): With Wrong Side facing, skip next 6 unworked sc (for armhole) following first half of back, join yarn with sc in next st, sc in next 34 (36) sc, turn; leave remaining sts unworked for second armhole and half of back—35 (37) sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—31 (33) sc at the end of Row 3.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat last row until front measures 3” from beginning, end with a Wrong Side row.
Divide for Neck
First Shoulder
Next Row (Right Side): Ch 1, sc in first 10 (11) sc for first shoulder, turn; leave remaining sts unworked for neck and second shoulder—10 (11) sc.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across, turn—9 (10) sc.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—8 (9) sc.
Repeat last 2 rows until 5 sc remain.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat last row until piece measures same as back.
Fasten off.

Second Shoulder
Next Row (Right Side): Skip next 11 unworked sc following first shoulder (for neck), join yarn with sc in next sc, sc in each remaining sc across—10 (11) sc.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—9 (10) sc.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across, turn—9 (10) sc.
Repeat last 2 rows until 5 sc remain.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat last row until piece measures same as back.
Fasten off.

Second Half of Back
Row 1 (Wrong Side): With Wrong Side facing, skip next 6 unworked sc (for armhole) following front, join yarn with sc in next sc, sc in each remaining sc across, turn—17 (18) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—16 (17) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across, turn—15 (16) sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat last row until piece measures 4” from beginning, end with a Wrong Side row. Fasten off.

Shape Shoulder
Next Row (Right Side): With Right Side facing, skip first 10 (11) sc, join yarn with sc in next sc, sc in each remaining sc across, turn—5 sc.
Next 2 Rows: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off.

Sew shoulder seams.

SKIRT
Row 1 (Wrong Side): With Wrong Side facing and smallest hook, working across opposite side of bodice foundation ch, join yarn with sc in first ch, sc in each ch across, turn—81 (85) sc.
Row 2: Ch 3, 3 dc in first sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc, [ch 3, 3 dc in next sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc] 11 times, [ch 3, 3 dc in next sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc] 0 (1) time(s), turn—23 (24) 3-dc groups.
Change to middle-sized hook.
Rows 3–5: Ch 3, 3 dc in first sc, sc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, 3 dc in next sc, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across, turn.

Work now proceeds in rounds.
Round 6 (Right Side): Ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in first sc, sc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, 3 dc in next sc, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across, ch 3; join piece into a round by working a slip st in top of first ch-3, turn.
Round 7: Ch 1, *sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc, turn.
Round 8: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in same sc as join, sc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, 3 dc in next sc, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in top of first ch-3, turn.
Repeat last 2 rounds until skirt measures 18 (19½)” from bodice, end with a Wrong Side row.

Edging Round (Right Side): Ch 3, 4 dc in same sc as join, sc in next ch-3 space, *5 dc in next sc, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of first ch-3. Fasten off.

SLEEVES (make 2)
Beginning at top of sleeve, with middle-sized hook, ch 12.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, [ch 3, 3 dc in next ch, sc in next ch] 5 times, turn—Five 3-dc groups.
Row 2: Ch 4, 3 dc in first sc, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc] 5 times, tr in same sc as last 3 dc, turn—6 groups.
Row 3: Ch 4, 3 dc in space between tr and next dc, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc] 5 times, (sc, ch 3, 3 dc, tr) in last ch-4 space, turn—7 groups.
Row 4: Ch 4, 3 dc between tr and next dc, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc] 6 times, (sc, ch 3, 3 dc, tr) in last ch-4 space, turn—8 groups.
Row 5: Ch 3, 3 dc between tr and next dc, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc] 7 times, (sc, ch 3, 3 dc, tr) in last ch-4 space, turn—9 groups.
Row 6: Ch 3, 3 dc between tr and next dc, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc] 8 times, sc in last ch-3 space, turn—9 groups.
Rows 7 and 8: Ch 3, 3 dc in first sc, sc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, 3 dc in next sc, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across, turn.
Row 9: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 3 dc in first sc, [2 sc in next ch-3 space, 3 dc in next sc] 8 times, sc in top of first ch-3, turn—45 sts.

Cuff
Change to smallest hook.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc in first st, *skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * across, turn—23 sc.
Rows 11–13: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew side edges of cuff together (only sew the cuff seam). Place seam of one sleeve at center of underarm of bodice, and sew sleeve in place, easing cap to fit. Repeat to sew in other sleeve.

Buttonband
Row 1: With Right Side facing and smallest hook, join yarn with sc to work across right edge of back opening, sc evenly spaced across right back edge, turn.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Fasten off.

Buttonhole band
Row 1: With Right Side facing and smallest hook, join yarn with sc to work across left edge of back opening, sc evenly spaced across left back edge, turn. Place 4 markers evenly spaced across Row 1, for buttonhole placement. Place first marker near top of back opening, next marker near bottom of back opening and remaining 2 markers evenly spaced between the first two.
Row 2 (buttonhole): Ch 1, [sc in each sc to next marker, ch 2, skip marked sc] 4 times, sc in each remaining sc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, [sc in each sc to one sc before next ch-2 space, skip sc before ch-2 space, 2 sc in ch-2 space] 4 times, sc in each remaining sc across. Fasten off.

Neck Edging
Row 1: With Right Side facing, join yarn with sc at beginning of neck edge, sc evenly spaced across neck edge. Fasten off.

Overlap buttonhole band over button band and sew bottom of bands together and to lower edge of back opening. Weave in ends. Sew buttons opposite buttonholes.

BONNET
With middle-sized hook, ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 17 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—18 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each dc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, 3 dc in same st as join, skip next dc, sc in next dc, *ch 3, skip next dc, 3 dc in next dc, skip next dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * across to last dc, turn; leave last dc unworked, do not join—Nine 3-dc groups.
Row 4: Ch 3, 3 dc in first sc, sc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, 3 dc in next sc, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across, turn.
Repeat last row until piece measures 6 (6½)” from center of ring, end with a Wrong Side row.
Next Row: Ch 3, 4 dc in first sc, sc in next ch-3 space, *5 dc in next sc, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across; rotate piece to work across side edges (for neckband), ch 1, sc in end of each row down side edge, sc in unworked dc of Round 2, sc in end of each row up other side edge, turn.
Next 2 Rows: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in ends. Sew ½ yd of ribbon to each front corner of bonnet, for ties.

BLANKET
With 2 strands held together and largest hook, ch 5; join with slip st to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 2 dc in ring, [ch 2, 3 dc in ring] 3 times ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, turn—Four 3-dc groups.
Round 2 (Wrong Side): Ch 3, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in first ch-2 space (corner made), [dc in each dc to next ch-2 space, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in ch-2 space (corner made)] 3 times, dc in next 2 dc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, turn—7 dc across each side.
Rounds 3–14: Ch 3, [dc in each dc to next corner ch-2 space, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in ch-2 space] 4 times, dc in each dc to end of round; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, turn—55 dc across each side at end of Round 14.
Begin Lace
Round 15: Ch 1, skip ch-3 of join, *sc in next dc, ch 3, skip next 2 dc, 3 dc in next dc**, skip next 2 dc; repeat from * to next corner ch-2 space, ending last repeat at **, (sc, [ch 3, sc] twice) in corner ch-2 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next dc, skip next 2 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first sc, turn—48 ch-3 spaces.
Round 16: Ch 3, 2 dc in same sc as join, *sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3 **, 3 dc in next sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, turn.
Round 17: Ch 1, *sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc, turn.
Round 18: Repeat Round 16.
Round 19: Ch 1, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc] 6 times, *(sc, [ch 3, sc] twice) in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc] 11 times; repeat from * around, working sts in last brackets 5 times instead of 11 times; join with slip st in first sc, turn—56 ch-3 sps.
Rounds 20–22: Repeat Rounds 16 and 17, then repeat Round 16 once more.
Round 23: Ch 1, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc] 7 times, *(sc, [ch 3, sc] twice) in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc] 13 times; repeat from * around, working sts in last brackets 6 times instead of 13 times; join with slip st in first sc, turn—64 ch-3 sps.
Rounds 24-26: Repeat Rounds 20-22.
Round 27: Ch 1, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc] 8 times, *(sc, [ch 3, sc] twice) in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc] 15 times; repeat from * around, working sts in last brackets 7 times instead of 15 times; join with slip st in first sc, turn—72 ch-3 sps.
Rounds 28-30: Repeat Rounds 20–22.
Round 31: Ch 1, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc] 9 times, *(sc, [ch 3, sc] twice) in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next sc] 17 times; repeat from * around, working sts in last brackets 8 times instead of 17 times; join with slip st in first sc, turn—80 ch-3 sps.
Rounds 32-24: Repeat Rounds 20–22.
Round 35: Ch 1, *sc in next ch-3 space, 5 dc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Red Heart® Baby TLC™, Art 258 available in solid color 5 oz (141g), 258 yd (328m) and Multicolor 4 oz (113g), 242 yd (222m) balls.

materials: Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Blanket: Approx 32" [81 cm] wide x 38" [96.5 cm] long.
gauge: 16 sts and 10½ rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Pullover
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ).
FRONT
With A, ch 38 (41-44-47).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. 37 (40-43-46) sc. Turn.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 9 (10-11-11) sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * twice more. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. JoinMC.Turn. 40 (43-46-49) sts.
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: With MC, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc across. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc across. Join A.Turn.
3rd row: With A, ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in first sc. *Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. *1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. 1 sc in last ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in last sc. Join MC. Turn.
5th row: With MC, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next sc. *2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to turning ch 3. 2 dc in top of turning ch.
Turn.
These 2nd to 5th rows form pat.
Work a further 5 (9-9-13) rows in pat, ending on 2nd row of pat. Fasten off.
Shape armholes: Next row: (RS). Miss first 3 sc. Join A with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in same sc. *Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem 3 sc unworked.
Cont even in pat on rem 34 ( 37-40-43) sts for 3 (7-7-11) more rows, ending on 2nd row of pat.
Shape neck: Left Side: 1st row: (RS). With A, ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in first sc. *Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next sc. Rep from * 1 (1-2-2) time(s) more.Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 dc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. *Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. 1 sc in last ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in last sc. Join MC. Turn.
3rd row: With MC, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next sc. *2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * 0 (0-1-1) time more. 1 dc in next ch-3 sp. Yoh and draw up a loop in same sp. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw up a loop in next sc. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw up a loop in top of ch 3. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook – dc3tog made. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc across. Join A. Turn.
5th row: With A, ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in first sc. [Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next sc] 0 (0-1-1) time. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 dc in next sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. (Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp) 1 (1-2-2) time(s). 1 hdc in last sc. Join MC. Turn.
7th row: With MC, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next sc. (2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next sc) 1 (1-2-2) time(s). Turn. 5 (5-8-8) sts.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc across. Fasten off.
Right Side: 1st row: With RS facing, miss center 8 (11-8-11) sc. Join A with sl st to next sc. Ch 3. *Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next sc. Rep from * 2 (2-3-3) times more.Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. *1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Rep from * 1 (1-2-2) time(s) more. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in last ch-3 sp. Join MC. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. Yoh and draw up a loop next sc. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw up a loop in next ch-2 sp. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – dc2tog made. *1 dc in next sc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * 1 (1-2-2) time(s) more. 2 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Join A. Turn.
5th row: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in first sc. [Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next sc] 1 (1-2-2) time(s). Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 3. (1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3) 1 (1-2-2) time(s). 1 sc in last ch-3 sp. Join MC. Turn.
7th row: With MC, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next sc. (2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next sc) 1 (1-2-2) time(s). Turn. 5 (5-8-8) sts.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc across. Fasten off.
BACK
Work from ** to ** as given for Front.
Cont even in pat on rem 34 (37-40-43) sts until armhole measures same length as Front, ending on a 2nd row of pat. Fasten off.
SLEEVES
With A, ch 25 (28-31-34).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. 24 (27-30-33) sts. Turn.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 11 (13-14-16) sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join MC. Turn. 25 (28-31-34) sts.
Work from *** to *** as given for Front.
Shape sides: 1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each dc across to last dc. 2 sc in last dc. Join A. Turn.
2nd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next sc. *Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 5 (counts as hdc and ch 2). *1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. 1 sc in last ch-3 sp. Ch 2. Miss next sc. 1 hdc in last sc. Join MC. Turn.
4th row: With MC, ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next sc. *2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to turning ch. 3 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
5th row: As 1st row.
6th row: With A, ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in first sc. Miss next sc. *(1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next sc. Miss next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 5 (counts as hdc and ch 2). *1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. 1 sc in last ch-3 sp. Ch 2. 1 hdc in last sc. Join MC. Turn.
8th row: With MC, as 4th row. Rep 1st to 4th rows once more.
Sizes 12 mos, 18 mos and 2 yrs only: Rep 5th to 8th rows once.
Size 2 yrs only: Rep 1st to 4th rows once more.
All sizes: 35 (48-51-60) sts.
Cont even in pat until Sleeve from beg measures 7½ (8½-10-11) [19 (21.5-25.5-28) cm]. Fasten off. Place markers on side edges of sleeves ¾" [2 cm] down from final row.
POCKET
With MC, ch 33 (33-36-36).
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch across. 31 (31-34-34) sts. Turn.
Beg with 2nd row, work 5 rows even in pat as given for Front.
Shape sides: 1st row: (RS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 2. *Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 sc in first ch-2 sp. *Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from *, ending with 1 sc in last ch-3 sp. Ch 2. Miss next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in last sc. Join MC. Turn.
3rd row: With MC, ch 3. 1 dc in next ch-2 sp counts as dc2tog). *1 dc in next sc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next ch-3 sp. Yoh and draw up a loop in same sp. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw up a loop in last sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – dc2tog made. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Join A. Turn.
5th row: With A, ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in first sc. *Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 2. 1 sc in first ch-3 sp. *Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. Ch 2.Miss last ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in last sc. Turn.
7th to 10th rows: As 3rd to 6th rows.
11th row: As 3rd row.
12th row: As 4th row.
Fasten off. 16 (16-19-19) sts.
FINISHING
Sew shoulder seams.
Neck edge: With RS facing, join A with sl st to left shoulder seam. Ch 1.Work 60 (63-63-68) sc evenly around neck edge. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Next rnd: Work 1 reverse sc (from Left to Right) in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.
Sew in sleeves placing rows above markers along unworked sts of Front and Back to form square armholes. Sew side and sleeve seams. Sew pocket to Front as shown in picture.
Blanket
Note: Blanket is worked lengthwise.
With MC, ch 150.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch across. 148 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc across. Join A.Turn.
3rd row: With A, ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in first sc. *Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. *1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. 1 sc in last ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in last sc. Join MC. Turn.
5th row: With MC, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next sc. *2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to turning ch 3. 2 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
Rep rows 2 to 5 for pat until work from beg measures approx 31" [79 cm], ending on a 2nd row of pat. Fasten off.
Top Edging: 1st row: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to top right corner of Blanket. Ch 1.Work 1 row of sc evenly across top edge to opposite corner. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc across. Fasten off.
Bottom Edging: Work as for Top edging, joining MC in bottom left corner.
Outer Edging: With RS facing, join A with sl st to bottom right corner of Blanket. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in same sp. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in side of next sc of Bottom edging. *(1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next rem loop of foundation ch. Miss next 2 loops. Rep from * across the side ending with: (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in last loop. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in side of next dc of Top edging. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in top of same dc. Miss next 2 sts. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next st. Rep from ** to ** to next corner dc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next corner dc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in side of same dc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in next st of side. Rep from ** to **, ending with (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in last st. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in side of next dc of Bottom edging. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in top of same dc. Rep from ** to ** across Bottom edging, ending with (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 dc) all in last st. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
